meaning: Expressing invocation, surprise, or admiration; (also) used to gain attention.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Have you seen the mural downtown? It's unlike anything I've ever come across.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, I walked by it yesterday—the colors are so bold!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I keep noticing new details every time I look at it. There’s so much going on in each section.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The way the scenes blend into each other is impressive. The artist must have spent ages on it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: A, I just can't help admiring how it brightens up the whole street.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It really brings the community together. Makes you want to stop and take it all in.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should come over, I have something amazing to show you.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: You're making me curious! What is it?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I was cleaning my closet and found something from high school.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Seriously? Now I have to know what it is.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: A, check this out! My high school yearbook—look at all these old photos.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: No way, that's awesome! We have to look through it together.

meaning: Representing the sound of a sneeze.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That breeze is carrying all kinds of stuff today—my eyes won't stop watering.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. I feel a sneeze lurking every other second.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hang on, I've got some tissues if you need one.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Achoo! Whoa, excuse me—guess that one couldn't wait.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Bless you! That came out with some force.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Thanks! Maybe fresh air isn't always a good idea for me.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe the puddles I had to dodge just to get here—my shoes are basically swimming pools.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounds like an adventure and a half. Are you sure you're alright? Your nose is looking kind of pink.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s this weird combo of cold rain and muggy air, I think. I’m just a bit sniffly, nothing major.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The city’s got every kind of weather right now. Let me know if you need tissues—I’ve got a never-ending stash.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You might be onto something with those tissues… oh, hang on—

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Achoo! Whoa, excuse you! See, I told you those tissues would come in handy.

meaning: Representing the sound of a sneeze.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This place is practically a dust factory today—my eyes are starting to itch.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. I can feel my nose tingling already.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If you sneeze, try not to blow away all the papers this time!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Atishoo! Wow, sorry—didn’t mean to send your notes flying.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Bravo, that was impressive! Need a tissue or should I just start taping things down?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: A tissue would be great, thanks—and maybe some paperweights for backup!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This room seriously needs a deep clean; my eyes are watering just looking at all this dust.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Right? It's getting to me too—atishoo! Whoa, that one snuck up on me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Bless you! Should I grab the vacuum before we get buried in tissues?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds like a rescue mission. Pass me the duster and I’ll join the battle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Deal. With teamwork, we might just win against these dust bunnies.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If we survive this, I’m voting for weekly cleaning from now on.

meaning: Representing the sound of a sneeze.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Atichoo! Oh wow, I didn’t expect that to hit me so suddenly.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Whoa, that sounded intense! Are you feeling okay there?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think so. These sneezes always catch me off guard in this dusty old library.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I’ve got some tissues if you want—my bag is basically a portable pharmacy.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You’re a lifesaver! If the next book sets off an avalanche of dust, you’ll know why I’m hiding behind a tissue wall.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Deal! I’ll keep watch while you brave the shelves.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Atichoo! Wow, that was louder than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Whoa, that sneeze nearly startled me off my chair!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Sorry about that—these old books are full of dust.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Maybe the library’s ventilation is on break today.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I wouldn’t be surprised. I can practically see the dust dancing in the sunlight.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Next time, we’re studying in the café with a breeze and fewer sneezing attacks!

meaning: An exclamation representing a slight cough or clearing of the throat, used (a) to attract attention, esp. prior to speaking (b) to express hesitation, (mock) disapproval, embarrassment, suggestiveness, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Ahem, I know you’re deep into those reports, but can I steal your attention for a moment?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Caught me in the act, Ethan. What’s so pressing?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, the client just bumped up the deadline, so we’re looking at some late nights this week.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Late nights? My poor coffee stash is about to take a hit.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If it helps, we could at least order something better than the cafeteria snacks this time.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Deal. If you’re in, I’m rolling up my sleeves—bring on the fancy takeout.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Looks like we drew the short straw for the early slot at the conference tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Not our luckiest day! Should we run through our opening one more time tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Ahem, actually, would you mind kicking things off instead? I may have accidentally promised my niece I'd record her school play later and I’m not sure I can make the very start.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s a twist! Family definitely wins points. Don’t worry, I can handle the first segment.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thank you! I’ll jump in as soon as I can—just need to slip out briefly, then I’ll be there.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No problem. I’ll keep things rolling until you arrive—your secret’s safe with me.

meaning: An exclamation of surprise, regret, pain, etc., often used in imitation of foreign speakers of English.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That was such a loud crash outside. Did you hear it?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Yeah, it sounded like something heavy fell over.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Should we check it out, or do you think it's nothing?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let's at least peek out the window, just to be safe.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, but you go first! I don't want to get a scare.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Ai! There’s a raccoon rummaging through the trash cans!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ai, I just spilled coffee all over my white shirt right before the meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh no, that’s the worst timing. Do you have a spare shirt at work?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Nope, not today. I was in too much of a rush this morning to pack one.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe you can borrow one from someone in the office, or wear your jacket the whole time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’ll try the jacket trick, but I hope nobody notices the coffee smell.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed for you! Let me know if you need backup during the meeting.

meaning: Awailing exclamation of resignation, surprise, regret, alarm, etc.; sometimes imitative of non-British speakers of English.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should've seen the look on Professor Carter’s face when I dropped my water bottle in the middle of his lecture.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That sounds brutal. Did everyone turn and stare, or was it one of those moments where you could just sneak it past?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Aie, the entire hall went quiet, and my bottle did that dramatic roll all the way to the front. I wanted to melt into my seat.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Classic. If it makes you feel better, at least you didn't set off the fire alarm today.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I guess causing a minor scene is better than campus evacuation, but still—could've done without the spotlight.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Stay hydrated, but maybe next time, try a bottle that doesn’t double as a rolling pin.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The office feels twice as empty when I’m the last one out, you know?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. Did you double-check your stuff before you leave?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Wait a sec—aie, my access badge is still on my desk!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That badge is seriously trying to make you pull overtime, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Apparently it doesn’t want to go home as much as I do.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Well, let’s rescue it together. I’ll grab the lights while you get your runaway badge.

meaning: A cry of sorrow or lamentation.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can't believe what happened at the park this morning—my heart just dropped when I saw it.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: What did you see? You look really shaken up.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There was a little boy sitting on the bench, clutching a broken kite and just whispering, 'alew… alew…' over and over. It was all so haunting.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Oh, Emily, that sounds awful. I wish we could have done something for him.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It just lingered—you know those moments that make the whole world feel heavy?

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Yeah, those always stay with you. Maybe next time we can help, even if it's just a small gesture.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: There's an emptiness when I pass by Jenny's house now. It's like the neighborhood lost a bit of its heart.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Alew, every time I walk past her garden, the silence just echoes. We used to laugh together on those warm evenings—now it feels so hollow.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I miss her stories and the way she always had lemonade ready for us. It's oddly quiet without her kind presence.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Sometimes I catch myself thinking she’ll wave from her porch like she used to. It doesn’t feel real that she’s not there anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Maybe we could plant some sunflowers by her fence, just the way she liked. It might bring a little brightness back.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: I’d like that, Emma. It’s a gentle way to carry her memory forward.

meaning: Representing the bark of a (small) dog, or a human imitation of such a bark.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Last night, I swear there was something making weird noises by the porch.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Seriously? Was it loud or more like a squeak?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Definitely not loud—it was kind of sudden, though, and kept stopping and starting.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Sounds suspiciously like the neighbor’s terrier trying to guard his turf again.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Actually, it sounded just like this: arf arf! Over and over, right under the window.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Classic move—he acts tough but those tiny barks always make me laugh!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Would you look at that little fellow near the fountain! He’s barely bigger than my shoe.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: He’s got that bouncy walk—like he owns the park or something.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: His tail hasn’t stopped wagging since he got here. Overachiever of the dog world, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Did you catch his bark earlier? I swear he’s trying to sound fiercer than he looks.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Arf! Arf! There, that’s my best impression—did I nail the tiny but mighty vibe?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Honestly, you could lead the next neighborhood pup parade with skills like that.

meaning: Expressing pain or fright; (also) expressing anguish, disappointment, or frustration.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You look deep in spreadsheet land—are the numbers behaving yet?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Not really. This total keeps coming out way off. I've tried three different formulas already.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Spreadsheet formulas have a mind of their own sometimes. Can I see what you're working with?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Sure, check out this column. Every time I sum it, the answer doubles for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hmm, maybe you have hidden rows or duplicate values. Try using the filter to check for extras.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let me... oh, now I've lost the whole column—argh, how did that even happen so fast?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess what? I tried assembling that bookshelf from IKEA all by myself this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Brave move! Did you manage to finish it without any extra screws left over?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Not exactly. Things didn't go according to plan.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Uh oh, what went wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Argh, I put the shelves in upside down and when I tried to fix it, I dropped the whole thing on my toe!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That sounds painfully familiar. Let me know if you need another set of hands next time!

meaning: An exclamation usually expressing mild remonstrance, entreaty, commiseration, disgust, or disapproval.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My stomach is basically writing angry emails right now; what should we eat?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Taco Palace is just across the street. Their burritos are legendary today.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Aw, don't make me go back there—I still haven't forgiven that salsa for last time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, point taken. Maybe the Thai spot next to the bookstore?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Now you’re speaking my language! Extra peanuts, please.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Prepare yourself for spice-induced bliss.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: My day just keeps getting better—guess who managed to step right in a puddle on the way to work?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously? That’s just bad luck. Did it soak through your shoes?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Yep, socks and all. I had to sit in damp shoes for an hour.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounds miserable. Please tell me you had a spare pair with you.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No backup, and of course today was the day of that big client meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Aw, talk about the worst timing! That really shouldn't have happened to you today.

meaning: Suggesting something happening suddenly, emphatically, or easily and predictably.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Still stuck on that old coffee machine, Mark?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's like it has a new trick every morning. I never get it right the first time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Try this: flip the switch, hit start, bada-bing, you're brewing coffee in seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Huh, that actually sounds simple. I’ll give it a go!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Let me know if it works. If not, I’ll come to the rescue.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Hopefully I won’t need a hero for my morning caffeine tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: I was stressing over that jammed printer, but I gave the tray a gentle tap and—bada-bing—the pages shot right out like it was never stuck.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: No way, that's all it took? I've spent ages fiddling with those before.

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: Sometimes it just needs a little encouragement, not a full-on troubleshooting session.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I guess I've been doing it the hard way all along.

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: If you ever hear it make that odd clicking sound again, give it a try.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Noted! Next time, I'll go for the gentle approach first.

meaning: An interjection imitating the sound of a hard blow.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’re really keeping that ice pack busy today—rough afternoon?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, the bookshelf decided to fight back when I was rearranging things.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let me guess—one wrong move and it all went south?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Exactly! I reached for the top shelf, lost my balance, and bam—the whole stack toppled onto my shoulder.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Books can be brutal. Glad you survived the literary landslide.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m wearing armor when I tidy up. Lesson learned!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what happened in the kitchen this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let me guess—something slipped off the counter and, bam! Everything went crashing down?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Exactly! The glass bowl hit the floor and shattered everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh no, that must’ve been a nightmare to clean up.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You have no idea. I’m still finding little pieces under the fridge.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Sounds like your morning started with a real adventure.

meaning: Commotion or uproar; a disturbance; a loud argument.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: You look like you just walked out of a tornado, Ben. Did something wild go down?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: The office was a madhouse today—a total bangarang broke out after someone sent the wrong numbers to the client. Voices were bouncing off the walls.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: That sounds exhausting. Did anyone manage to get a handle on things or is it still a mess?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: HR tried to calm everyone down, but tensions were still running high when I left.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Let’s hit pause on all that drama. How about we focus on muffins and lattes instead?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Best idea I’ve heard all day. Lead the way to caffeine salvation!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Did you catch all that noise by the bakery just now? It rattled my window.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No way, I missed it completely. Was it serious?

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Serious enough that Mrs. Clarke came running out with her broom. I thought someone was setting off fireworks.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was a full-on bangarang—shouting, slamming doors, the whole block got involved in seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: That explains the flash of blue lights. I hope nobody got hurt in the middle of that mess.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Same here. I swear, there's never a dull moment on this street.

meaning: To bark, as a dog.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I just got back from the park and let me tell you, Rusty really put on a show today.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh no, did he chase after another jogger with those little legs of his?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Not this time! But you wouldn't believe what happened when he spotted a kite flying low.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let me guess, he tried to become a flying dog?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly! He sprinted in circles, stopped, and then suddenly started going baugh! baugh! so loud, the kid with the kite paused just to watch.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds like Rusty all right. Pretty soon he’ll be barking at clouds too!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That was a sharp sound—did you catch it just now?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: For sure! That came from over by the swings, pretty sure it's someone's dog.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He’s really making a scene. Must have spotted something exciting.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Maybe he's championing his territory or just greeting everyone who passes by.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you were that dog for ten seconds, what would you shout out to the park?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Easy! I'd throw my head up and go, 'Baugh, baugh!' for all my canine buddies to hear.

meaning: To bark, as a dog.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Something’s making a racket in the backyard again—sounds like another midnight adventure.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Is that Charlie? He’s got a nose for trouble, especially when the moon’s out.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Let’s have a peek and see what he’s all worked up about this time.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: There he is, by the gate. He’s staring at the bushes like he just saw a ghost.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Listen to him go—baw, baw! I’ll bet he caught wind of that possum again.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: With Charlie on patrol, I doubt any sneaky critters will stick around for long!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you see that? He just darted out from behind the bench like he owns the place.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: He’s got so much energy! I bet he’s looking for someone to toss a stick.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Or maybe he’s trying to recruit us into some secret dog mission.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If that’s the case, I hope the initiation involves treats.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Let’s see if he responds to this—baw, baw, baw!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Look at that! He’s actually perking his ears up at you now.

meaning: The barking of a dog.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My eyes feel like sandpaper today, I barely caught a wink.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Rough night? What kept you up this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: The folks next door adopted a puppy, and it wouldn't stop—baw-waw, baw-waw—right outside my window.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Yikes, that's the downside of cute new neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If this keeps up, I might start barking back myself.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Now that's a showdown I'd pay to see!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe what happened when I passed by the Wilsons’ house—right as I walked by, their little terrier burst out with a loud 'baw-waw, baw-waw!' nearly making me jump out of my skin.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: That must've been a surprise! Did you end up speeding up your pace or stop to check on him?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I slowed down for a second, just to make sure he wasn’t squeezing through the fence. He seemed proud of his performance.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think some dogs treat their gates like theater stages. My neighbor's beagle gives me a full show whenever I roll my bike past.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I swear, they all have unique routines. Sometimes it feels like they're competing for the neighborhood’s top entertainer award.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Well, they sure keep our mornings unpredictable. Next time, maybe I’ll join in with an encore clap.

meaning: The sound made by a horn on a motor car or other vehicle; a short high-pitched sound such as is emitted by an echo-sounder, a radar device, etc.
To sound (a horn); to make (something) emit a short high-pitched sound.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My feet hurt already and we just started walking—city life is ruthless.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! I almost feel like we deserve pizza after this.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Pizza sounds perfect, but we have to survive these crosswalks first.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Don't move yet, these drivers act like the lines are just suggestions.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that? One second I step off the curb—beep!—instant reminder to pay attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That's New York for you: always an adventure, usually loud!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: We should pick up the pace if we want to grab those muffins before the rush.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: No problem, the shortcut's just up ahead by the fruit stand.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa—did you hear that sudden 'beep'? That car came out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You almost stepped off the curb! These drivers are unpredictable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Guess my mind was on blueberry muffins and not the street.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Well, let’s keep our eyes open—those muffins will taste better if we actually make it there!

meaning: To bark in a thin voice, to yelp.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Would you look at that little bundle of fluff—Max practically fits in my palm!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: He’s an expert at squeezing into small spaces. Last night he curled up inside my slipper.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He must be a riot around the house. Has he tried to stand up to the vacuum yet?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Every single time! He puffs up and tries to make serious noise, but it always makes me laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I have to hear this. What’s his brave voice sound like?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Picture this fierce face, then all you hear is, 'bewh, bewh!' You can’t help but giggle.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So you finally brought Max home! I heard some funny noises coming from the hallway earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was him! He does this weird 'bewh bewh' every time the mail slot flaps. It's like an alarm system with tiny lungs.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That cracked me up! He sounds way too fierce for his size.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You should see him when he spots his reflection in the oven door—twice as loud.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Max is already keeping you on your toes, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Absolutely. I think I need earplugs just for the afternoon mail.

meaning: An exclamation uttered when something strikes an object, or a sound imitative of such a blow.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Remind me never to trust my sense of balance again. I really thought jumping over those recycling bins was a solid plan.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, you cleared one, but then—bif!—your knee went right into the second bin and sent bottles everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If only the Olympics had an event for creative chaos, I’d be on the podium.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: At least you gave everyone in the parking lot a good story for lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, I guess my athletic career will remain in the realm of comedy.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, your daring spirit is undefeated—and the recycling survived, mostly!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you just hear that? Bif! That sounded like it hit pretty hard against the garage door.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yeah, that made me jump! What do you think it was this time?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Probably Jamie’s basketball again—he’s always losing control of those layups.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: He really puts some power behind those shots, doesn’t he?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: We should check if there’s a dent before he gets in trouble.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Right behind you. Let’s hope it’s just a scuff mark this time!

meaning: An exclamation uttered when something strikes an object, or a sound imitative of such a blow.
To hit, strike.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: This shelf just doesn’t want to line up. Maybe I missed a screw somewhere?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hang on, let me nudge it—*biff*—yep, that’s snug now!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That sounded promising! The whole thing shifted into place.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You grab the next board and I’ll hold this one steady.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If this goes together as well as that last part did, we’ll be done in no time.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let’s keep this teamwork rolling!

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Biff! That screwdriver just slipped right out of my hand and smacked the cabinet.

dialogue.speaker: Connor
dialogue.text: That sounded dramatic! Anything broken, or just your pride?

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Only my pride, thankfully. This shelf is fighting back though.

dialogue.speaker: Connor
dialogue.text: Let me know if you need backup—I’ve wrestled with stubborn furniture before.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: You might have to tag in soon. This thing’s winning on points.

dialogue.speaker: Connor
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I've got my toolkit and a can-do attitude standing by.

meaning: A thump or blow.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: If we can just get this bookshelf past the hallway corner, I think the hardest part is over.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Steady... almost got it—whoa, bing! That corner came out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounded like it packed a punch! The bookshelf holding up okay?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Yeah, no dents—just a dramatic entrance. Maybe I’ll let you steer this time.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Deal. I'll try to avoid any more unplanned sound effects.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: At least we know it’s sturdy! Let’s inch it forward together this time.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: You won't believe what I tackled today—finally tried to mount that floating shelf in the living room.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: That’s bold! Did it work out, or is your wall a disaster zone now?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: I thought it was all going great. The instructions made it look so straightforward.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Let me guess—a plot twist involving a power drill or a crooked bracket?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Worse! The bracket was perfectly straight, but my measuring tape fell behind the radiator just as I needed it most.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Oof, that’s rough! The last time I tried DIY, my hammer slipped and—bing—right into the floorboard.

meaning: An exclamation made by someone winning a game of bingo.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Looks like the competition's heating up at our table! My card is filling up quickly.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You’re telling me! I just need one more in the G column. How many numbers are you waiting on?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Two left for me! Every time they call a number, my heart skips a beat.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Same here, especially with that last round. I thought for sure I had it, but no luck yet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait—I just got G-54! Bingo!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No way, Sophie! You did it! Drinks are on me for your big win tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: If G-48 is called next, I might finally have a full row.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And the number is... G-48! Bingo! I can't believe it!

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Seriously? I was so close! You always win these games.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: It’s pure luck, I promise. Sometimes you just get the right cards.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Well, next round I'm definitely getting there before you.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Let's see who wins the next one.

meaning: To move on with rotatory motion, as a rifle bullet.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That shot landed right in the bullseye, Samantha! Not bad at all.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: I've been tuning my grip lately. Seems like it's finally paying off.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I always wondered what really happens to the bullet after the trigger’s pulled.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Once it leaves the barrel, you can almost see it birl its way toward the target, slicing the air just right.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That's such a wild image—no wonder your shots look so smooth.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: A little twist in the right place really does the trick, every single time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Check out that spinning target at the end—think you can knock it down, Lily?

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: I’ve got a steady hand and a little luck on my side, so let’s see.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Take your time with the first shot; those things have a mind of their own.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: No kidding—last time I tried, I could almost see the pellet birl all the way to the end.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s some sharp eyesight. Maybe it’s your secret advantage.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Only one way to find out—here goes nothing!

meaning: To throw.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Check this out, Madison—I bet I can launch this apple core all the way over the creek.

dialogue.speaker: Madison
dialogue.text: No way! If you actually make it, I'll be seriously impressed.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing. You might want to stand back.

dialogue.speaker: Madison
dialogue.text: Do it! Give that thing a big old bish!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you see that? It actually cleared the water!

dialogue.speaker: Madison
dialogue.text: I owe you a snack, Ryan! That was legendary aim.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This stack of old mail is taking over my desk again. Can you grab some of it for me?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: No problem! Here goes—bish! Straight into the recycling.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Smooth move! Now the desk can finally breathe.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I could probably take on that pile of receipts if you’re feeling brave.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Receipts are next, for sure. I appreciate your heroic cleanup skills.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Anytime! Clearing clutter is my secret talent.

meaning: To deal a blow to, to slap heavily.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Whoa, your book bag looks like it’s seen better days. What happened?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Oh man, in the morning rush, I swung around too fast and blad—the whole bag crashed right into the table edge.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Yikes, did anything inside survive or is it all a lost cause?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: A couple of notebooks got crumpled, but I think my laptop’s alright. Could’ve been worse.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Well, at least you made it with most of your stuff intact! Maybe that bag deserves a day off.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It really does. If only bags could call in sick.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You should've seen it, Mark! Right as Tom went up for that layup, I leapt and my hand blad across the ball—echoed like a firecracker in the gym. Everyone’s face was priceless.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Man, that's intense! Did Tom just stand there in disbelief or try to play it cool?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: He tried to act tough, but you could tell he was half laughing, half shocked. Even the ref cracked a grin.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Classic Tom. That’s why I love these games—never know when something like that’ll shake things up.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously. Little moments like that keep everyone on their toes.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Next time I’m bringing earplugs if you’re going to keep making echoes like that!

meaning: Meaningless, insincere, or pretentious talk or writing; nonsense, bunkum. Also used as a derisive interjection.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Well, that's one more hour of my life I'm not getting back.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let me guess, another classic Monday meeting?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You know it. They somehow managed to talk a lot without saying much at all.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Any actionable items, or was it all just talk?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It was all 'synergy' this and 'optimize' that, blah, blah, blah. Nothing actually useful, as usual.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Sounds like corporate poetry in motion. I owe you a coffee for surviving that.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That meeting chewed up my whole afternoon for nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. My notes from the first half still look exactly like my notes from the last one.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: When they pulled out another slide deck, I almost zoned out completely.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Honestly, when they started talking about the 'synergy goals,' I couldn't keep a straight face.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: All I heard was blah layered on top of more blah—none of it actually applied to what we do day-to-day.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Right? If they want people to care, they might want to try saying something with actual meaning next time.

meaning: A dash or plash of liquid, as when rain appears to fall in sheets; a mixture of blow and splash.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Just my luck—wasn’t planning on reenacting a soggy adventure today.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I swear the clouds rolled in out of nowhere. Ten minutes ago it was sunny!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Let’s duck under that old bus stop over there before my backpack starts floating.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Good call—every time the wind shifts, there’s a loud blash right off the pavement!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: My socks have gone from dry to squishy in record time.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: At this rate, we might as well join the ducks in that puddle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Those clouds showed up out of nowhere—look at that sky!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. I just felt a chill, you know it’s coming.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: We’d better pick up the pace unless you want soggy sneakers.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Too late, I already felt a few big drops. My hair's a lost cause now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yikes, I can barely see through this stuff. It’s coming down harder every second.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Suddenly—blash!—the rain just exploded all over us. I feel like I jumped in a pool with my shoes on.

meaning: A bleating or shrill sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you just catch that odd noise coming from the field? I swear something out there is calling for attention.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it too! It definitely doesn't sound like the usual birds or crickets.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Let’s tiptoe closer; maybe we’ll finally spot what’s making all the fuss.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Whoa, look right by the fence! There’s a goat poking its head out.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Listen to it go—blat, blat! That little guy has some serious lungs on him.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I’m impressed! That goat could start a one-animal band with that voice.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that? Something just went 'blat–blat' out there and nearly made me jump out of my skin.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I heard it! That sounded vicious—was it one of those delivery scooter horns?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Could be, but honestly, it was so sharp I half expected to see clowns pour out of a tiny car.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Remember at that parade last year? There was a whole fleet of scooters with no chill about their horns.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Oh, right! Every five seconds, another burst—my ears never fully recovered.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s relocate to the back room before we get front-row seats to the next solo performance out there.

meaning: To bleat as a lamb or kid; to cry piteously as a child.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look over there by the picnic table—someone’s having a rough afternoon, huh?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah, that little boy looks like he’s on the verge of tears, clutching his juice box like it’s a lifeline.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Makes you want to scoop him up and reassure him that everything’s going to be okay.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: He’s letting out these tiny blea, blea sounds—my sister used to do that whenever she dropped her ice cream.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s practically irresistible not to go over and check if he needs a hand finding his family.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: All right, let’s go—maybe we can turn his afternoon around.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So much for my quiet afternoon—Ella just woke up and started making the saddest noises.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Uh oh, major toddler turbulence? What’s going on over there now?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, she’s got her face all scrunched up, sitting up in her crib and going, 'blea, blea'—you’d think someone took her favorite toy.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: That sound could melt even the toughest babysitter’s heart. Are you surviving?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Barely! I’m armed with juice and her stuffed rabbit, wish me luck.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: If that combo doesn’t work, nothing will. You’ve got this!

meaning: To protrude the tongue in mockery.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Saw you spacing out right in front of Mr. Howard—blear! Bet he noticed too.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh wow, call me out in front of everyone, why don't you?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Hey, you’re the one who started doodling rockets during algebra.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At least I’m not the one who almost fell out of his chair laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That was just gravity doing its thing after your sketches distracted me.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next math class, I’m bringing a shield in case the doodle police strike again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, Liam, that banana bread didn’t even make it to lunchtime. Hungry much?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Don’t judge—baking skills like yours shouldn’t go to waste waiting around!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you compliment me just to steal the last slice, you get the classic blear treatment!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Classic Sophie move. Just can’t handle sharing your secret recipe, can you?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe not, or maybe I just enjoy tormenting you after your snack attacks.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m hiding a loaf before you even see it—I’ve learned my lesson!

meaning: A thin, high-pitched blipping sound, spec. one made by electronic equipment.

dialogue.speaker: Nick
dialogue.text: That monitor’s acting up again—keeps flickering like it wants attention or something.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s tired of us pulling late nights in the lab. Did you save the new test data already?

dialogue.speaker: Nick
dialogue.text: Yeah, just exported the files. I hope we don’t lose any this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Same here. That backup drive is still plugged in, right?

dialogue.speaker: Nick
dialogue.text: Wait—there it goes again. That sharp little 'bleep' just popped from the corner—think it means the export finished.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Awesome, looks like our data’s safe for once! Mind if I double-check before we pack up?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: There it goes again—my tablet just made that odd bleep in the middle of the video.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That sound keeps making me jump. Is it from an app or something?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: I think it might be some notification popping up. Let me check the settings.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If we ever solve this, I’ll be very impressed. It’s been happening all week.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Apparently, the weather app loves to interrupt movie night. I’ll switch notifications off now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Perfect, now maybe we can actually finish a scene without any surprise sounds.

meaning: (A piece of) ostentatious jewellery. Hence: wealth; conspicuous consumption.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hold up, is that a new ring catching the sunlight or am I seeing things?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No, you’re not seeing things. I splurged a little over the weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It’s seriously dazzling—did you pick that up at the mall or somewhere special?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Actually, there’s this place on Main Street that just opened. Couldn’t resist checking it out.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Main Street’s getting all the cool shops lately; that ring really stands out.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Right? I walked in and just knew I needed a little more bling in my life.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: You should have seen Mark’s entrance at the gala—I swear, every head turned when he walked in.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: No kidding! Those rings and that watch? Full-on bling. I thought the chandelier had competition.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: He definitely has a talent for shining brighter than anyone else in the room.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: And he wears it all so confidently—like he was born with it.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Next time I need to dress to impress, I'm calling him for advice.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Same! If he ever decides to lend out that sparkle, sign me up first.

meaning: Any sudden brisk blow or twitch; a quick popping sound.
To strike with a brisk rap or tap.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: This porch is the best seat for summer nights—listen to how still everything is.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I know, right? Then out of nowhere, something just snapped over by the flowerpots.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Was it that little blip, almost like someone flicked a pebble off the wood?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yep, that’s the one! Made me sit up straight for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Maybe a firefly landed a little forcefully—those guys are everywhere tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Or a mischievous squirrel. Honestly, I never trust the quiet entirely.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: The cabinet’s jammed again. I swear it’s fighting back this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Oh! Did you just hear that blip? Something definitely moved when you yanked it.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yeah, I felt that shudder through the handle. That can't be normal.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Maybe whatever’s stuck in there just gave way. Want me to hold it steady while you try again?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Sure, but if it launches off this time, we're wearing helmets next attempt.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Deal. I’m ready for round two—bring it on, cabinet.

meaning: To burst into tears, weep violently; disfigure with tears.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You know, Mark, yesterday when everything hit you at once, it was like you just started to blirt right there on my couch.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was a mess. My eyes wouldn’t stop and I’m sure I soaked two of your cushions.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If those cushions could talk, they’d say you gave them a proper rain shower.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I guess I owe them (and you) some serious comfort food. Got any requests?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Homemade brownies would fix almost anything, just saying.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Deal. I’ll bring a whole tray, and next time, I promise not to leave a puddle behind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, I couldn't help but notice you've been clutching that mug for the last ten minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I tried so hard to keep it together at the office, but once I stepped through my apartment door, I just had to blirt. Still feel like my face hasn't recovered.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, that sounds intense. Do you want to talk about what set it off?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It was just everything piling on—deadlines, criticism, then missing my bus in the rain. One tiny thing tipped me over.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sometimes it really is that last little thing. I’m here, and there's no rush.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Thanks, Sophie. I actually feel lighter already just knowing you get it.

meaning: A sharp blow or knock; a shot.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: That last play had me on the edge of my seat—did you catch the way Tyler weaved through the defense?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: For sure! Right when it looked like he had an open lane, Marcus just closed the gap out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Then—blizzard! Marcus came in swinging, and the whole section behind me gasped.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No kidding, the sound echoed through the gym. Tyler barely stayed on his feet after that.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: He’s tough, but you could tell he needed a second to shake it off. That kind of play seriously changes the energy.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, moments like these are why I love coming to these games. Anything can happen!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen the crowd jump when Harris dodged that uppercut—pure adrenaline all around.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sounds wild! Did anything crazy go down after that?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just seconds later, Harris spun and landed an insane right hook out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must’ve hit with a blizzard—no wonder the crowd lost it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, the whole arena just froze for a second before erupting. That punch sealed it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Moments like that are why I never miss a fight night if I can help it.

meaning: A large irregular spot or patch of light, colour, or the like; a blot, smear, or stain.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That canvas is really starting to look like a sunset now, Tyler.

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Thanks! I’m trying to blend the oranges and reds, but this brush won’t cooperate.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe you could use your fingers in the thick parts, give it a little texture?

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Tempting… Alright, let’s see what happens if I add some yellow highlights up here.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, that paint just landed everywhere when you squeezed the tube!

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Yeah, now there’s a massive blodge right by the horizon. Maybe it’ll pass for a dramatic sunbeam?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you look at my sweater? I swear it was spotless this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh wow, what did you get into at lunch, paint or curry?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No idea—I only remember leaning back against something in the park.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Honestly, it’s got this giant blodge all over the sleeve. Kind of impressive, in an abstract art way.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Great, now I'm making fashion statements I didn’t sign up for.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe you’ll start a trend. Or at least distract everyone in the next meeting!

meaning: To make a howling noise; to operate a radio set in such a way that it emits such a noise.
A plopping sound; a howling sound.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Have you noticed the radio's been making more weird noises than usual tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, when I turned it on earlier, it was all static and I swear I heard a weird howl coming from it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just now, it made this loud bloop—like it was howling straight through the speakers!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That's exactly what I heard! I thought I was imagining things.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Nope, it's definitely in there. Maybe we need to adjust the frequency or something.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Good idea. Let's see if tuning it a little differently calms it down.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Would you listen to that? Every time I twist this knob, the radio starts to bloop—it’s like it’s alive and complaining at me.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sound is wild! Did it always do that, or is this something new?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I swear it used to behave. Maybe it’s just cranky today; this thing’s seen better years.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Old gadgets do have personality, don’t they? Careful or it’ll start playing ghostly tunes next.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If it starts, I’m blaming you for jinxing it. Let me try the antenna one more time...

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’re brave, Ethan. I’d run for the hills if that radio started doing anything else!

meaning: An inflamed eruption, or discoloured patch, on the skin; a pustule, boil, or botch.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’re fidgeting again—has that rash gotten any worse since yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I wish it hadn’t, but it definitely feels itchier now than it did before.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Did you try putting on any cream or just hoping it would go away?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I tried some aloe vera but it’s not making a dent. I think it might be spreading too.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let me see. Maybe it looks worse than it feels.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Here—right above my elbow, do you see that big red blotch? It wasn’t nearly this angry-looking this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at my arm for a second—doesn’t this look odd to you?

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Let me see... Hmm, did something bite you, or is it just irritated?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I woke up to this bright red blotch right on my forearm. It came out of nowhere and now it stings every time I touch it.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: That’s pretty intense. Have you tried putting anything on it, like some cooling cream?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Not yet—I’m worried it might react badly, so I’m just leaving it alone for now.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Probably a safe move. If it gets worse, maybe pop over to the clinic later today just in case.

meaning: The sudden breaking of a storm; a sudden downpour of rain, hail, etc., accompanied by wind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My umbrella might as well have stayed home—I swear it was all sunshine when I left this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! The sky flipped so fast, I barely had time to shut my windows.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I got trapped on Maple Avenue; could hardly see past the windshield in my car.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Right? That was a blout if I’ve ever seen one—branches thrashing, rain hammering the pavement, the works.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If I’d left five minutes later, I’d have needed a boat instead of a car.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Next time I’m checking the radar before trusting that blue sky, lesson learned!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen the sky earlier—one huge blout swept through just as I stepped off the bus. My shoes are still squelching.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: No way! That explains why my window rattled like crazy a bit ago.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I had to huddle under the coffee shop awning with three other people, all of us just staring at the sheets of rain.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Bet the barista was handing out extra napkins for everyone’s hair!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If only! The place was packed, and I nearly slipped when I finally made a dash for it.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Sounds like you survived a real adventure—next time, bring a kayak.

meaning: To swell out, become distended.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Would you look at that bread dough? It’s practically taking over the whole bowl now.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It’s wild, right? When I set it aside earlier, it barely covered the bottom.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s so fun to watch it bluff like that—pushing at the plastic wrap like it wants to escape.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I know! Every time I peek, it’s spread even more across the sides.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Baking days are the best. The kitchen feels alive.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let’s hope it turns out fluffy after all that action in the bowl!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that—my sourdough starter began to bluff right out of the jar this morning! I swear it looked like it was about to take over the whole kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No way! That must’ve been wild to see. Did it actually push the lid up?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It did! I left it on the counter overnight, and by breakfast, there was dough creeping everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That’s classic. Mine never gets that dramatic, but maybe I’m not feeding it enough.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s a little messy but kind of satisfying. Makes me feel like I’ve got a really lively starter, you know?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Totally! Next time, maybe I should tempt fate and let mine go wild too.

meaning: Rumbling, lumbering noise.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you feel that little tremor from upstairs just now?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was hard to miss. Almost like someone dropped a box up there.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Could it be the pipes acting up again? Or maybe something in the attic shifted?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Hmm, it’s late for the pipes. Unless a squirrel snuck inside and started exploring.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Listen—that blumbering noise is back! It’s rolling through the ceiling like a restless giant.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Alright, now I have to know what it is. Grab a flashlight and let’s investigate.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you just hear that noise coming from the basement?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was a blumbering sound, like something huge rolling around down there.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It made my picture frames shake on the wall!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, this old house always seems to have a surprise for us during storms.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Maybe we should check it out before it gets any louder.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, but you’re going first, just in case it’s the furnace acting up again!

meaning: To mix (clay, powdered flint, etc.) up with water.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That bucket looks heavier every time I see you lug it around the studio.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Tell me about it—my arms are getting a real workout just getting everything ready for throwing.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Is all that for a single batch, or are you prepping enough for the whole class?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It’s enough for a few of us, but it takes ages to make sure the consistency is right.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I imagine there’s a trick to getting rid of those stubborn dry spots.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Absolutely—if you don’t blunge long enough, the mix turns out lumpy and impossible to work with.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The studio smells amazing today—must be a batch of fresh clay in the back.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You caught me at the perfect time, I was just about to get things ready for the afternoon class.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Give me a sec, I need to blunge this before anyone arrives—nothing like a smooth start to hand-building.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That word always makes me think of some mystical potion ritual!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Honestly, the results are just as magical when the pieces come out of the kiln.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Can’t wait to see what everyone creates this afternoon—let the creative chaos begin!

meaning: To emit the breath eruptively from the mouth; to snort in sleep.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Room sharing is always an adventure—I barely got any sleep with all the tossing and turning last night.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: You should’ve heard yourself! Every so often you’d go 'blurt!' and I’d wonder if a sleepy walrus had wandered in.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You’re kidding! I had no idea I was making any noises at all.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Oh, it gave me quite the late-night show, trust me.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe next time I’ll try earplugs—if I manage to out-snore myself.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: No promises—I’m actually looking forward to the encore performance tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Last night, I kept hearing these funny noises from your side of the room.

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Oh, was that the blurt again? I never notice it unless someone tells me.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yeah! At first, I thought something fell off the shelf, but then I realized it was just you.

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Sorry about that. My sister says I’ve been doing that since I was a kid.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s honestly kind of endearing. Beats having a roommate who snores all night.

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Glad it’s not too annoying! I’ll try not to startle you next time.

meaning: To cry with a voice smothered with tears and sobs.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I saw your light was still on, so I figured you might need someone right now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s just been one of those days where everything hits at once.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You can let it out, you know. I’m not here to judge—just to listen.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, every time I try, it just gets stuck in my throat.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Even if you bluther, I’ll still be right here beside you. You don’t have to hold back.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thank you. I probably will, but it’s good not to have to do it alone.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You've barely touched your tea. Something's weighing on you, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It's just... today felt impossible, like everything went wrong one after another.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You don’t have to carry it all by yourself, you know. I’m here if you want to talk.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I appreciate that. I just—sometimes it all gets so overwhelming I can’t even find the words.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: And now, just trying to explain it, I’m starting to bluther again... I wish I could stop.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You don’t have to. Let it out. I’m not going anywhere.

meaning: To move up and down like a buoyant body in water, or an elastic body on land; hence, to dance; to move to and fro with a similar motion, esp. said of hanging things rebounding from objects lightly struck by them.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Did you go down to the pier today? The sunlight made the water sparkle like glass.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I did! There were a bunch of seagulls swooping around and fishermen chatting by the railings.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It’s always lively down there. The boats drifting by always catch my eye, especially when they change direction with the breeze.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And I noticed a cluster of lilies floating gently near the edge. It looked almost peaceful with everything so still.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I love that—sometimes I imagine what it would feel like to bob up and down on the water and let the world slow down for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That does sound relaxing. Next time, maybe we should rent a canoe and drift around together.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, Charlie, look at this—there’s a whole display of balloons over that bench.

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: Ha! They’re so colorful, it’s like a little parade above our heads.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If the wind picks up, they might actually start a parade down Main Street.

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: Oh, check out the big red one—looks like it’s bouncing more than the rest.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, every time a breeze comes through, it seems to bob higher than its neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: It’s almost hypnotic—I could watch them for hours.

meaning: A hearty laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The way you set off that boffo right in the middle of Claire’s magic trick—seriously, everyone dropped their cards and stared!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hey, what can I say? Cards flying everywhere and Claire wearing that sparkly top hat just caught me off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You made the whole show twice as memorable, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Claire’s still trying to figure out where her queen of hearts went!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Maybe your laugh scared it into hiding!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If it turns up in my bag, I’m blaming you for all future shenanigans.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You know, when we caught Ben attempting to juggle apples at the picnic, I let out such a boffo that even the squirrels looked scandalized.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously, that moment had me doubled over. Ben’s face was priceless—he looked like he just invented slapstick.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: And when the third apple rolled right into Mrs. Patel’s sandwich, I thought I was going to lose it all over again.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If only someone had filmed it! Ben’s claim to fame would’ve started right there, sticky sandwich and all.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Guaranteed! Next time I’m bringing a camera—and maybe some juggling lessons for Ben, too.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: He’d need them! Remind me to sit far away from the fruit basket at the next picnic.

meaning: The noise made when a compressed spring is suddenly released; a reverberating sound.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa! As soon as I pressed down on this old jack-in-the-box, it went boing and the clown popped straight up into my face.

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: You jumped back like it was about to attack you!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Can you blame me? That thing is more lively than it looks.

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: That’s the most excitement this attic has seen all year.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Remind me not to trust any more vintage toys around here.

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Deal. Next mystery box, we open together, slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Check out this box I found in the attic—look at the crank on the side.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whoa, that looks ancient! Is that a jack-in-the-box?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Yep! I wonder if it still works after all these years.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Only one way to find out. You brave enough to turn the handle?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing. If I scream, just pretend you didn’t hear it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whoa! There it goes—boing! That caught me off guard!

meaning: A bump; a blow. Also: a brief resonant sound, such as might accompany this.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yikes, I just smacked my elbow on the desk—boink! That’s what I get for reaching for my charger without looking.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Ouch! That sounded brutal. Are you holding up over there?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yeah, I’m tough, but my elbow might start its own protest soon.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If it does, I hope it demands better desk placement, at least.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll remember: chargers first, acrobatics later.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Sounds like a solid plan—save the heroics for after coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: So, picture this—I’m carrying my coffee, and I turn the corner way too fast.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Uh-oh, let me guess, boink right into the wall? Hope the coffee survived!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The mug definitely didn't! It went flying and everyone around just froze for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Classic office moment right there. At least you gave everyone a morning show.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: My pride took a hit, but my sense of humor survived. I might avoid that corner for a while though.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You just need a warning sign: 'Caution: Rachel ahead with coffee and questionable brakes!'

meaning: The sound caused by the discharge of a gun.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You sure you’re ready for this, Noah? The shooting range isn’t exactly like video games.

dialogue.speaker: Noah
dialogue.text: I think so! How hard can it be? Just aim and fire, right?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Perfect stance… now squeeze the trigger gently and—bom! That’s the sound you’ll hear when the gun fires.

dialogue.speaker: Noah
dialogue.text: Whoa, I wasn’t expecting it to be that loud! My hands are shaking a little.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Happens to everyone their first time. It gets easier after a few shots.

dialogue.speaker: Noah
dialogue.text: Guess I’ll need to practice more if I want to impress you next time.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You really weren’t exaggerating—this old fort looks straight out of a movie.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Just wait until they line up and fire—every time those reenactors pull the trigger, it’s like bom and the whole crowd jolts.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I’ve got to admit, my heart’s racing a little already.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: You should see it when the cannons kick in—it only gets wilder!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If I scream, promise you won’t tease me all week?

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Deal—unless you run for cover, then all bets are off!

meaning: Representing a low-pitched, resonant sound of the kind made by the ringing of large bell, the striking of a gong, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: That’s the third time this hour I’ve heard something echo from downtown.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: I know, right? Bong! There it goes again—makes it feel like the city’s keeping time for us.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It always startles me, even though I know it’s coming.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: When I was a kid, I used to pretend that was a secret signal meant just for me.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Honestly, sometimes it does feel like it slices right through everything around here.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: If that’s the case, I guess we’d better be ready for whatever it’s announcing next!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: There it goes again—the clock just struck seven and the whole street filled with that deep bong; it carries right through the morning mist.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You can almost set your watch by that old clock, can’t you? It’s like a cue for the day to really begin.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I’ve always found it grounding. Even when everything else feels chaotic, the clock just keeps marking time for everyone.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Funny how something so simple can tie everyone together. People pause to listen, even if just for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It makes me wonder how many stories have unfolded under that sound—first dates, hurried walks to work, lazy Sunday strolls.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: If only the clock had a memory, imagine the tales it could tell. Ready to grab some coffee before the square fills up?

meaning: An abrupt, heavy sound, as when a solid object strikes a hard surface or bony part of the body.
To hit (a solid surface or bony part of the body) resoundingly with or against something hard and unyielding.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoops—bonk! That shelf attacked me again.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: You didn’t just run straight into it, did you? That sounded rough.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I swear, it's always in the same spot and still manages to surprise me.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Honestly, we should put caution tape around it or something.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Or a giant neon sign just for my head’s sake!

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I'll start drafting the hazard warning—maybe you'll finally win the battle with that shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Hand me that flashlight, would you? This attic is a maze, and I can't see a thing.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Hang on, I think it's buried under this pile of boxes. Give me a sec.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Just don't trip over the skateboard. Last time it nearly sent me flying.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: No worries, I've got my footing! Wait, the box on top is slipping.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Careful, that one's packed with books!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Ow! That was a real bonk to the head. Who stacked these things like this?

meaning: To hum as a bee or beetle; to make a loud, deep sound with much resonance, as a cannon, a large bell, the waves of the sea, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know, the salt in the air makes everything feel so refreshing when you're by the sea.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it's like the whole world quiets down except for the waves.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I always find myself stopping to listen when the tides roll in.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Those moments are the best, especially when a big surge hits the rocks.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s when you get that deep vibration in your chest, right before everything goes calm again.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Exactly, and then—boom—the sound just echoes all around you, like the sea is announcing itself to the whole coast.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Wow, check out those dark clouds rolling in over the ocean.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: It looks kind of dramatic, doesn’t it? The sunset barely stands a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I love when the sky goes all purple and gold before a storm hits.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? Sound travels so far over the water.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Absolutely—boom, the thunder just vibrates straight through you out here.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Gives me goosebumps every time. There's nothing like a storm by the sea.

meaning: A short abrupt explosive sound.
To hit, strike, punch.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hey, do you hear that weird noise coming from the kitchen?

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Not sure, what kind of noise are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
