dialogue.text: I hope my arms don’t give out halfway up the stairs. Let’s lift on the count of three.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Alright, one, two—watch your toes—three!

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Whoa! That corner just went duff right into the banister. Sorry, I lost my grip for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No worries, as long as nothing broke. Let’s adjust our hold before we try another step.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, I promise not to redecorate your staircase with box corners!

meaning: Expressing inarticulacy or incomprehension. Also (usually mildly derogatory): implying that another person has said something foolish or extremely obvious.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You actually forgot your phone at home again? Duh, that’s why you couldn’t find it in your bag.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously, Emily? I just thought I misplaced it for a second, no need to rub it in.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Well, this is the third time this week—maybe you should put a tracker on it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Maybe I should just glue it to my hand at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If that works, let me know your secret; I lose my keys more often than you lose your phone.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Deal. Next step: inventing key-glue. We’d make a fortune.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You seriously can't find your keys again? Duh, you always leave them in your jacket pocket.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, no need to rub it in. I'm just checking everywhere before I blame my jacket.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Not trying to rub it in, but you have to admit it's becoming your routine.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If it is, it's not a routine I enjoy. Wait—found them. You were right, as usual.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I should start keeping a scoreboard at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Please don't. I'd rather not see how many times I lose to my own forgetfulness.

meaning: Expressing (frequently mock) astonishment, alarm, horror, or surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: So, I went to grab my cereal this morning and almost dropped the box.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t leave me hanging. What did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: There was something furry sticking out from behind the pantry door.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Wait, are you telling me we have a furry intruder? Like, with whiskers or with fangs?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Eek! It moved when I got closer—turns out it was just my scarf, but my heart definitely skipped a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I was ready to grab a broom and a suit of armor! Your scarf has some serious scare tactics.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Eek! There’s something weird and squishy in this box of old cables.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you just jump back? What did you touch in there?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I have no idea, but it felt like it was alive for a second.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Please tell me it’s just some leftover putty or something, not one of those toy worms again.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That would be so much better than what I imagined for a split second.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I'm not reaching in there until you prove it's safe—I value my fingers!

meaning: Used to express the inarticulate sound or murmur made by a hesitant speaker.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hey, do you want to go for a hike this Saturday? The weather's supposed to be great.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: That sounds awesome! I haven’t been hiking in ages. Which trail did you have in mind?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I was thinking maybe Willow Creek? But I’m open to suggestions if you prefer something else.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Willow Creek works for me, but I should double-check if I have anything planned already.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Er, no worries if you’re not sure yet—just let me know when you find out.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Thanks, Emily! I’ll check my calendar and text you later today.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s the third time the special has caught your attention—you must be tempted.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's intriguing, but I can’t decide if it's worth the risk.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hmm, er, every time I try something unfamiliar, it goes either really well or kind of disastrous.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Sounds like we’d be rolling the dice, then.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe that’s half the fun. Shall we just go for it and see what happens?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, you’ve convinced me—let’s take the plunge!

meaning: Used as an emphatic expression, chiefly of disgust, but also (formerly) of surprise or approval.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Brace yourself, Matt—I had a total food disaster last night.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Oh no, what did you get yourself into this time?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: So, I tried making blue cheese pasta because it looked fancy online.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Did it turn out as good as the pictures?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Not even close—when I opened the cheese, the smell just punched me in the face. Ew, it lingered for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: That’s brutal! I can practically smell it from here just hearing about it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened at lunch yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: What happened? I thought you were excited to try that new place.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I was, until my salad arrived with a surprise guest—a little caterpillar crawling right on top.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Oh man, that's the worst. Did you call a server over?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I just stared at it for a second and then said, 'ew,' way louder than I meant to.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I would've reacted the same way. That's a definite appetite-ruiner!

meaning: To stutter or stammer; to utter incoherent sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That was some crowd in the conference room, wasn’t it? I spotted you up front.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, my hands wouldn’t stop shaking. Presenting slides always gets me like that.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I get nervous just imagining it. Did the words come out the way you rehearsed?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Not even close. I kept tripping over the intro and lost my place halfway through.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Ah, I’ve been there. Sometimes I faffle so much in the beginning, I wish I could just skip to the Q&A.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That’s reassuring, actually. Makes me feel less alone in the struggle!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I just—uh, fa- faffle—sorry, it’s like my words tangle up every single time I try to say something important to you!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That was quite the sound you just made! Should I be worried you’ve invented a new language, Emma?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No, nothing like that, I promise. Nerves just get the better of me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, if it helps, you make nervous energy look charming.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Thanks, Lucas. I just wanted to get it right.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Don’t sweat it. The important part is you showed up, tangled words and all.

meaning: Representing the sound of (esp. male) masturbation.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Man, thinking back to freshman year, those paper-thin walls should’ve come with a warning label.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No kidding. Every night was like live audio roulette—sometimes music, sometimes heated arguments, and sometimes... questionable rhythms.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Questionable rhythms? Now I’m intrigued. Was that from next door or down the hall?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Mostly next door. Mark had a pretty regular schedule, if you catch my drift.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, trust me, I caught it! There were nights when all I heard was fap fap fap echoing like some weird metronome.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Legend has it, the RA started leaving earplugs in the common area just for that reason.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: You know, I barely slept last night because of those mysterious sounds coming from the next room.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Oh, I caught that too! It was so persistent, I wondered if he adopted a hamster or something.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Right? It kept going for ages, and I swear it sped up at one point.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Maybe he was binge-watching action movies and got a little too immersed.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Either that, or his hands were extremely busy with something else. The walls in this building are way too thin.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Yeah, all I kept hearing was... fap fap fap. I had to put on my headphones to get any peace.

meaning: A movement made by bending the last joint of a finger against the thumb and suddenly releasing it; a smart stroke or tap given by this means.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You've been lining up those paperclips for ten minutes—should I be worried about your sanity, or are we brainstorming in a new way?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: My brain needs a break from spreadsheets, that's all. These numbers are starting to blur together.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hmm, check this out—fillip! That one almost made it to your coffee mug.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If you knock over my coffee, your spreadsheets are going solo.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Deal, I'll keep my paperclip antics on my side of the table.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Excellent, because I've finally got this formula working and I need all the luck I can get.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Would you look at that? Somehow, a popcorn kernel survived the great cleanup and is daring me right at the edge of the bowl.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: That sneaky little guy’s been hanging on for dear life. Should I fetch the dustpan, or do you have a trick up your sleeve?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Watch closely—here comes the legendary fillip technique… and just like that, it’s airborne!

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Whoa! You knocked it clean off the table—extra points for flair.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Popcorn kernels are my specialty. Wait until you see what I can do with a grape.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: I’d pay to see that! Your aim’s got real showmanship.

meaning: A foolish or ridiculous notion; a foolish hobby.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Trust James to find the oddest ways to spend his weekends.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh no, what’s he gotten himself into this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He’s apparently started painting rocks and giving them names. He’s got a whole shelf dedicated to them now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That is... unexpectedly specific. Did he say why?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Nope, just shrugged and said it beats his old filly-folly from last summer. Honestly, with him, you never know what’s next.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, at least he keeps life interesting, I’ll give him that much!

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Liam, was that you I saw in the park with what looked like a homemade kite yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Uh, yes, guilty! I was trying to see if I could get it to actually fly, but it mostly just flopped around.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: I have to admit, it was entertaining to watch. But where did this sudden interest in kites come from?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Honestly, it started as a bit of filly-folly. I read an article about creative hobbies and next thing I knew, I was taping paper and sticks together.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Well, who knows, maybe your next filly-folly will be just as fun and a little less breezy.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: No promises! But maybe next time, I'll make sure it's less likely to dive-bomb unsuspecting joggers.

meaning: To make a slight continued noise; to rustle; to move with such a noise.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: These trees seem extra lively today. Even the air feels different.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Wait, did you catch that? There’s movement just past that fallen log.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s a rabbit. They love hiding when folks walk by.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Could be. Hold your step a second; let’s see if it shows itself.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: *whispers* Something’s definitely shuffling in there.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: I can hear the fissle through the grass—whatever it is, it knows we’re watching.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: The way these branches sway, it almost feels like the trees are whispering secrets to each other.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's the perfect soundtrack for an afternoon lost in thought, honestly. Even the tiniest sounds stand out.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Wait, did you just catch that? Something’s moving near those ferns by the pathway.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, listen closer—there it is again! That little fissle, like feet or wings brushing through the undergrowth.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Last spring, I swear every evening sounded like that, all the hedgehogs stirring up the garden beds.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I love how these small things make the world feel busier than it looks from a distance.

meaning: To make a slight continued noise; to rustle; to move with such a noise.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: These woods always seem to wrap you up in their quiet, don’t they? Even the air feels softer here.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It’s almost like the trees are holding their breath. Makes you want to whisper even if there’s no one else around.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Hold on—did you catch that sound? Right under those ferns. There’s a little fistle between the branches—listen!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You’re right! Something’s definitely shuffling in there. My guess is a squirrel on the hunt for dinner.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It could be. The way it moves, staying hidden, I wonder if it even knows we’re here.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let’s walk a bit closer. I’ll go first in case it makes a dash for the next tree.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe what happened in the park this morning—my backpack nearly got snatched by a curious squirrel!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No way! I bet it made your bag fistle in the leaves. Those little guys are brave these days.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It did! I spun around so fast, but the squirrel just darted off with the loudest commotion.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: They’ve been getting bold lately. I saw one tugging at a lunch bag just last week.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I guess we should start carrying extra snacks for our furry park neighbors—or risk another backpack ambush.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Just make sure it’s not your favorite sandwich next time, or you’ll have even more trouble on your hands!

meaning: Hurry, the middle of any business.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The clock’s not slowing down for us—how close are you to wrapping up that document?

dialogue.speaker: Benjamin
dialogue.text: I’m past the halfway point, just squeezing in the final numbers. My laptop’s taking its sweet time though.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Every project turns into a fix-fax right when we need a breather. Can we get a move on?

dialogue.speaker: Benjamin
dialogue.text: Right there with you! My fingers are flying—I’ll send it over in thirty seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If the printer jams, I’m going to take it as a sign. Need me to prep anything else before we dash?

dialogue.speaker: Benjamin
dialogue.text: Nope, just hit print and we’re golden. Race you to the conference room!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Looking at the stack of emails, I’m getting dizzy—are you this swamped with the launch updates too?

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: It’s a madhouse on my end as well. I haven’t stepped away from my screen in hours.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If you need an extra set of eyes on those client briefs, just send them my way.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Thanks, Rachel! I’m deep in the fix-fax—trying to get the marketing outline finalized while everything’s moving at full speed.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That sounds wild. You always thrive in the eye of the storm, so I know you’ll nail it.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Here’s hoping! I’ll shout if I hit a wall—right now, I’m back to the grindstone.

meaning: To make a hissing or sputtering sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That’s the new soda maker on the counter—looks intimidating, right?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I was just eyeing it! I’ve never used one before, but it does look kind of fun.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If you want bubbles, just screw the bottle in and press that button down.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing. Should I press gently or really go for it?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You’ll have to give it a decent push, don’t worry, it can handle it!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Oh wow—did you see that? It just went fiz and made the cap jump!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Check this out, I bought that fancy new soda with the wild flavors!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Ooh, adventurous! What did you end up picking?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This one's supposed to taste like passionfruit and lime. Should I crack it open?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Absolutely, let's see if it lives up to the hype.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing. Opening the can now.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Did you hear that fiz? That’s how you know it’s extra bubbly!

meaning: To make a hissing or sputtering sound.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Only the best for our movie marathon—ice-cold root beers!

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: You always know how to kick things up a notch. Pass one over?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Absolutely. The cap's on tight—there it is, fizz! Perfect timing.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Yes! That sound just makes me thirstier.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Let's toast to a night of terrible films and amazing refreshments.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Cheers to that—first sip goes to the master of snacks!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s the last bottle of lemon soda—let’s hope it isn’t flat!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Alright, moment of truth—listen… fizzzzz! That’s what I like to hear.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Careful, it’s foaming up—you might need another glass.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: No worries, I’ve mastered the twist-and-pour technique.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You say that, but last time it ended up all over the counter!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: This time, I guarantee zero splash zones. Cheers to that!

meaning: To flap the wings.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should've seen the park this morning—a flock of geese caused quite a stir by the pond.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No way! Did they come close to you, or just stay at the water’s edge?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: They waddled up onto the grass right beside the path. I froze, hoping not to startle them.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And then one of them suddenly went flab, flab—those wings were massive up close!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I know, my heart skipped a beat! They're a lot bigger than you'd expect when they're in motion.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: For a second, I always feel like I’m in some nature documentary when that happens.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Would you look at that robin? It’s been bouncing from branch to branch since we sat down.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: He does have an audience today. I think he spotted us watching him.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: He’s getting closer, too. Almost as if he wants to show off.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Robins are the drama queens of the bird world, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Did you see that? Just before he hopped, his wings went flab flab flab—like he was winding up for takeoff.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Now every time he moves, I’m picturing those tiny wings going wild. He’s definitely putting on a show.

meaning: Hanging loose by its own weight, yielding to the touch and easily moved or shaken, flaccid, limp, soft; said chiefly of or with respect to flesh.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Wow, I can barely lift my gym bag right now—those resistance bands really did a number on me.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No kidding. My legs are still wobbling from the lunges—you’d think I’d be used to it by now.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, after those bicep curls, my arms went all flabby on me. I tried reaching for my phone and almost dropped it!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I know the feeling! My calves started acting up when I took the stairs; I nearly tripped over myself.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Maybe we belong in one of those slow-motion workout videos instead of this intense class.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hey, every superhero has their off days. Next session, we’ll come back twice as strong.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: My legs feel like jelly after those squats—there’s no way I’m making it up the stairs tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Same here! Those lunges absolutely destroyed me, and I’m still feeling last week’s ab workout.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: At least we survived. I keep thinking I’ll suddenly wake up with super-toned legs or something.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Muscles take their sweet time. I read somewhere consistency is everything, so we just have to stick with it.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: True, but every time I poke the back of my arm, it still feels so flabby. Maybe I need to add more tricep work.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Hey now, be kind to yourself—you’re putting in the effort, and that’s what counts most!

meaning: A blow, slap, or stroke.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You’re not going to let me live this down when you hear what happened during my morning jog.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Don’t leave me hanging—did you trip over something again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Even better, I tried to leap over a tiny branch and totally misjudged the distance.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Tell me you at least stuck the landing this time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Not even close! My shoe caught the edge and, flack, right into a muddy puddle I went.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: You and those heroic leaps—one of these days, they’re going to put up warning signs just for you!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you see what just happened on the field? My heart's still racing.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely, that tackle came out of nowhere. The whole crowd was holding its breath.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: And then Alex just got right back up—like nothing even happened!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: The ref even looked stunned for a second. I wasn't expecting that at all.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Everyone around me just gasped. It was unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: When his shoulder hit the turf, there was that nasty flack—made me cringe for sure.

meaning: To flap, make a flapping; to flutter.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You should've seen the commotion outside my kitchen window just now.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Now you've piqued my interest—what happened this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: A bright blue jay flew straight at the feeder and suddenly there was a wild flaff, flaff, flaff of wings against the glass—made me spill my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That bird clearly has a flair for the dramatic!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No kidding, I half-expected it to leave a little feather signature on the pane.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Morning coffee with live entertainment—your kitchen is never dull.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, Liam, did you catch that seagull’s wings just now? It went flaff flaff right over my head—I thought it was going to snatch my fries!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: I saw it! For a second I thought it was aiming for your hat. Those birds are fearless.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, they probably think this whole boardwalk belongs to them at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Well, with all these picnics, can you really blame them? It’s like a buffet for birds.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time I’m bringing a decoy sandwich just for the drama.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: I’ll get the slow-motion camera ready—you never know when a bird might put on a show.

meaning: To whip with a light, sudden stroke.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: My arm is starting to feel like jelly, but this cake won't make itself!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You got this! Put some muscle into it—show that cream who’s boss.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: If this bowl slips out of my hand, we're having pancakes instead.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Deal! But try to channel your inner baker just a bit longer.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Alright, time for maximum effort. Watch out for flying cream!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Nice! That’s the spirit—flank, flank! Give the whisk a little snap and we’ll have perfect peaks in no time.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Daisy made it through the whole training session without getting distracted by squirrels this time!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: That's impressive. Max still thinks every leaf blowing by is a new friend.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Have you tried bringing his favorite squeaky ball to help him focus?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I did, and he actually ended up squeaking it so much, the instructor had to take it away!

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Sounds like Max might need his own private class.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Seriously, and right as they took the ball, his tail started to do this little flank, flank on the mat—pretty sure he was announcing his disappointment to the whole room.

meaning: To strike with a sudden blow.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You know that stack of magazines on the coffee table? I just witnessed the wildest thing with Oreo and those.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let me guess, he knocked them over—again?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Not just a casual push this time. He took one big leap and flap—sent the whole pile flying across the floor!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That cat’s got serious dramatic flair when he’s feeling feisty.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He even looked back at me like he’d performed some magic trick.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s time Oreo found an outlet for those acrobatics that doesn’t involve redecorating our living room.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Disaster almost struck during lunchtime—Max was at it again.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Let me guess, he tried to swipe your food?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He’s too quick for his own good. One moment, he was circling the sandwich platter.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Did he actually get a bite this time, or did you save the day?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was a close call—I barely managed to grab a napkin before he lunged.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Right as he reached out, I gave the table a sharp flap with the napkin, and he bolted so fast you'd think he'd seen a ghost!

meaning: A sudden outburst or issuing forth of flame or light; a sudden, quick, transitory blaze.
A sudden movement of a body of water, a splash

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Toss another branch in, will you? These embers are starting to look lazy.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that sudden flash? The whole ring was lit up for just a second!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was wild! It's like the fire decided to put on a show.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: My heart jumped—I thought it was going to get out of control for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Nah, it's under control. The way these logs burn can be pretty unpredictable sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Keeps things interesting, that's for sure. Fires have a mind of their own out here.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Did you see that over by the forest edge? Something lit up out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was like a burst of light—a sudden flash right through the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: It was so bright, I had to blink a few times to clear my eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Same here. It almost looked like something caught fire for a split second.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Should we go check it out, or do you think it’s better to stay here?

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Let’s wait just a minute—if it happens again, we’ll know where to look.

meaning: To flap about (as a fish); to flutter (as a bird); to flounder.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened at the pond this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let me guess, another fishing adventure gone wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Pretty much! I hooked a fish, but the moment I brought it out, it started to flasker all over the dock—it was a miracle I didn’t drop it back in.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That must have been hilarious to watch. Did you manage to hold on?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Barely! My hands were slipping and I was laughing so hard.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Next time maybe bring a towel or something—sounds like you'll need it!

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: So there I was, knee-deep in the river, trying not to slip with all that slippery moss underfoot.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Classic Nathan—braving the wild! Did anything actually bite today?

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely! Had a monster of a trout get hooked right before lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Don't tell me it gave you a show. Those big ones never come quietly.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: You should've seen it—the second it broke the water, it started to flasker so hard it almost yanked my rod clear out of my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Wish I could've seen that! Sounds like you had the river to yourself and a wild story to bring back.

meaning: To float, flutter.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know, I always forget how the park transforms in autumn. Every corner feels like a painting.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Totally, and the cool air today makes it even better. There’s something about the way the trees look when the sun hits them.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you notice those crimson leaves just now? They seem to flatter down from the branches every time the wind sweeps through.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Yeah, they kind of twirl around before landing, like they're showing off a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It makes walking here feel magical—like we're on some kind of enchanted path.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Let’s take the long way around so we can wander through more of these falling leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Did you catch that flash of color just above the water lilies?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I did! For a second, I thought it was a petal blowing in the breeze.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Nope, that’s a butterfly. It keeps circling around those pink blossoms.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Look at its wings flatter as it glides—it’s like a little patch of sunlight never wants to settle.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: That’s beautiful, Ethan. Watching it never gets old.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Best entertainment the park can offer for free, if you ask me.

meaning: A random blow or kick, a stroke.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: That corner kick just got the whole stadium on its feet; the energy is unreal right now.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Seriously! The defense barely survived that scramble—thought the net was about to ripple.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Watch number 14 lining up—he's got that look like something wild’s about to happen.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: He’s unpredictable, I’ll give him that. The other team’s just hoping to keep the ball away from him.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: There it goes! No way he meant to kick it in that direction—what a twist.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Classic fleg right there. The chaos in the box afterwards was hilarious!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: My legs are still sore from that match yesterday—who knew amateur leagues could get so wild?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: No kidding. I’m pretty sure I dodged more bodies than I touched the ball.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: At one point, I swear Marcus spun around and almost collided with you.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: He did! I barely managed to hop out of the way. It felt more like a dance battle than soccer.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You remember when Ethan tried to shoot and ended up flopping onto the grass instead?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Of course! And just as everyone was watching him, Sam ran in with this wild fleg right past us—he nearly booted the Gatorade cooler!

meaning: To make a jerking movement.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: If you saw me at the gym this morning, you’d probably still be laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Wait, what happened? Did something go sideways with your workout?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I was trying to do those box jumps, but on the second try my foot went all flerk and almost tripped me up in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds like exactly the type of move I'd accidentally invent.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: At least the trainer just told me to call it 'dynamic footwork.'

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Hey, trendsetter! Next thing you know, everyone will be adding that to their routine.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If you saw me trying to get Benji into his crate just now, you'd think I was wrangling an octopus.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That little dog? What did he do this time?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: He flerked so suddenly when I picked him up that I nearly dropped my coffee everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Classic Benji! He always keeps you on your toes.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! Next time, I'm bribing him with extra treats first.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit—never underestimate the power of snacks with that one.

meaning: A chattering or gossiping person; a flighty or frivolous woman.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Whew, that was some meeting, huh? My head's still spinning from all the back-and-forth.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No kidding, Rachel. Olivia hardly paused for air between comments. Did you keep track of what she was saying?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I tried! One second she was dissecting the quarterly reports, next she was telling us about her cat’s birthday party.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Right! And don’t forget her take on the new coffee machine, squeezed in somehow.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: She’s definitely got a talent for keeping the conversation moving, I’ll give her that.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Honestly, I haven’t seen such a flibbertigibbet in the office since Marsha retired. Never a dull moment with Olivia around!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You won’t believe this—Mark just called me a flibbertigibbet in front of everyone at lunch because I kept jumping from one funny story to another.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Oh wow! Only Mark would whip out a word like that. How did the rest of the table react?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They all burst out laughing, honestly. I think everyone was just glad someone lightened the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Well, you definitely know how to keep people entertained on a Monday!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, better to be chatty than have everyone yawning through lunch, right?

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Someone has to make the cafeteria fun, and you do it best.

meaning: A light blow, esp. one given with something pliant, a whip, etc., or with the finger-nail.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There it goes again—flick! Seriously, your pen is just begging to be launched across the table.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Sophie, if my pen vanishes one more time, I’m putting it on a leash.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear I’ll keep my hands to myself. For now, at least.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’re lucky I’ve got a backup. Paperweights were invented for people like you.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you start hauling out bricks, I’ll know I’ve gone too far.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: As long as they keep you from launching my stuff, I just might.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’ve been staring at this page for so long, the words are starting to blur together.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: That’s usually my cue to take a snack break. Or just nap under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You and your naps. I think you just want an excuse to avoid this chapter.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Guilty as charged. But hey, at least I’m honest about my laziness.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If you even try to flick me with that pen again, I’ll switch your coffee for decaf.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, truce! I value my caffeine way too much for that risk.

meaning: To flutter; to hover. occasionally To flap the wings; to move by flapping the wings.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Would you look at that squirrel, Jamie? I swear it's putting on a show for us.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: And right above it—see that robin? It keeps trying to flicker between the leaves, like it's just teasing gravity.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I always wonder if they're playing or just hunting for the perfect spot.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Maybe a bit of both. They make the trees look alive with all that movement.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This spot under the maples might just be the best seat in the park for watching them.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Agreed. If I sit any longer, I might start thinking I have wings myself.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Check out the back porch—there's a little goldfinch by the feeder.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh wow, it’s darting between the sunflower and the hanging basket!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I always smile when I see them flicker around like that, barely landing before they’re off again.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It makes the garden feel so lively, almost like the flowers are moving too.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It’s true—sometimes I think they visit just to show off their acrobatics.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Next time, I’ll try to snap a photo if they pause long enough for me!

meaning: A piece of nonsense or idle talk; a trifle, a conceit.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: So, Mark just told me that wearing mismatched socks on Fridays is supposed to bring good luck around here.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, that old flim-flam again? Every year someone brings it up like it's ancient office wisdom or something.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Seriously? I almost believed him for a second. Has anyone ever even tried it?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Only Claire, and her computer crashed twice that day, so I wouldn’t rush to dig out wild socks just yet.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Well, I guess I’ll stick to regular luck and hope my shoes match.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s probably safer—for both your footwear and your productivity.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe what Tracy just told me by the printers—apparently, they're changing our whole project lineup next week.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: That’s the third wild story I’ve heard this morning. I haven’t seen anything official about it anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It's wild how quickly stuff spreads around here. People barely blink before turning it into office news.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: It’s just more flim-flam, if you ask me. I’d rather wait for an actual update than jump at every rumor.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yep, I’ll stick to my to-do list instead of playing detective over every little whisper.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Priorities, right? Let’s see what the meeting brings, if anything.

meaning: To burn unsteadily.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That's the fourth match I’ve used and still no real fire—maybe it’s just stubborn tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Could be these chunks of wood—they don’t feel as dry as I thought they were.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at that… the flame just flimmer and then disappears before it goes anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Hmm, let’s try breaking up some of the kindling more—maybe smaller pieces will catch better.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I’ll get the hatchet and chop a few—let’s see if that’ll help steady things up.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Now that’s the spirit! This campfire’s not going to beat us tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: This fire’s turning pretty moody all of a sudden, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Definitely. Half the logs look untouched while the rest barely glow.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s the wind swirling through. The flames keep flickering instead of catching properly.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Yeah, you see that? It starts to flimmer every time the breeze comes through, like it's fighting to stay alive.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: Let me rearrange the wood a bit—maybe that'll help it settle down.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: I’ll grab an extra log or two from the pile. We’re not letting our campsite go dark tonight!

meaning: The action or an act of tossing, or turning something over, and related senses.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: These pancakes smell amazing. How do you know when they're ready on one side?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I usually look for bubbles on the surface and check if the edges look set.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Makes sense. Should I give it a try with the spatula now?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Go for it! One smooth motion and... flip! Nicely done, it’s perfectly golden.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thanks! Honestly, I was worried it might end up on the floor.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You nailed it. Maybe you should do the next one too!

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Why do my cards always end up everywhere when we're playing? Maybe I should leave shuffling to you, Ben.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Come on, Alice, everybody's got their own style. Let's see what you've got!

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Alright, watch this—flip, flip... Oops, there goes the ace under the table.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That's actually pretty impressive! You managed to entertain us and deal at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: It’s a new move—part magic trick, part total accident.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: At this rate, you’ll have your own Vegas show by next Friday night.

meaning: Noise and confusion caused by show.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: My ears are still ringing from that talent show last night, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Right? The whole auditorium was just flipper-de-flapper—people cheering, music blaring, stage crew running around. Total sensory overload.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: And right in the middle of all that, Grace tried her juggling act! I could barely see what she was doing.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That part was wild! I almost missed the actual performance with everything going on around.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Well, it definitely made for a memorable night! Doubt anyone’s going to forget that chaos anytime soon.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If next year’s anything like this, I’m bringing earplugs and a pair of binoculars.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: My ears are still ringing from all that flipper-de-flapper on stage—those performers really went all out tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’re telling me! I was clutching my seat when the lights started spinning and the band kicked in.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: And don’t get me started on those fireworks; I nearly spilled my drink twice.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was a miracle nobody tripped over those confetti cannons—they were everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: After a show like that, my heart’s racing more than after a gym session.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s hope our feet remember how to walk straight when we head out for snacks.

meaning: To propel or throw with a jerk or sudden movement; often, to propel by a blow from the finger-nail released from the thumb.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: If I poke this paperclip one more time, I might actually invent a new form of office boredom.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Or you might start an indoor sport. Care for a little friendly competition?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Alright, observe as I flirt this paperclip straight toward the stapler—precision and style in one go!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Impressive! It practically bounced off and did a flip. I wasn't expecting athletic moves from office supplies.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Give it a shot, but don't be surprised if the paperclip chooses its own path; they're rebels, trust me.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Get ready to witness the great stapler vault.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This bench is going to have my imprint forever if we wait much longer.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: No kidding! If boredom was an Olympic sport, we’d have gold medals by now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hey, look at this little pile of pebbles. Dare you to hit that soda can with one.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: You’re on. But what’s the strategy—just chuck it or what?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Try using your thumb; you get more power than just tossing.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: Alright, here it goes—let me flirt this pebble and see if I can nail the can.

meaning: To slash or cut.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: You’re turning that celery into confetti over there, Emma.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It’s this chef’s knife! It really makes chopping kind of fun.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Those slices are so uniform. Can you go even faster without losing a finger?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Check this out—flish, flish, flish! Perfect slices, no hesitation.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Nice! I feel like I should be wearing safety goggles just watching you.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Relax, kitchen safety is my superpower. Next up: onions!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: These rose bushes are way tougher than I expected. My gloves are barely holding up.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let me pass you the pruning shears—they work wonders on thick stems.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Thanks! Here goes—one solid squeeze and… flish! That branch is history.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Wow, that was impressive! You made it look effortless.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: These tools really make all the difference. I might actually enjoy yard work now.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let me give it a try next—I’ve got my eye on that overgrown hedge.

meaning: To move or dance about in a frolicsome way; to frisk.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Were you watching the ducklings by the pond earlier? They couldn’t sit still for a second!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. The little ones zipped right past my shoes, all in a tangle of tiny feet.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: They always seem to flisk from one corner of the water to the other, making everyone around them smile.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s the charm, isn’t it? It looked like spring itself was bubbling up right there.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: If only grown-ups could capture half that energy on a Tuesday afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Next time you spot them, save me a seat—maybe the enthusiasm will rub off on us.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at that sunshine daring us to do something fun today.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: The park was a riot of color yesterday—the kids just couldn’t stop flisking between the swings and the fountain.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must've been a sight! Did anyone end up in the fountain?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: A couple of them got pretty close, but their laughter was even louder than the splashes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I could use some of that energy—maybe we should join them next time.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: If we time it right, we might just get swept up in all the fun, too.

meaning: A stroke.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Spent most of my Saturday painting the back porch. My arm is so sore now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Painting is no joke! Did you have to work overhead, or just straight on?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Mostly straight on, but every flitch with the brush felt like a mini workout by the end.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I can imagine! Repetitive stuff like that wears you out faster than you'd think.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Definitely. But I have to admit, it's satisfying to see the fresh coat dry.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That's the best part! Just don't look at it too closely if you see any missed spots.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at this—one flitch of the brush and the whole sky starts to appear.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You make it look effortless. Was it always this smooth for you?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Not at all! The first time I tried, I ended up with blobs instead of clouds.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, your clouds now are amazing. Mind if I give it a try?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Grab that brush next to you—just relax your wrist and go for it.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing. If I make a mess, at least it'll be colorful!

meaning: To fly off.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Those sparrows are really squabbling over the last few crumbs, aren't they?

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: They always act like it's the end of the world if they don't grab a bite first.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh! Did you see that one just flizz into the air after snatching a piece?

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Ha! That little guy didn't waste a second, did he?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Nope, he's already eyeing the next snack from the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: These birds are honestly more dramatic than any soap opera I've seen.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You see that squirrel edging closer to my sandwich? I swear, they're getting bolder every year.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Just wait, if you so much as rustle that bag, it's going to flizz right up that tree before you can blink.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That nimble escape artist! There it goes, look—did you catch how fast it moved?

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I saw! I always wonder if they practice those acrobatics when nobody’s watching.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Probably training for the annual nut heist. I never stood a chance at keeping this snack.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: You and half the park, Megan. The squirrels are undefeated champions here!

meaning: To dirty, soil.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Looks like the backyard practically tried to swallow you up again, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe how squishy the garden got—mud just everywhere, even down my boots.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: And somehow it all found a new home on our living room rug, apparently.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Oh shoot, I didn’t even notice that! Sorry, I stomped straight in without thinking.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: You managed to flobber the whole path from the back door—I could trace your steps in muddy prints.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ll go fetch the vacuum and clean up my masterpiece right away.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, Ben! Your boots totally flobbered the kitchen floor—I can see trails everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ugh, I didn't even realize I was leaving a path. That rainstorm was brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It looks like the floor lost a wrestling match with the backyard.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I'll grab some towels and start cleaning before it gets any worse.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Here, use this spray—last time it tackled the mess in half the time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I owe you big time. Next time, I'll take my shoes off at the door, promise!

meaning: To walk slowly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You always beat me here, Ben. I swear you’re part cheetah.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Or maybe you just enjoy pressing the snooze button a little too much.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s not a crime! Anyway, what’s the plan for this trail today?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s just flod from the lake up to the old sycamore. My coffee hasn’t kicked in yet.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You read my mind. Anything faster and I might just turn back.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Deal. Besides, the slower we go, the more squirrels we get to judge.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: If we want those cinnamon rolls, we might have to pick up the pace—closing time's not far off.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: My feet are protesting every step. Did we really have to take the long way through the park?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: You act like we climbed Everest! It’s just a little stroll, Ethan.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, your 'little strolls' always end up being marathons. Remember last weekend?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Oh, come on. At least this route has a great view. Don’t you think it’s worth it?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I suppose, as long as I can just flod beside you and enjoy the scenery instead of racing.

meaning: To beat, whip; to chastise with repeated blows of a rod or whip.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I see you’re completely absorbed by that book again, Mark. Must be a wild story.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: You could say that—it’s set in this old English boarding school where the teachers don’t mess around.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Let me guess, the kind of place where kids tiptoe around every rule?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Exactly, and when someone slips up, the punishment is pretty dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me—you just got to the part where the headmaster decides to flog Tom in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I still can’t believe that was considered normal back then; the whole classroom goes silent when it happens.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: You know, reading these old school stories makes me grateful I wasn’t born a hundred years ago.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let me guess, strict teachers and impossible rules?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Exactly! There’s this scene where a student gets caught sneaking out after dark.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, did the dreaded headmaster stomp in and flog him right in front of everyone?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Worse, he made all the students watch in dead silence while it happened. The whole mood was so heavy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Can you imagine if someone tried anything like that these days? There’d be outrage before the day was out.

meaning: To splash.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at that water—it’s just begging for someone to jump in!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, but it’s probably freezing. You first!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Ha! I didn’t peg you as the cautious type.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I’m just being smart. Show me how it’s done, Megan.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Stand back, Lucas—legendary leap incoming!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Whoa! That was a massive flouse! Now I have no excuse not to jump in.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That goose just crash-landed like it owns the place.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I know, right? Did you hear that huge flouse when its feet hit the pond?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, now I want to toss a rock and see if I can top that.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Classic Megan—never one to turn down a challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Just wait, I still hold the record for wildest pond chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s see your skills—nature’s not ready for this.

meaning: To splash.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Sun’s out, and this pool is calling my name—if only it didn’t look like an ice bath.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: The suspense is killing me, Emma. Just dip a toe in, or are you going for the dramatic entrance?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Dramatic entrances only. On three, I’m jumping—don’t say I didn’t warn you.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Wait, wait! Give me a second to duck or you’ll get my shirt soaked.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Too late! Floush! That was way colder than I signed up for!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You just turned me into a human towel, Emma. Thanks a lot!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Whoa! Look at that—my cannonball just went floush and sent water everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You got me all wet, Emily! I wasn’t ready for a tidal wave.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen your face—worth every drop!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s on now. My turn to make some waves!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Bring it! Just don’t blame me if you end up drenched, too.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted. Nobody’s safe around this pool today!

meaning: To repeat indistinctly, mumble.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You know, during the team update, I kept hearing Jake flummer behind his laptop whenever marketing came up.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Hmm, that's interesting. Was he actually saying anything, or just making noise?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: It sounded like he had things to say, just not out loud for everyone to hear.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Classic Jake, keeping his thoughts close but giving away just enough to be noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: He’s got a talent for subtle sideline commentary, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Next time, I might sit closer—could be worth catching the director’s cut of the meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, I gave up halfway through talking to Ben today—my ears just couldn’t keep up.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Was it during the group work? He’s notorious for never really projecting his voice.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Worse, it was during our coffee break. I asked him a simple question, and I got a string of noises instead of an answer.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let me guess, a lot of eyes-down, shuffling papers, and not much else to go on?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He’d look at his cup and just flummer something about the schedule, like the words dissolved before reaching my end.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now I feel less bad for pretending to understand. At this rate, we’ll need a Ben-to-English dictionary.

meaning: To fall or move heavily with a dull noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You already claimed the couch—sneaky move.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If I didn’t, my legs would’ve given out by the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought about just collapsing on the welcome mat.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: There’s space here if you need a dramatic landing spot.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Permission granted—*flump*—wow, I might never move again.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You make exhaustion look like an art form, Megan.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: My hands are barely keeping it together—these bags weighed a ton, didn’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I don’t know what possessed us to buy so many cans at once. My back’s already protesting.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m voting for online delivery. I’ll clear the table for you.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I’m just glad we made it up the stairs. I’m heading straight for that armchair.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Flump—there, I think that’s my official sign I’m done for the day.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You’ve definitely earned a break, Emma. I’ll handle the cans for now.

meaning: To fly or be flung out with sudden impetus.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So, you actually dared to get on Thunder Catapult after I chickened out?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: No way I was missing that! The harness clicked, my heart was pounding—you know the feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did it live up to the hype, though? People were screaming like crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe it. The second they counted down, everything around me just melted away.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Tell me, what happened at the launch? I've never seen people shoot off that fast.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: All I remember is this unreal jolt, then suddenly I flunge through the sky—my shoes nearly came off!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: My heart’s still pounding from that ride—who knew the Tornado would actually live up to its name?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously, by the time we hit the second spiral, I was clenching my eyes shut!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: The loop just before the tunnel caught me off guard. For a split second, I thought my shoes were going to fly off!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I heard you laughing and screaming at the same time—I didn’t know that was physically possible.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, when the coaster jerked left out of nowhere, I thought we were about to join the birds up there.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: When we hit that last hill, I swear my entire body did a flunge; for a second, gravity just didn’t exist!

meaning: To scatter, throw about.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Honestly, I knocked over the bag and the coffee beans went flurr across the countertop, under the toaster, I even found some in my shoe.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: That sounds like a scene straight out of a slapstick movie.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: It really was—my morning wake-up turned into a scavenger hunt before I'd even had any caffeine.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: At least you'll appreciate that first cup even more after all that effort.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: You'd think so, but I'm still finding beans whenever I open a drawer.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Bonus points if you discover one in your lunch later—talk about a surprise pick-me-up!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: How did our simple craft idea turn into this total mess?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I think the extra glitter might have been a mistake… it's everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Sorry, my arm did a sudden flurr with the beads and now they're all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Honestly, it looks kind of magical. Like a celebration exploded in here.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let's hope we don't find beads in our shoes for the next month.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, we need a clean-up strategy before we start!

meaning: A sudden agitation of the air, a gust or squall.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at those clouds rolling in—ten minutes ago the sun was blazing.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Seriously, it’s like the weather just flipped a switch on us. My coffee’s getting cold so fast.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I might have to dig out that fuzzy scarf after all. Did you see the way those leaves just danced across the yard?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah, and the patio umbrella nearly took flight. This breeze means business.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wait—did the grill lid just bang shut by itself?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It did—caught right in the middle of a flurry! That’ll wake you up better than any espresso.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you believe I wore sunglasses and brought an umbrella today? This sky makes me suspicious.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That’s smart thinking. My hat almost ended up in a tree yesterday!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At the bus stop, there was this wild flurry that scattered everyone's newspapers and had us all scrambling.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Sounds like a scene straight out of a slapstick comedy! Hope your umbrella survived the chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It did, but I swear umbrellas have a grudge against me whenever there’s wind involved.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let’s hunt down some coffee before the sky decides on its next trick.

meaning: To fly up quickly and suddenly; to start up and fly away.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You can really hear yourself think out here; the forest is almost too calm.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Earlier, near those maple trees, I caught sight of a pair of warblers darting around.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Keep your eyes sharp—maybe we'll get lucky and spot something rare.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Did you catch that sudden rustling behind the ferns?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Whoa, look at that! The grouse just flushed right as we stepped closer.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That startled me—I’ve never seen them take off quite like that before!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: The light out here really does something special to the fields, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely. If you listen, you can even hear little rustlings in the grass—there's so much life hiding.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hang on—watch near that thicket! If we keep walking, there's a chance we could flush those sparrows right out into the open.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, I see them! That would be quite a sight if they suddenly took off.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It always catches me off guard, even when I’m expecting it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Nature never fails to throw in a bit of drama, does it?

meaning: Representing lecherous or half-suppressed laughter. Frequently used to indicate sexual innuendo.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, that was the most interesting staff yoga session I've ever seen. Didn't know downward dog could cause so many near-accidents.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: To be fair, squeezing thirty employees into the conference room was ambitious. Someone's shoe landed in my face.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I couldn't help but notice Mark suddenly became very enthusiastic about 'assisting' others with their positions.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: You'd think he'd won the lottery the way he kept offering helping hands.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, when Mark started demonstrating that stretch behind Helen, I thought HR's eyes were going to pop out. Fnarr-fnarr.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Let's just say next week's session is probably getting a bigger venue—and maybe a few ground rules.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen my pizza dough last night—it doubled in size out of nowhere, totally caught me off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Sounds like things got a bit steamy in your kitchen. Fnarr-fnarr.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Tom, honestly, only you could turn baking into something suggestive.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Hey, you lob ’em over the net, it’s my job to serve them back with style.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time I’ll just stick to crackers—hard to twist that one, right?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Now that’s a challenge—give me five minutes and a thesaurus.

meaning: To harass, worry.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Today just keeps stacking more things on my plate—I'm running out of ways to shuffle everything around.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Sounds like a whirlwind. Did something in particular tip things over, or has it just been piling up?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's my team lead, really—he won't stop trying to frab me over unfinished reports. I feel like every time I breathe, he's right there asking for an update.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That's got to be exhausting. He needs to give you some space to actually get things done.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, saying it out loud makes it just a little less overwhelming.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: If you ever need someone to listen, you know where to find me—I've got a good ear for these office storms.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My mind's racing again—I just can’t shake this uneasy feeling about tomorrow's interview.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’ve done everything you can to prepare, Emily. Try to give yourself some credit.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I want to, but it’s like my nerves have a mind of their own.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Sometimes thoughts frab at me the same way, especially before something important. It can feel endless.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Knowing someone else deals with that too makes it a bit lighter, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: We’ll get through it, one step at a time. I’ll even buy you coffee afterward as a reward.

meaning: A noise made by knocking.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: These old houses sure have a lot of surprises at night, don’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: They really do. Did something spook you just now?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: There was this sudden frap coming from the hallway—not exactly what I expected during my midnight tea.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, I bet that’s just the coat rack wobbling whenever the heater kicks on.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Your house has a whole personality after dark—including dramatic entrances, apparently.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Stick around and you might catch it reciting poetry next!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That was weird—I thought I heard something coming from the hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Me too! It was like, frap frap, right against the door.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Should we check if someone’s there or just ignore it?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let’s not rush; sometimes it’s just the wind or the pipes acting up again.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: True, but I've got a hunch it’s the mailman with that package I ordered.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Alright, you peek while I stay back here just in case!

meaning: To make a harsh or strident noise; to creak.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I swear, that noise kept me on edge all night—came from the old staircase, I think.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You're not imagining things. I heard it every time the house settled or the wind picked up.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I've never noticed it sound quite that loud before. It almost rattled my glass of water.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was more like fratch, fratch with every gust outside. Not your usual creak at all.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, it made me wonder if a board is about to snap or something.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: After we eat, let's grab a flashlight and check under the stairs before it gets any stranger.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s the third time tonight I’ve heard something coming from the hallway. This place really turns up the suspense after dark.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: The wind loves to play tricks in old houses, especially ones with drafty corners like this.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I don’t know, Jack, this noise almost made me jump out of my skin. It’s different from the wind—more like the house itself is unsettled.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’ve never been in a place that announces its age quite so loudly. Every step is a little performance.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If those floorboards get any more dramatic, I’ll start thinking we have a ghost for company.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Did you just hear that? The stairs did a full-on fratch that echoed down the hall—definitely not shy tonight!

meaning: To falter, stammer (out).

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That was some whirlwind of a meeting, Ethan. Your insight on the market shift turned a few heads.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If only they knew my heart was nearly pounding out of my chest, especially when the questions started flying.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Nobody would have guessed it—you looked ready to take on the board single-handed.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Easy for you to say, you practically breeze through the toughest spots.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: But when Mr. Harris grilled me on the quarterly figures, I totally fribbled my response—I just hoped I made some sense up there.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: All I caught was a composed answer. Sometimes we’re our own worst critics, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You've barely touched your sandwich, Alex. That's your classic tell something's up.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Guess I’m off my game today, huh? Just zoning out a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: C’mon, man. You know you can vent to me. I’m not letting you sit here in silence.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: It’s nothing, really. Work’s just been a bit overwhelming lately.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t give me that. I know when something's brewing in your head. Let it out.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Okay, but—uh—I keep trying and I just… fribble… it doesn’t want to come out right. But there’s something I need to say.

meaning: To move restlessly (about or up and down); to fidget.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You've practically worn a path in the carpet. What's going on across your mind?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I know, I just can't stop myself from fridge up and down—it feels like my nerves are electric wires.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That sounds intense. Something coming up that’s making you restless?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've got that big meeting with my boss in an hour, and my mind keeps jumping to the worst-case scenarios.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
