dialogue.text: You've prepared so much, Jake. How about a quick walk to clear your head before you go in?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That might just do the trick—thanks for rescuing me from my own pacing.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: You’ve tapped your pen about a hundred times—something big going on?

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, not really. Just thinking about a few things.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Pretty sure you almost bored a hole in your notebook.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Sorry. This project update meeting is kind of looming over me, you know?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I figured as much—you’ve been fridge-ing at your desk ever since you walked in.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Guess I’m not as subtle as I hoped. Thanks for noticing, though.

meaning: Of the eagle: to scream.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you catch that eagle just frill above us? That sound echoed all over these hills.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it's almost like the whole valley goes quiet for a second when it happens.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Nature has a way of grabbing your attention when you're least expecting it.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It sure does. That call made me look up so fast I almost tripped.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Keep your eyes open, maybe we’ll spot it gliding before we finish this trail.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I’m already scanning the sky—would be the highlight of the hike if we do!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you catch that up there? The eagle just swooped and let out this loud 'frill!'—it sent chills right through me.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No way, Olivia! I glanced up just in time to see it glide, but I missed the sound. That must’ve been wild!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It really was. Moments like this remind me why I love coming out here.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Same here. I feel like we stumble into something incredible every time we explore these trails.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Let’s keep our eyes open—a second sighting would make today even more epic.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You read my mind. I’ll get my binoculars ready for round two!

meaning: A collection of short and small branches, producing a frizzy appearance.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Check out that shrub—its top is completely fruz after last night’s storm!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Wow, you're right! It looks like it's having a wild hair day or something.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every time we get heavy wind, that spot turns into a tangled masterpiece.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: It’s kind of awesome, honestly. Gives the park some extra personality.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Imagine a squirrel trying to run through that—total obstacle course vibes.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If I were a squirrel, I’d claim it as my secret fortress!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you take a look at the trees behind the old house today?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Yeah, I walked past them! They looked kind of scraggly, didn’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Some of those branches stuck out in all directions, almost like a messy haircut.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It’s true—I don’t think I’ve seen branches twist and poke out like that before!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Exactly, the way the little branches clumped together gave the whole bottom half a real fruz.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That word nails it! I’ll definitely remember 'fruz' next time I see a tree like that.

meaning: A small chubby person. Chiefly used as a term of endearment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at Max waddling around the playground in his tiny jacket.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I can't get over how adorable he is, always running after the other kids with that big grin.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Every time I see that little fubb giggle, my heart just melts a bit more.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It's honestly the cutest thing. He has everyone wrapped around his finger.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I just want to scoop him up and squeeze those chubby cheeks.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let's get him a warm cocoa, I think our star buddy deserves a treat today.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You should've seen my nephew at the birthday party—he made a beeline for the cupcake table as soon as he arrived.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Smart kid. Did he manage to snag more than one?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, definitely. Anytime someone looked away, he’d sneak another, giggling and cheeks stuffed.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: No wonder—those cheeks are probably made for holding sweet loot!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He was so proud, marching around with sprinkles on his face like tiny battle scars.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: I can just picture that little fubb taking on the dessert table, fearless and adorable.

meaning: A small chubby person. Chiefly used as a term of endearment.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at those kids rolling down the hill—like little tumbleweeds!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Haha, the one in the yellow jacket almost disappeared in the grass for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Total fubbs vibes from him—he's just got that squishy, adorable energy.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: For sure! Reminds me of my cousin when he was tiny and used to waddle everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It's impossible not to smile watching them, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Yeah, little pals like him just spread good vibes all around.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at that little one waddling after the puppy—so adorable!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He’s got the roundest cheeks I’ve ever seen. I can’t stop smiling watching him.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: And his little arms barely reach around the puppy’s fluff. It’s too much!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He’s such a fubbs—tiny, chubby, and just the happiest little ball of energy.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Definitely! You just want to scoop him up and squish those cheeks.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He’s got the whole playground wrapped around his little finger, that’s for sure.

meaning: To jumble (up).

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Why does the bookshelf look like a windstorm tore through it? My novels are all out of order!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Sorry, I tried to find that mystery book you lent me, and I totally managed to fubble the rows in the process.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ah, that makes sense! No wonder I found cookbooks next to horror stories.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let me help you rearrange everything. We can even come up with a new sorting system if you want.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That might be a good idea! Alphabetical, by color, or by genre—what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Genre sounds fun. I’ll grab the pile on the floor while you start on the middle shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: My closet exploded again—shirts in my sock drawer and shoes under the blankets.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That sounds chaotic. Did you try your color-coding trick this time?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I tried, but halfway through, I got distracted and things spiraled.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Classic Rachel move—start strong, fubble everything, and then wonder where that one blue sweater ended up.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Hey, that sweater has a mind of its own, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Maybe we should tackle the closet together before it grows legs and escapes next time.

meaning: To puff. Said of a breeze, fire, etc.; also, of a person in anger or out of breath.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Never thought a walk from the bus stop would turn into such a full-body cardio session!

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Yeah, I saw you battling the wind outside—'fuff fuff' everywhere, and you came in fuff-ing like you'd just run a marathon.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Seriously, it felt like the air had a vendetta against me. My hair's still standing on end.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Been there! Last Tuesday, I ended up with leaves in my jacket pocket thanks to a surprise gust.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Next time I’m bringing goggles and maybe an anchor just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Or just lean into it—pretend you’re on some epic arctic expedition. Makes it almost fun!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It's getting chilly, Liam. Can you try starting the fire again?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Alright, one more time... A gentle spark, and—*fuff fuff*—there! Come on, catch!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I think I see smoke this time! Keep going, it's working.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Almost there, just need a bit more patience.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: If we get this fire started, s'mores are on me.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Now that’s motivation. Let’s do this!

meaning: To throw into disorder; to jerk about; to hustle, treat with contumely.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If chaos had a soundtrack, today at the office would have been blasting it on repeat.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Sounds intense! Was it another one of those all-hands-on-deck kind of days?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Worse. Teams swapped projects, the printer jammed nonstop, and nobody could find the meeting notes.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Honestly, I don't know how you keep your head straight in all that madness.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I barely did—Jenna fuffled my workspace so badly, my files are still wandering the office somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: That's just wild. Maybe tomorrow your files will find their way home—and Jenna finds some chill.

dialogue.speaker: Erin
dialogue.text: Nothing wakes you up on a Monday quite like unexpected chaos, let me tell you.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Did something crazy happen at work again, or was it your commute this time?

dialogue.speaker: Erin
dialogue.text: It was the lobby—just as I stepped inside, a crew rushed in for a delivery and totally fuffled the place. Papers scattered, chairs askew, it was wild.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously? Sounds like you had a front row seat to the mess.

dialogue.speaker: Erin
dialogue.text: Right? I practically had to tiptoe around just to get to the elevator.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Makes me glad I only had a sleepy barista to contend with this morning!

meaning: To play (on a guitar) with the fingers.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That riff you played earlier totally caught my ear. How do you make it sound so textured?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I just like experimenting, you know? Sometimes my fingers find their own path on the strings.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Can you show me that technique up close? It looked so fluid from across the room.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Watch this—when I go fum, fum across the strings, it gives the chords a gentle spring. Feel that?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that motion makes the melody almost dance. It's got so much life.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's the fun part. Let me slow it down and you can join in with me.

dialogue.speaker: Evelyn
dialogue.text: I just spent the last hour working on that new song in my room—my fingers are in desperate need of a break.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: You and your endless guitar sessions! Did you change up your playing style this time?

dialogue.speaker: Evelyn
dialogue.text: A little bit, yeah. I was messing around with the rhythm and dynamics to see what felt right.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Let me guess, you added one of those mellow parts where it almost sounds like a different instrument?

dialogue.speaker: Evelyn
dialogue.text: Exactly, there’s this section where I just fum through the chords instead of striking them and it completely changes the mood.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Now that’s what I’m looking forward to—with that touch, your set will definitely stand out.

meaning: To kick.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Can you believe how the ball rebounded off that post? I still can't get over it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It was wild! I thought it was going to sail way over, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: But then Ethan ran up out of nowhere and—funk!—right into the top corner. The crowd went nuts.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I know! That was the moment the whole match changed.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Makes you want to get out there and try pulling off a shot like that yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let’s just say my sneakers have never come close to making a sound like that!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That shot I took at the park earlier almost ended up in the pond instead of the goal.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You really lined it up and went full-on funk with that ball! It took off like a rocket.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I had no idea my foot could launch something that far, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: The ducks had no clue what was happening—one minute they're chilling, next minute, incoming soccer ball.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Guess I owe them an apology and maybe a safer spot for my next attempt.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Or we bring a net next time, so you don’t accidentally relocate the wildlife!

meaning: A bustle or commotion out of proportion to the occasion; a needless or excessive display of concern about anything; ostentatious or officious activity.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Talk about making a fuss over a cup of coffee—Janet just dropped her mug, and suddenly the whole office is practically staging a rescue operation.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think half the team just wanted an excuse to take a break. Still, coffee did go flying in every direction.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: True, but all that dramatic dashing around seemed a bit much for some spilled caffeine.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: I almost grabbed a mop myself, just from the sudden commotion! It was contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Maybe we should just keep a warning sign ready: 'Caution, coffee zone.'

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: If only we could serve coffee without the theatrics—one can dream!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe how everyone rushed over when Jamie dropped his lunch tray in the break room.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I was finishing up some emails, but I heard all the voices and footsteps—what actually happened?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was literally just a spilled drink and a sandwich on the floor, but folks made it sound like a major emergency.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It’s wild how just a clatter can set off such a fuss; people were practically tripping over themselves with suggestions and towels.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Right? Jamie just kept saying he was fine, but no one would let it drop for ages.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think it brightened up an otherwise dull Monday for everyone involved.

meaning: To make a bustle or commotion out of proportion to the occasion.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe the chaos in the kitchen when the coffee machine stopped working.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Oh, I saw Anna nearly spill her laptop in the scramble for instant coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Someone even started circulating a sign-up sheet for emergency supplies.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Did Marsha get involved too? She’s always prepared for a caffeine crisis.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She showed up with two French presses and a thermos, leading a mini seminar on manual brewing.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I just watched the whole fustle from my desk with my own mug, honestly amused.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You'd think they were giving away gold in the conference room with all that crowd this morning.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Seriously, all that for a box of doughnuts? I could barely squeeze in to get a napkin.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I overheard Mark claiming he skipped breakfast just for today. He looked way too pleased about those sprinkles.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And let's not forget the photos—someone was actually arranging the box for the perfect shot.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's almost as if they've never seen a doughnut before.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: It’s pure fustle whenever there’s free food; they just can’t help themselves.

meaning: To whistle.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Did that sparrow just try to imitate you, or was that actually you making that sound?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You caught me! I was practicing again, but my whistling still needs a lot of work.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: That's the spirit, Jack! Want to show me your best attempt?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, brace yourself. Here comes my masterpiece.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Wow, that was a very determined 'fute'—you're halfway to impressing the pigeons, at least!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Just wait, a few more tries and I'll have the whole park joining in!

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That popcorn was the real star tonight. I could eat another bucket right now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You and your snacks! Oh, check out that blue jay on the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Back in school, I’d always try to call birds over on the walk home.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Is this your moment to shine? Let’s see your famous bird call.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: *puckers lips and whistles toward the bird*

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That was a perfect fute! The blue jay actually looked this way for a second.

meaning: To make the humming sibilant sound characteristic of bees and other insects.
Loose volatile matter; a mass of fine, light, fluffy particles.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I always forget how alive this garden gets in the summer.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: No kidding, just look at all those bees weaving between the sunflowers.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Stand still for a second—you can catch the soft fuzz they make as they zigzag around us.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: That’s actually kind of mesmerizing, like a natural soundtrack for the afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Makes me wish I brought my sketchbook to capture it all.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Let’s circle back here next week, and you can draw while I keep an eye out for more wildlife.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at that—the lavender's attracting a whole army of bees again.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You picked the perfect spot for those flowers. Seems like they're putting on quite a show for their little visitors.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There's this low sound floating over from the bushes—kind of feels like the whole place is alive.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That always happens this time of year. They really get into their work.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's oddly comforting, just sitting here listening to them while the sun's out.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Sometimes if you close your eyes, you can almost picture them fuzz between the petals and leaves, all busy and content.

meaning: To talk much or glibly; to chatter, prate.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, that was quite the marathon meeting. My coffee didn't even last halfway through.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Right? I could practically hear my stomach growling by the end. We really need a timer for these.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe next time we should suggest a buzzer every thirty minutes. Keep things moving!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Oh, definitely. Otherwise, once Chris starts to gab about his new project, there’s no reeling him back in.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No kidding! I lost count of how many tangents we went on today.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: At least we got some popcorn-worthy stories out of it. Next time, I’m showing up with snacks.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Would you believe I almost walked past this café and missed your wild hair in the window?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Honestly, with us, it’s impossible not to stop—we always end up gabbing till the chairs are stacked on the tables!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You say that, but you always have the best stories—I still remember the one about the raccoon and the pizza box.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Hey, that raccoon had more ambition than half my coworkers! Speaking of, how did that art show of yours turn out?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Miraculously, my painting didn’t fall off the wall this time and someone even left a note asking about commissions.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: See, I knew you’d blow everyone away! Now spill every detail—I want to picture it from the first brushstroke to the last applause.

meaning: To talk volubly, to jabber.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You should've seen Mark at lunch today—he just started to gabber about his new project, and the whole table tuned out after five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Classic Mark move. He gets so swept up, it's like everyone else vanishes.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I almost knocked over my coffee trying to signal a rescue mission.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Speaking of rescue missions, how's your own workload shaping up?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It's a bit of a juggling act right now, but I finally wrapped up that big proposal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That calls for a celebratory donut run—let's plot our escape route after this!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If you ever need background noise, just hang out near Ryan from IT. He can gabber longer than a podcast host; I swear, I escaped his latest epic halfway through his story about garden gnomes.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That sounds like prime entertainment! Did you at least get something useful out of it, or just gnome trivia?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Mainly gnome trivia, honestly. I now know more about miniature hats than any sane person should.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I have to admit, I'm probably guilty of cornering people myself when I get going.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Oh, trust me, I’m aware. Remember your legendary monologue about sandwich bread at last year’s picnic?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Touché! Maybe we should have a minute glass to keep us in check next team lunch.

meaning: To talk volubly, inarticulately and incoherently; to chatter, jabber, prattle.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe the noise at my nephew’s party—kids everywhere, adults talking over each other.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh no, was it hard to catch up with anyone in all that commotion?

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Totally! The kitchen was just a constant gabble—couldn’t focus on a single conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds exhausting. Did you manage to escape after a while?

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: I did! I took shelter on the porch for a bit of peace and quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Smart move. Sometimes stepping outside is the only way to keep your sanity at those gatherings.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, that was quite the circus in the conference room, wasn’t it? My notes are all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Tell me about it—the whole thing was just a gabble. I could barely pick out what anyone was actually saying.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: By the time they got to the new policy updates, I’d already lost the thread.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought someone might start juggling papers just to add to the chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least the donuts survived the meeting madness—I needed that sugar rush.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe if we put our heads together, we can reconstruct what actually happened in there.

meaning: To jerk; to strike with a sharp blow. Also, to toss up (the head).
To strangle, suffocate.
A ‘made-up’ story; a piece of deception, an imposture, a lie.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Wow, Liam, this canoe is wobblier than I thought! I hope it doesn't tip us over.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Just keep your balance and follow my lead. I promise, we won't end up swimming today.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Are you sure? The river's moving pretty fast after that rain last night.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Yeah, but if we paddle steady and don't overreact to the swirls, we'll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm trusting you. My paddle is ready!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Whoa! Did you feel that? The canoe just gagged sideways when we hit that rock. Grab the edge!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Would you look at Charlie go! That ball never stood a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He's like a rocket—never slows down for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every time he gets close, I swear he adds a little drama for the crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, that last run he did, he gave his head a big gag before sprinting back with the prize.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's his signature move—I bet everyone here recognizes it by now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: He’s the star of the park for a reason! Keeps everyone entertained.

meaning: Of geese: to cackle.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: There’s our feathery fan club again, taking over the whole pond.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: You can hear them gaggle from halfway across the park—those geese really make an entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It sounds like they’re trying to outdo each other, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: Honestly, if they had microphones, we’d never get a quiet walk again.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: At least they keep things lively around here.

dialogue.speaker: Samuel
dialogue.text: For sure—nature’s own improv troupe, just with more feathers.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you ever want to feel like the main attraction, just eat lunch by the lake—those geese have no concept of personal space.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously! Did they do their usual routine, or did something new happen?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So, I'm minding my own business with a bagel, and suddenly five geese materialize out of nowhere, eyeing every bite.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds like the start of a showdown! Did they just stare you down, or was there more to it?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, they definitely amped it up—they began to gaggle all at once, as if they were trying to outdo each other in sheer volume.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I can only imagine the noise! Next time, you might need a sign: 'Quiet Zone—No Goose Gatherings Allowed.'

meaning: An exclamation indicating impatience or exasperation.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: If this slideshow eats one more photo, I swear I’m going to turn this computer into scrap metal.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Try dumping the cache or something? You’ve been at this for two hours straight.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: I thought that might help, but it’s still freezing—gah, why does this always happen when I’m on a tight deadline!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Sounds like a textbook case of technology betrayal. Want me to bring over some snacks and moral support?

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Honestly, at this point, I’m ready to accept offerings of chocolate for the tech gods.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Chocolate and a backup flash drive coming your way. You’re not alone in this fight.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Are we sure this bookshelf isn’t missing a step? The diagrams just look like blobs to me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let me flip the page—there’s got to be a logical order. Maybe if we start with all the dowels first?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’m trying, but this little wooden peg will not fit. Did we mix up the sides again?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Gah, these instructions are just making it worse! Every picture looks the same!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m pulling up a how-to video before either of us throws this thing out the window.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Bless you for thinking of that. Maybe the internet will save our Saturday.

meaning: The most rapid movement of a horse (occasionally of other quadrupeds), in which in the course of each stride the animal is entirely off the ground, with the legs flexed under the body.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You should've seen Lightning on the track today—when he broke into a gallop, it sent chills down my spine! The energy was just electric out there.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I can imagine! Horses like Lightning always steal the spotlight with moves like that.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Honestly, the crowd barely blinked, everyone was glued to the rail. It's moments like that which make these races unforgettable.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No kidding. That split second when it all comes together—it’s worth every minute at the track.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Maybe one day, we'll be watching from the winner’s circle instead of the stands.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Now that's a vision I can get behind! Let’s keep dreaming big.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The countryside was buzzing today—there must have been at least twenty horses out on the trails when I went for my walk.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That sounds majestic! The last time I was near a pasture, one of the stallions suddenly broke into a gallop across the field. The sound of his hooves drumming so fast gave me goosebumps.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I can almost picture it. Horses have such an impressive presence when they move like that.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Completely agree. For a second, everything else just faded into the background except for that wild energy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Now I really want to see a horse show up close—maybe I’ll look for an event next weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let’s do it! I bet watching them together would be unforgettable.

meaning: To devour or eat greedily; to gulp down.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I can’t believe how good these burgers look. My mouth is watering already.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Right? I’ve been dreaming about this place all week.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Okay, first bite coming up... Mmm, that’s incredible.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You make it look like the best thing you’ve ever tasted!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Honestly, these fries are so good I just want to gamp the entire basket before you get any.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ll fight you for the last fry if I have to!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at that—pizza’s barely hit the table and you’ve already got a slice in each hand!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: What can I say? There’s something magical about extra cheese and pepperoni.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You make it disappear faster than I can grab my napkin.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, you know me—never one to let good food go uneaten.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: If you keep that up, the rest of us are going to leave hungry.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Sorry! Sometimes I just gamp my way through meals without even thinking about it.

meaning: To growl, snarl; to chatter, chide; to chirp, twitter.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Looks like we've stumbled into a stand-off—see that spaniel giving the pigeons the stink-eye?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He’s practically quivering with impatience, but those pigeons aren’t budging an inch.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It’s like a silent battle of nerves. I half expected feathers to fly by now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Instead, everyone’s settled into a weird truce—except for that one bird on the end, eyeing him back.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: If only they could speak, I’d love to hear what’s being said in their version of this drama.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You can almost hear it—dog giving off his garre and the pigeons tossing their own garre right back, nobody willing to back down.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You would've laughed—Charlie tried to chase a squirrel through the window again this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let me guess: all that frantic pawing and his usual garre noises—he never lets those backyard visitors go in peace.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He was full of energy, that's for sure. My coffee nearly spilled with how much of a ruckus he caused.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That pup has more spirit in the mornings than I do after two espressos.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: And once the squirrel darted off, he just plopped down with the most innocent face.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Charlie’s daily adventures are better than any reality show—I’ll never get tired of hearing about them.

meaning: A loud noisy laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Picture this—I'm juggling a stack of books and somehow the door swings right into my path.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let me guess, the books didn't survive the encounter?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, they flew everywhere, and as soon as I made eye contact with the librarian, gawf! I just lost it right then and there.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You really have a flair for dramatic entrances—and exits.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At least I gave the reading room some entertainment for the day.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I'm bringing popcorn next time you visit the library, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you see Josh slip on the cafeteria floor today? He tried to play it cool, but that tray went flying!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Gawf! Just picturing it is cracking me up. Only Josh could fall that dramatically.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: And then he stands right up like nothing happened, but his mashed potatoes landed in someone’s bag.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: How is it that he always ends up at the center of chaos?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I swear, if there’s a mess within ten feet, Josh will find it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Remind me never to carry soup when he’s around.

meaning: To bawl out.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You look like you just walked out of a storm—was your meeting with Mr. Carter really that bad?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I wish it were just bad, Rachel. It was a total disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Uh oh, was this about the inventory mix-up?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Exactly. Somehow my numbers made it into the wrong spreadsheet and the clients saw it before I caught the mistake.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That sounds brutal. How did Mr. Carter handle it?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He didn’t hold back at all—he started to gawl at me right there in front of everyone, and it just kept getting louder.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I can see that look—you survived another wild meeting, didn’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: You have no idea. As soon as I walked in, Mr. Harlan started to gawl at me about last week’s numbers. The whole team just froze.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yikes, I don’t envy you at all right now. That sounds brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: He really caught me off guard. I just wanted the floor to swallow me up.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If you want to vent, you can let it all out here—no judgment zone.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Honestly, I might take you up on that offer. I need to decompress somehow.

meaning: To garbage (fish).

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I’ve been replaying your fishing adventure in my head—did you manage to land anything wild out there?

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: With the way things went, I’m surprised my rod survived. I swear the lake was playing tricks on me.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That spot can be brutal—sometimes all you get are bites from mysteries below.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Exactly! Every time I felt a tug, I’d reel in, crossing my fingers for a trophy.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Let me guess, it turned into a full-on geremumble session by the end, right?

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: You read my mind. Next time I’m bringing a magnet instead of a lure!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: The lake looks calm today. I bet the big ones are hiding out there.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You say that every time and somehow I end up reeling in surprises instead of dinner.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe your luck will change, or did you bring that bright red lure again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I did, but the last time I used it, it was nothing but geremumble all afternoon—no wonder I smelled like the dump by the time we packed up.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That explains why the ducks kept following you around till we left.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hey, maybe the ducks know something we don’t! I’m ready for round two today.

meaning: To speak rapidly and inarticulately; to chatter, talk nonsense. Said also of an ape.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Would you look at that one? He just sits up there and gibbers at everyone passing by—total show-off!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, that’s the energy I need on Monday mornings. Zero filter, just making noise and grabbing attention.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Right? Sometimes I wish I could just climb up somewhere and chat nonsense without a care.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You kind of do, though. Remember karaoke night last week?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Hey, at least I kept my feet on the ground. Compared to these guys, I’m basically dignified.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sure, but if you ever start swinging from the rafters, I’m recording it for proof!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, those capuchin monkeys are really going wild in that tree.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, you can actually hear them gibber up there, like they're having a rowdy conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It’s hilarious! They’re louder than half the kids on the playground.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: And the way they jump from branch to branch—it's like an acrobatic show.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If I could climb like that, I'd never walk anywhere again.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously! I think they'd win gold at the monkey Olympics.

meaning: A squeaking noise.
To move backwards and forwards.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This couch is actually more comfortable than it looks, Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know it’s a little old, but it’s my favorite spot during movie nights.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Whoa—did you notice that noise when I shifted?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: It does that every now and then. I guess the springs have their own personality.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It almost startled me. It’s like the couch is talking back.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Every time someone sits there, it lets out that little 'gig gig'—keeps things interesting, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Dragging that chair in here again, Jake? You must really love punishment.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I have to fix it! Every time I sit, it makes this obnoxious sound.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let me guess—it gets worse when you lean back? Go on, give it a try.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Watch—if I tilt just a little... there it goes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yep, that's definitely the infamous gig you warned me about. It sounds like a mouse orchestra in your seat.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Told you! Either I lube it up tonight or we both go mad by Friday.

meaning: To laugh continuously in a manner not uproarious, but suggestive either of foolish levity or uncontrollable amusement.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Why are you hiding your phone and grinning like that? What are you up to, Jack?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Nothing! Well... okay, I found this ridiculous video of a cat wearing sunglasses, jamming out to disco music.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sounds way too good. You have to show me!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, here it is! Check out how seriously it takes its dance moves—look at that little paw spin.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh my—giggle—how is it so committed? giggle The glasses aren't even falling off—giggle

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I knew you’d love it! Now I’m laughing more at your reaction than the cat itself.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Tell me you saw the whole chair fiasco with Sam during lunch today.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: How could I miss it? He nearly launched himself across the cafeteria like a circus act.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: And then he just froze there, clutching his sandwich for dear life—did you notice that?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Absolutely! The best part was when he tried to act all normal while everyone was gawking.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, I was barely holding it together, especially when his napkin got stuck to his shoe as he stood up.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Seriously, that whole scene will live rent-free in my mind—giggle—just picturing his face gets me every time.

meaning: To jingle, to tinkle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That noise keeps coming from the hallway again—did you move something out there?

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: No, I haven't touched anything. What kind of noise is it?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's faint, like something small is being shaken back and forth.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Let me check my keys—I left them on the shoe rack earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whenever you pick them up, they go ging, ging and echo down the hallway. That's exactly it.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Mystery solved! Guess I'll hang them up so they don't keep making a scene.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Something just sounded off in the hallway, did you notice it too?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No, not really. What kind of sound did you hear?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It went ging, ging twice, like from somewhere near the shoe rack.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You think your keys finally slipped off that hook again?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Either that or Oscar just knocked his collar against the umbrella stand.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, let's see which culprit it is this time.

meaning: To come like a flash of light.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My brain’s been circling this essay topic for hours and nothing was clicking.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oof, that’s the worst. Did anything finally spark, or are you still at square one?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Out of nowhere—glash—this wild idea popped into my head while I was making tea.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s epic! The universe really delivered when you least expected it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Right? Now I'm itching to get started before that energy disappears.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Run with it, Soph! Those are the best ideas—the ones that hit you sideways.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You ever have one of those mornings where everything just feels a bit off?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: All the time—something weird happen to you again?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I was running late, shoes untied, backpack half open, the whole works.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like your typical Monday, but I sense there’s more.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Just as I reached the corner, this bright blue car came glash around the bend—I nearly dropped my coffee!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No wonder you look wide-eyed. That’d wake anyone up faster than caffeine!

meaning: To swallow (drink or food) quickly or in large mouthfuls, to gulp; to drink or eat gluttonously.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Wow, did you see that? I just globbe-ed down the entire smoothie before I could even taste it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Seriously? You finished it that fast? I was going to ask for a sip!

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Sorry! I didn't even realize until my cup was empty. It was just too good.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time, pace yourself. Maybe try enjoying it a little instead of inhaling it.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: I know, I know. I’ll try to resist, but no promises if there’s mango involved.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Then I guess I’ll guard my mango smoothie with my life next time.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That mountain of pasta was made for champions—look at the steam rising off it!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My stomach is basically singing just looking at it. I skipped breakfast for this moment.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Dive in before I change my mind and snag your plate.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t stand a chance—I’m practically about to inhale it.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You work some serious fork magic, Sophie. I blinked and half your plate is gone.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sometimes I just lose all table manners and globbe everything when I’m this hungry!

meaning: A gluttonous eater.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you see the dessert table? I think they baked an entire bakery just for tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: I’ve already got my eye on at least three different cakes. This place is dangerous.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You’re making those towers of food look easy—are you planning on sampling every dish here?

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Well, it’s not often I get this much variety. Someone has to do the heavy lifting.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: At this rate, you might need a bigger plate—and maybe a medal.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Guess it’s official—I’m the resident gloffer tonight, no contest!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You should’ve been at the Mitchell family cookout—there were ribs stacked higher than my chances of ever finishing them.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Stacked ribs sound like a delicious challenge. Did anyone actually manage to keep up?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Oh, trust me, it was every person for themselves. Especially once the brisket hit the table.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Was it chaos when it came time for dessert too?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Total chaos. You should’ve seen Ben—he was a real gloffer, plates clattering and cheeks puffed out, already eyeing the cherry pie before he’d even finished his ice cream.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Classic Ben. Next year, I’m bringing a stopwatch just to keep up with his dessert rounds.

meaning: To swallow greedily.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wow, Ethan, I blink and your burger is already half gone!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Don’t blame me—the chef outdid themselves today.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You’re eating like you haven’t seen food in days.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I mean, can you blame me? This is legendary lunch material.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: All I hear across the table is glop, glop, and suddenly your plate is empty.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hey, that’s just my appreciation in action! Want to swap bites before mine vanishes entirely?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Just look at all that cheese melting. This is what happiness looks like on a plate.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Honestly, if I could marry this lasagna, I might.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: First bite goes to me—wish me luck, this looks way too hot.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Don’t wimp out now, Jake. Dive right in!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hey, Maya, you’ve already cleared half your plate!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: I just get caught up in the taste and glop it all down before I know it!

meaning: To utter a series of short, quick, usually high-pitched sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Something’s rustling in that hedge again—got a feeling it’s our mysterious critter back.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: There it goes! Do you hear those weird, staccato noises? It’s almost like it’s performing a secret code.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Honestly, that little sound always creeps up on me. Every evening without fail.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s some kind of rare squirrel? City squirrels don’t usually sound like that, though.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: No, listen—right there, that ‘glotter glotter glotter’! See? As if it’s trying to get our attention on purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: It does sound deliberate. Next time, I’m bringing my camera; proof I’m not making this up!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Something's causing quite the ruckus by the fence—did you catch those tiny bursts of sound a second ago?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I sure did. It almost sounded like someone was rapidly clicking a bunch of marbles together. Any idea what's behind it?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I'm betting it's that cheeky chipmunk again. Last time he was out there, he nearly startled the cat with his antics.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Ha, that makes sense. The little guy does seem to have an endless supply of mischief and noise.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Listen—there it goes again! Glotter, glotter, glotter—he can't seem to stop making those quick chatters every time he finds a seed.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It cracks me up every time. That chipmunk practically has his own soundtrack out there.

meaning: An inarticulate sound rendered by this spelling.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You would not believe what happened when I tried that new snorkeling spot yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you find any treasure or just a bunch of seaweed?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: More like a face full of water! I tried to adjust my mask, and next thing I knew, I was flailing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That sounds like a scene from one of those underwater adventure cartoons.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I probably looked just as silly trying to get my footing. My arms were everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If someone had filmed you, I bet the best part would be you popping up making that classic 'glub glub' noise.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Alright, brace yourself—this chili has a reputation for sneaking up on people.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: (takes a spoonful) Glub—whew, that packs a punch!

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Did you just discover the dragon’s breath? You looked a little startled.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I wasn’t expecting the heat to hit so fast! That’s a flavor rollercoaster.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Consider yourself officially initiated. Only the bold make it to the second bowl.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Pass me the milk—if I survive this, I’ll earn my spot among the brave!

meaning: An inarticulate sound supposed to be expressed by this spelling.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Did you really just eat half your burger in one bite?

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Gluck—oops, sorry, didn’t mean to make that noise. Guess I was hungrier than I thought.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Should I keep my fries far away from you, just in case?

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: No worries, yours are safe. Unless I finish my burger too quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: At this rate, you’ll be eyeing dessert in a minute.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: What can I say? My appetite's on a mission today!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This stupid jar just won’t budge. My hands are slipping all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Here, use the towel—wait, oh—gluck—did you just make that noise, or was it the jar?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Pretty sure that sound came straight from me. I didn’t even know I could do that.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Well, now we both know your true powers are unlocked by stubborn lids.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m just handing it to you before I start inventing new noises.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Deal—though I’d miss these unexpected performances.

meaning: A word formed to imitate an inarticulate sound.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That pitcher is practically calling my name from the fridge.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I was just about to grab some iced tea—want me to pour you a glass too?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Oh, that glug, glug sound when it pours always makes me laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Right? It sounds like the tea is as eager to escape as we are to drink it.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: It adds extra anticipation—almost like a drumroll for refreshment.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Here’s your glass—the performance is complete!

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: Check this out—I found that sparkling water you like, and it’s ice-cold.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: You read my mind! Although, you always make drinking it sound like some sort of water feature.

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: What can I say? I take my hydration seriously.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Every time it’s just glug glug glug and I think the river’s running through our kitchen!

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: Maybe I just need a smaller bottle—or less enthusiasm.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Never lose the enthusiasm. The ambiance is half the fun!

meaning: To swallow or gulp down.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This lemonade looks twice as sour as I imagined—they weren't joking about the extra lemons.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Are you up for the challenge, or should I be the brave one and go first?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Let’s see you try—if you survive, I’ll give it a shot.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Glut-glut—wow, I didn’t expect you to down half the glass in one go!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Pucker up, Emma—this is actually really good once you get past the kick!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You really weren't kidding about loading up that hot sauce!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: My tongue is in full rebellion, Megan. I think steam's coming out of my ears.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You need a drink? There's a pitcher right here.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: *glut-glut* Whew! That almost put out the fire. Remind me not to be brave next time.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll just hand you a fire extinguisher with your meal.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If it comes with less drama, I’ll gladly take it!

meaning: A noise or fuss.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This place feels like the whole town decided to show up at once.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Seriously, that group by the jukebox is causing such a glutter—I can barely hear the music, let alone you.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It's wild, right? It's like they're putting on their own show over there.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Maybe we should move to that booth by the window. Might be a bit less chaotic.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Good call. I'd actually like to finish this coffee without shouting across the table.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Race you to it before someone else gets the idea!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Can you believe the glutter coming from next door? My headphones can't even drown it out.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I thought it was just my imagination! What's actually happening over there?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I'm not entirely sure, but it sounds like they're moving furniture and singing at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That's a new combo, even for them. Does this mean you're giving up on your online class for now?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At this point, I'm just embracing the chaos. Maybe I should just record it and send it to my professor as proof.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That would definitely make for an unforgettable excuse! Remind me never to rent the apartment next to these guys.

meaning: To strike (the teeth) together, as in rage or anguish.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Can you believe my laptop decided to crash right in the middle of the presentation draft? Of course it had to be today.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That’s unreal. Didn’t you save it on the cloud last night? Maybe there’s a backup hiding somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I thought I did, but it only backed up half of it. The worst part is, the QA section is just gone.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That’s the section that took you hours, isn’t it? No wonder you look like you’re ready to throw something.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, I practically lived with that document for a week. I keep going over every folder and temp file, but nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Ugh, thinking about that kind of setback just makes me go 'gnacche, gnacche'—I swear my jaw hurts from clenching now.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Can you believe they passed me over for the project lead... again? It's like my work just disappears.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Seriously? After all those late nights you pulled, that doesn't even make sense.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Exactly, and then Tom had the nerve to say he wasn't sure I was 'ready' yet.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That would make my blood boil. How did you even keep it together?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Sitting there at that table, I swear I could hear gnacche, just trying not to snap right back at him.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You handled it a lot better than most would—your patience is next level.

meaning: To bite in a snapping fashion.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you see that dog at the park try to steal my sandwich earlier?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah! I thought he was going to jump onto the picnic table.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: He snapped at it so quickly—gnap!—right before I could pull my hand away.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You reacted faster than I would have. That sandwich was almost history.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’m pretty sure he’s still eyeing our food from the bushes.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let’s pack up before we have another close call!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at this—when I held out a cracker, that squirrel came right up and went 'gnap!' before I could react.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Classic park squirrel move. They see food, and it’s all instinct.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No kidding! If I hadn’t moved, I’d be short a finger right now.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Guess they take snack time pretty seriously. Respect.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Maybe I’ll try with something softer next, like a piece of banana.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Just promise me you’ll keep all ten fingers. I’m not doing one-handed card games later.

meaning: To snarl, growl.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Would you look at that, there's a dog blocking the path ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He doesn't seem too happy we're here, his ears are pinned back.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear him gnar just now? Sounds like he's warning us off.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let's pause a second and act like we're not interested.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, if we keep our distance and act calm, he'll probably settle down.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: One step at a time—I'm not in the mood to test his patience.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that sound behind the gate? It was just—gnar, gnar—like something out of a cartoon!

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: I heard it loud and clear! That pooch has a serious attitude today.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Honestly, my heart skipped a beat. I wasn't expecting that kind of welcome on our stroll.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Let’s give it some space; I don’t fancy testing my luck with those teeth.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: You read my mind—detour it is. This block’s got more drama than daytime TV.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: If excitement is what we wanted, we definitely found it. Onward to quieter adventures!

meaning: To nip, bite. Of a horse: To champ (the bit).

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at Chestnut stomping around again—he's got more energy than the whole barn put together.

dialogue.speaker: Caleb
dialogue.text: He gets like that whenever someone walks in with a bucket; you should see the way he tries to push open the stall door.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Does he still get fidgety when you fit his bridle?

dialogue.speaker: Caleb
dialogue.text: Oh, every single time. Yesterday I thought he'd twist right out of my hands, the way he kept tossing his head.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That makes sense—last time, he gave the bit a sharp gnip, looked at me with those big eyes, and acted completely innocent.

dialogue.speaker: Caleb
dialogue.text: Classic Chestnut. He really knows how to keep us guessing what he'll do next.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen Daisy in the paddock earlier—she had more attitude than usual.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Did she try one of her little stunts again? She loves keeping you on your toes.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, the second I brought out her reins, she tried to gnip at the leather like she was chewing bubble gum. Almost made me drop everything!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: That’s classic Daisy—always testing her limits. Hope your fingers survived the ordeal.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Barely! I’ll have to bring out my secret stash of apple slices next time to distract her.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: If apples calm her down, you might need a whole barrel by next week!

meaning: Of a male turkey: to make its characteristic gurgling sound in the throat.
Representing the characteristic gurgling sound made by a male turkey in its throat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wow, Jake, look at those huge feathers! That turkey looks like he owns the place.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: He’s definitely strutting his stuff. Those tail fans are impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Seriously! But do they just peck around, or do they make any cool sounds?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, they’re way more vocal than you’d think.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Like this? Gobble gobble gobble! I always wondered who in the animal kingdom made that noise.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You nailed it! That’s the soundtrack of every Thanksgiving parade.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what happened when I visited Oak Meadow Farm yesterday—I practically got surrounded by the birds near the barn.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounds intense! What kind of birds did you run into? Please don’t say geese, I’ve heard they’re aggressive.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Nope, it was the turkeys! The big one puffed up and started walking circles around me, letting out the wildest 'gobble gobble' right in my direction.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That’s amazing! Did you try to mimic him back or were you too startled to make a sound?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Honestly, I froze for a second, then burst out laughing. The other kids nearby couldn’t stop giggling either.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Farm adventures always make the best memories. Next time, I’m bringing popcorn to see the show!

meaning: Of persons: To turn the eyes to one side or other, to look obliquely, to squint.
Of a male turkey: to make its characteristic gurgling sound in the throat.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Would you look at the man by the pastry case? I swear, he acts like he’s anticipating a squirrel to leap out at any second.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: How so? I’ve only seen him tap his foot a hundred times.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He keeps scanning the room, and his eyes dart from side to side like he’s plotting something elaborate.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Oh, I caught that! Every minute or so, he suddenly starts to goggle at someone new—it's almost impressive, really.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If he’s auditioning for the lead in ‘The Watchful Customer,’ he’s nailing it.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Maybe I should join him and see who notices first—might be the most thrilling part of my day.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Did you notice the guy at the coffee table? He looks like he's in a spy movie or something.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Yeah, I saw him! I swear I just watched his eyes goggle over at us when he thought we weren't looking.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Seriously, it’s like his eyes are trying to check out every corner without moving his head.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Maybe he's looking for someone, or maybe he just enjoys being mysterious.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Well, it's definitely making my morning more interesting!

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Same here! Let's see if he tries to goggle at anyone else before we leave.

meaning: Of a pig: To grunt or snort, as in rage.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Next time you wander by the barn, keep an eye on Daisy—this morning she started golf, golf, golf the moment I came near her trough, sent straw flying everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh wow, she really put on a little show, huh? Was it just you she was aiming at?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Not just me—she wouldn't let Sam refill her water, either. She acted like we were out to steal her breakfast.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Classic Daisy. That pig guards her food like it's treasure.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Eventually I just tossed her an extra cob of corn and she settled down enough for us to get the chores done.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Corn to the rescue! I’ll remember to keep my pockets stocked before I step inside tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wow, look at all those piglets running around! They’re adorable but noisy.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously, I’ve never heard so much squealing in one place before.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you notice that big one near the trough? He seems a little irritated.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, when the others got too close, he went 'golf, golf' and chased them off!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He really knows how to assert himself. No one messes with his lunch.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Guess every group has its grumpy leader—even among pigs!

meaning: To utter loud but thick and scarcely articulate sounds; to shout.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: There’s barely a spot to stand, let alone squeeze past these baskets of tomatoes.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Guess the whole neighborhood decided to stock up at once—check out the scene by the bakery.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Looks like the baker’s having words with someone, but I can’t catch a single sentence from here.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He just started to gollar right in the middle of everything—like the world’s noisiest alarm clock.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: If his point was to get attention, mission accomplished—my ears are still ringing.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let’s take the long way around; I’d rather dodge flying baguettes today.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Still trying to calm down after that concert, and it's already the next day! How is that even possible?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No kidding! My voice is almost gone from singing along. It was something else.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: When the drummer started that solo, the entire arena just lit up. You could feel it in your bones.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: The energy in there was electric. I honestly thought the balcony might come down with all that stomping.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: And the lead singer? He just kept pushing it higher and higher. I don’t know how he does it every night.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Right at the peak, he started to gollar, and the crowd totally lost it. I’ve never seen anything quite like that before.

meaning: To utter loud but thick and scarcely articulate sounds; to shout.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That thumping from upstairs is shaking the picture frames again.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Sounds like a herd of elephants up there, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I hope they haven’t knocked over the lamp this time.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: I’ll take a peek. Knowing them, there’s probably a pillow fort involved.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Well? Should I grab the bandages or the camera?

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Neither! They’re just leaping around in blankets, making these wild goller sounds at each other like it’s a battle royale.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Last night was wild—did you hear that racket coming from down the street? It nearly knocked me out of bed.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: I was halfway through a movie and suddenly thought, ‘What on earth is going on out there?’ Sounded like chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Right? I swear I thought someone was starting a midnight wrestling match with their own shadow.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Could’ve been those teens from Oakridge again, but it didn’t sound like regular shouting.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You know, there should be a word for that kind of yelling—you know, when it’s just noise, completely out of control.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Oh, there is. My grandma always used to say folks were out there gollering when things got that loud and messy.

meaning: To shout with a thick voice.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Golly! Did you catch that three-pointer? This place almost shook with that shot!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Ben, you nearly made me spill my popcorn! What happened now?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You missed it, Rachel! Jones just nailed a shot from way past the arc.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No way! I looked down for a second, trust me to miss the wildest moments.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously, this crowd is getting louder every minute. My throat’s already hoarse.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Brace yourself, I have a feeling we’re not done shouting yet!

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I can't believe the band got this loud after the opening act, Riley! My voice is giving up trying to reach you.

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: You just hit me with a golly so strong, I think half the crowd turned around!

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: It was either that or waving my arms like a maniac, so pick your poison.

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: I'll take the yelling—I don't want you accidentally elbowing strangers again.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Maybe I should start passing notes. At least paper doesn't come with an echo.

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: If you do, make sure it's not another origami swan—I still have the last one from the festival stuffed in my jacket pocket.

meaning: To make an inarticulate cooing or gurgling noise such as that made by babies and small children.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Would you look at Ellie in that tiny hat? She’s stealing the whole show on the couch.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: She really is. I think she knows everyone’s watching her, too.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Her little noises are honestly the cutest part. That’s pure happiness right there.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Seriously, it makes me want to laugh every time she does it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Goo goo! Hear that? She’s definitely performing for us.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: She’s already got her fan club. I think she knows exactly what she’s doing!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at Mia’s little face—she’s absolutely fascinated by your necklace.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Did you catch that little goo she just made? She always does that when something shiny catches her eye.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It’s like her way of saying she approves!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I wish I could bottle up that sound forever.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Seriously, nothing makes my heart melt more than her little noises.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: She’s got all of us wrapped around her finger—no question about it.

meaning: An imitative representation of baby talk.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Check out that little guy on the blanket—he’s absolutely fascinated by those pigeons.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: He really is! That smile could melt anyone’s heart.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at him go—he's babbling away, goo-goo and all, like he's hosting his own show.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It’s hilarious! He seems to have a lot to say about bird watching.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If only grown-up conversations were as entertaining.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Right? We could all use a little more babble and joy in our days.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You would not believe how this little baby at the café just looked up at me, wide-eyed, and went 'goo-goo' right after stealing my muffin’s spotlight.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That kind of cuteness should come with a warning label; I bet everyone nearby melted instantly.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She had the sweetest cheeks and kept giggling every time I waved—totally stole the show.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Little ones always seem to have perfect timing for making people smile, don’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Absolutely, I found myself grinning back like a total goof.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Who needs a comedy show with babies like that around? They have the world’s best jokes up their sleeves!

meaning: To make a low rumbling noise, as bubbles rising through water, or as is heard in the bowels.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If this stew gets any thicker, I might need to call for backup.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hey, you’re the chef here—just don’t let it turn into concrete!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No promises. Want to pass me those thyme sprigs?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Sure thing. Wait—did the pot just make a weird sound, or was that you?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That was all the stew. It just did a big gothele right after I stirred—listen, it's doing it again!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It sounds like it’s brewing up its own storm. I think we created a monster dinner.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
