dialogue.text: Maybe Max needs a little more music and a little less pacing from me tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If you start humming softly, I bet he’ll melt right into sleep. Give it a shot and let me know!

meaning: To utter the cries by which certain African peoples express delight.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what just happened—I got the promotion I've been working toward all year!

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: That’s incredible news! Did your manager call you into the office or was it a surprise email?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It was an email at first, but when I opened it, I just had to let out a huge lulliloo! My whole team turned around in shock—I was so thrilled I couldn't hold it in.

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: Now that’s the energy I’m talking about. I bet the whole office felt your excitement.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Absolutely, every bit of stress just melted away in that moment. Hard work really does pay off.

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: Let’s toast to your success over dinner tonight. This definitely calls for a celebration!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened—I just got the email saying our photo was chosen for the city art exhibit!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No way! Lulliloo! That's the best news I've heard all week, Rachel. All that time in the park paid off.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I know, right? I kept rereading the message, sure I'd imagined it.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Our work is finally getting noticed—people are going to see our vision up close.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I can't wait to tell Emily and Mark. This feels like the start of something really special.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let’s make sure to celebrate this big step together—tonight’s got to be memorable!

meaning: The sound made by the fall of a soft heavy body.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, one last push and we should have this beanbag in place.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Careful now—those things have a mind of their own. Should we angle it toward the bookshelf?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hang on—oh no, my grip slipped and... lunch! Right on your foot, sorry!

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: No harm done, just startled me. That sound was ridiculous though.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It really does make a scene every time it lands. Maybe we need to start treating it like a wild animal.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Agreed. Next time, we bring snacks for the beast beanbag before we move it again.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, Sam, let’s slide this big pillow off the couch and onto the floor over there. You grab that side.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Got it, but this thing is even bulkier than I remembered! Ready? Okay, here we go.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Almost there—careful—now... lunch! There’s nothing like the sound of it landing.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Haha, that was oddly satisfying. The room feels way cozier already.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, and I think I earned a quick breather after that little workout.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Agreed. How about we claim this spot and relax for a minute?

meaning: Of a sheep or lamb: to utter its distinctive cry; to bleat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—there's a whole bunch of sheep just lounging by the hay bales.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: I think one of them just spotted us, listen—maa, maa! It's like they're trying to get our attention.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: They do seem pretty vocal today, don't they? Must be lunchtime coming up.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: Their fluffy coats make them look like walking clouds from here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Let's try edging a bit closer—I'd love to get a picture with them for my scrapbook.

dialogue.speaker: Matthew
dialogue.text: As long as they keep on bleating, I bet they'll pose for us. Let's do it!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—those sheep are crowding around the feeding bucket like it’s a buffet.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: They look so gentle! That little one keeps nudging the fence, trying to get closer.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Give it a try—do your best sheep impression. Let’s see if it gets their attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Okay, stand back! Here comes my best shot: maa, maa!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Oh wow, the one with the crooked ear actually looked up at you! You might have some competition.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Guess I’ve found my hidden talent—professional sheep impersonator in the making!

meaning: To cry like a cat; to mew.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you hear that noise outside last night? It kept me up for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: I thought I heard something weird, but I couldn't tell what it was. Was it an animal?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, it sounded like 'maule, maule'—like a cat mewing right under my window.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Oh wow, maybe there’s a stray hanging around your place now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That wouldn’t surprise me. I’ve seen one or two cats out back in the evenings.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: If they keep coming, you might have some new roommates before long!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s the third time today I’ve heard something scratching and squeaking in here.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, it’s just Jasper. He’s been restless all morning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Restless is one word for it. Is he always this dramatic when you leave him alone?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Pretty much. If he thinks he's being ignored for more than five minutes, he makes sure the whole apartment knows.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just heard him start to maule again—honestly, you’d think he’s auditioning for a part in a cat opera.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: You nailed it! He takes his performances very seriously, especially when tuna treats are on the line.

meaning: A short, high-pitched sound.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That was odd—my bag just twitched on its own.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Wait, your bag just moved? Are you transporting a gremlin in there or something?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I hope not. It felt like something tiny bumped the inside.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Give it a shake, let’s see if anything jumps out.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: (Gently shakes her bag) Meep! There it goes again! See, I’m not imagining it.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m convinced. That’s either high-tech or mildly terrifying.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Okay, Tom, if this thing chops onions as fast as the commercial says, I'm ready to be amazed.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Let me just figure out which button starts it up.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Uh, Tom, it just went 'meep' when you pressed that. Did you break something already?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Not my fault! I swear these things always make weird noises just to keep me on edge.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Well, if it starts dancing next, we're running for cover.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Deal. I’ll keep my hands off the salsa button, just in case.

meaning: Of a cat (occasionally of other animals): to make its characteristic cry; to utter a mew.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look who’s peeking out from under the table! Your kitty’s got the sneakiest stare.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, and did you catch the soft mew she made just now? She does that when she's hoping someone will notice her.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No wonder she’s got those big eyes fixed on us—she’s angling for attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I bet if you stretch your hand out, she’ll hop right into your lap.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here goes; let’s see if she accepts the invitation.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: She’s in one of her social moods tonight, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Guess who discovered the favorite sunbeam in the house?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me Oliver’s claimed the spot next to the bookshelf already.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He’s sprawled out there now, soaking it all in. Oliver, want a chin scratch?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He just gave the tiniest mew and rolled over. That’s his way of giving the green light, I think.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He’s such a little show-off when he’s comfortable.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I’m tempted to join him on the floor and see if it’s as comfy as he makes it look.

meaning: Of a cat (occasionally of other animals): to make its characteristic cry; to utter a mew.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Watch your step—there’s a tiny tornado of fur zooming around somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Was that a flash of orange that just darted under the sofa?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Yep, that would be Milo. He’s a master of hide-and-seek.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Does he always make such dramatic entrances?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Only when he’s hungry—then you’ll hear him mewt until I give in.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He’s got some serious charm tactics; I’d probably cave instantly.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That scratching noise by the window just made me jump.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I noticed it too—was it loud or just kind of faint?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was more of a faint sound, like something small trying to get our attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s the neighborhood cat coming by again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s check, before it gets spooked and runs off.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: There she is, peeking out from behind the planter and giving a tiny mewt.

meaning: Esp. of an infant: to cry feebly, to whimper; to make a whining noise.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Your living room looks so cozy, Emily. And I have to say, Ollie’s little sock collection is the cutest thing I’ve seen today.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thanks! He goes through about three pairs a day—tiny feet, big messes.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? Just now from the bassinet—Ollie let out the sweetest little mewl, like he’s in the middle of a very dramatic dream.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He does that every so often. Sometimes it means he woke himself up with a yawn or a stretch.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It’s such a soft sound, honestly made my heart skip a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should see him when the cat answers back. It becomes a whole duet across the house.

dialogue.speaker: Morgan
dialogue.text: Wow, Emily, I think Sophie’s cheeks just got even chubbier since last week!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She’s been working hard on outgrowing her onesies; every day is a surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She had the funniest little mewl when I tried to put her down for her nap earlier—like she was auditioning for a sad kitten choir.

dialogue.speaker: Morgan
dialogue.text: That’s adorable! Clearly, she’s got a dramatic streak already.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, she could teach a masterclass in theatrical sighs and pouts.

dialogue.speaker: Morgan
dialogue.text: If she starts throwing roses on the floor, let me know—I want to witness the performance!

meaning: Of a cat: to make its characteristic cry.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The night felt extra lively with all that noise by the fence, didn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought raccoons were having a party until I heard something else.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I peeked through the curtains and saw something darting near the flower pots.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That must've been Lily’s tabby on her nightly patrol again.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: For sure—there was a sharp miaow and then she disappeared into the hedge.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: She’s got quite the dramatic entrance for such a tiny creature.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That noise from the hallway just now nearly made me drop my book.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No kidding, it startled me too. Do you think the wind blew something over?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Well, it sort of sounded familiar... more like a little protest than the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’m pretty sure I heard a 'miaow' in there—sounds like someone wants attention.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Of course! Oscar must be wondering why his dinner is running late.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let’s get on his good side and fill up his bowl before he gets even more dramatic.

meaning: A fit of pique, a huff; a petty quarrel, a tiff.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, the office was buzzing after that meeting—I haven’t seen Tom shut his laptop that fast in weeks.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: Oh, I caught that! There was a definite miff between him and Nicole about the project deadline. It was almost theatrical.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe Nicole will send one of her infamous apology emails by tomorrow morning.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: If she does, I hope it’s got fewer exclamation points this time!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, it’s not a real Tuesday unless someone pulls a dramatic exit.

dialogue.speaker: Jordan
dialogue.text: No kidding—should we start keeping score?

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: That was probably the most dramatic book club meeting we’ve had all year.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously! I didn't think a discussion about the ending would spark an uproar like that.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: It got a bit wild when Anna started critiquing Mark’s favorite character so bluntly.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You could almost see the steam coming out of his ears. I hope he’s not holding onto it.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Give it a day, he’ll be back to making bad puns as usual.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, for sure. By next meeting, today’s little miff will be forgotten—until someone brings up that character again!

meaning: Reserved or restrained inmanner or behaviour, esp. in a contrived or priggish way; affectedly modest, demure; primly silent, quiet; affectedly moderate or abstemious in diet (rare).

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I couldn’t help but watch how Grace managed to avoid nearly every conversation at the table tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: She did seem to shrink into herself while everyone else was swapping stories.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s almost like she puts up a little wall whenever the topic gets personal.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Yeah, she’s got that mim air about her—always sitting upright, never really letting loose, and barely touching her food.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It makes her seem a bit mysterious, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: For sure! Maybe she’ll warm up once she feels more comfortable with the group.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Did you notice the way Simon sits at these parties? He has that whole mim vibe—barely saying a word, always tucked politely at the edge of the group.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah, he almost vanishes into the scenery. It's like he prefers to watch rather than join in.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: I think he’s just shy, really. But it does make everyone else curious about him.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: True, when he finally speaks, everyone listens. Maybe that’s his secret: leave them wanting more.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Maybe I should try that—saying less, observing more. I’m not sure I’d last more than five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You? Quiet for five minutes? That’d be the surprise of the century, Lily.

meaning: A prim, or affectedly modest or demure, woman.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, the book club dinner felt like a scene out of an etiquette manual last night.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That sounds intriguing—who managed to bring that sort of energy?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was Margaret. She barely touched her food, kept her ankles crossed the whole time, and didn’t laugh at a single joke.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Has she always been that reserved, or was it the crowd?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: From what Anne was whispering, that's just her usual self—timid to the point of looking uncomfortable.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: With that kind of presence, it’s like Margaret’s the resident mimp of our group—so much composure, it makes me sit up straighter just thinking about it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Last night's book club felt more like stepping into a Jane Austen scene than a Wednesday evening in my living room.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, did everyone arrive with lace gloves and dramatic sighs?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Not quite, but there was one woman near the window who never touched her biscuit and spoke only when addressed directly.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m intrigued—who was she?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That was Mrs. Palmer. She has such a knack for being a mimp; I half-expected her to curtsy every time someone glanced her way.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Perfect! Every gathering needs one, just to keep things interesting.

meaning: Expressing satisfaction, approval, or assent.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I just spotted that food truck with the bright yellow awning—looks like they’re serving tacos today.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, I walked past it earlier and the line was pretty long, but I guess that’s a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: People always line up when they smell fresh tortillas. Plus, everyone’s raving about their spicy chicken.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Mm, you’ve convinced me. Let’s brave the line.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit! Tacos always taste better when you have to earn them.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I hope they still have that mango salsa left by the time we get there!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: My hands are itching to try out that lemon tart recipe I bookmarked yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Lemon tart, huh? That’s a bold move. What inspired this sudden baking urge?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Saw a video of someone slicing into it—golden crust, silky filling. Just looked perfect.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Should we make a quick run for ingredients or do we have everything we need here?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Mm, maybe we’ll need a few more lemons and some fresh cream. The sharper, the better.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I’m on it. This is going to be worth every squeeze and whisk!

meaning: The lowing sound made by a cow or other bovine animal; an imitation of this.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You should've seen that cow, Liam! It turned its head right at me and let out the biggest 'moo' I've ever heard—almost knocked the hat off my head.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Sounds like you made a new friend—hopefully it’s not planning to follow you home!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: With that kind of welcome, I’d almost be tempted to invite it. These cows have serious personality.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Maybe they just appreciate someone who’s not afraid to get a little muddy around the shoes.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think my sneakers are permanently grass-stained, but it’s totally worth it for these moments.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Well, as long as we don’t leave with a new member in the car, I say we check out the sheep next.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Seeing those cows in the field today made me want to grab my sketchbook again.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You and your farm animal sketches! Did you ever finish that painting of the brown cow?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Not yet, but every time I think of cows, I remember how they always startled me with their calls at dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: They really do have strong voices. I bet yours would sound more artistic, though. Can you do it?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Alright, let me channel my inner cow for this masterpiece.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Here it comes—MOOO!

meaning: A concluding rhythmic flourish to a piece of jazz music, announcing a surprising denouement

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: Did you catch that jazz set last night? The energy in the room was electric.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I couldn’t believe how the band kept shifting gears right to the end.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: Yeah, and when the drummer dropped that wild syncopation and the band closed with a mop, I was totally floored.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That ending had everyone talking—what a way to surprise the crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: It’s moments like those that make you never want to miss a live show.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: So true. Jazz just keeps finding new ways to blow us away.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I swear, every time they jam on that stage, it's like the whole room forgets to breathe.

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: Seriously! Did you catch how the drummer slipped in that subtle shuffle behind the trumpet? That’s pure chemistry.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: They’ve got this unspoken language. I keep thinking they’ve reached the peak, but then they push even further.

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: It’s those spontaneous turns that get me. You never really know how they’ll wrap things up.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: And then, out of nowhere, the tempo shifts—just when I thought the set was winding down!

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: That’s the thrill, isn’t it? One sharp break, a quick trade-off, and then—mop! The crowd’s jaws just dropped.

meaning: Expressing disapproval, doubt, or dissatisfaction.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Well, that was certainly not the smoothest group presentation I've seen this semester.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: True, but considering how little time they had, I guess they did alright.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I kept waiting for more details on their main argument, but they just breezed past it.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Yeah, they lost me halfway through. Maybe they were just nervous.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Even so, you’d think someone would’ve stepped in and pulled things together.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Mph, that’s what happens when nobody takes charge. The results just don’t land right.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So, another round of budget cuts announced, right in the middle of our project deadlines.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Yeah, I read the internal memo. Are we supposed to just pretend this won’t make things impossible?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I'm already scrambling with the resources they've left us. Makes no sense at all.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Management says it's 'to streamline efficiency,' but it feels like they're testing how much we can take.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Mph, 'streamlining' just means we're expected to work twice as hard with half the support.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Guess we’ll see how 'efficient' things get when another deadline goes flying past.

meaning: Expressing disapproval, doubt, or dissatisfaction.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Well, there goes my afternoon plans—mphm, that project deadline just got bumped up without any warning.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Wait, they switched the deadline on you again? What’s going on over there?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yeah, apparently upper management decided we need to present earlier, so now everyone’s scrambling to catch up.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounds stressful. Nobody likes being blindsided like that.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Exactly. Feels like we’re always rushing just to meet some arbitrary change.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Maybe once this is over, you should use it as an excuse to treat yourself to something relaxing.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: I can’t believe we actually finished that group project on time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Same here. I thought for sure we’d be scrambling at the last second.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: mphm, I still have my doubts about how everyone pulled their weight.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Did you end up doing more than your share again?

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Let’s just say some people conveniently disappeared when it was time to revise.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Next time, maybe we should set some stricter deadlines within the group.

meaning: Chiefly in negative contexts: to utter a word; to speak.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That was probably the quietest project meeting we've ever had. You could practically hear the clock ticking.

dialogue.speaker: Tim
dialogue.text: Seriously. And Ben just sat there, staring at his notes the whole time.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Not even a muff from him, even when the team kept waiting for input. It was almost unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Tim
dialogue.text: I thought he’d at least chime in about the deadline, but nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He's usually got a strong opinion on everything, so it threw me off completely.

dialogue.speaker: Tim
dialogue.text: Next meeting, let's see if we can draw him out a bit. The silence just doesn't suit him.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That presentation felt like pulling teeth—especially when the professor started firing off those questions.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’re telling me! I almost wanted to disappear when everyone turned their heads to Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, we prepped together, so I don't get why he suddenly drew a blank.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe he got stage fright at the worst possible moment. He looked frozen.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He didn’t even muff; just stood there like a statue while we scrambled.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: We’re definitely keeping that in mind before we volunteer him for next time.

meaning: To speak indistinctly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I've laid out all my slides, but the transitions still feel off. Do you think they flow well enough for the meeting?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, your layout is strong. If anything, maybe add a short pause between sections so people can keep up.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That makes sense. Timing is everything, especially with Mr. Carter in the front row.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, he never misses a detail. Want to rehearse your opening statement together before the rest of the team arrives?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Sure, let's do a quick run-through. If I trip over my words, just signal me.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Of course. And by the way, whenever someone walks past the door, you kind of muffle what you're saying—makes it tricky for me to catch your point.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I swear, as soon as I saw all those eyes on me at the meeting, my heart tried to leap out of my chest.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sounds rough! My last time at the podium, my sentences started to muffle under the pressure—I barely recognized my own voice.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Exactly! For a second, I thought no one could make out what I was saying.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did anyone mention it afterwards, or were you saved by the friendly faces in the crowd?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: A few people gave me an encouraging thumbs up, which helped me breathe and finish strong.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look at you handling it like a pro! Next time I’ll borrow some of your confidence.

meaning: To utter a faint sound; to speak softly or indistinctly; to whisper; to mutter, mumble.
An inarticulate sound made with closed lips, usually as an indication of inability or unwillingness to speak; (in a negative context) the slightest utterance.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Funny how the rain outside makes this whole café feel like a secret little world, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: It does, doesn’t it? Kind of makes everything slow down. Sometimes I wish I could stay in these moments.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: You’ve been twisting that napkin for ages. Something swirling in your thoughts?

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: I tried to get the words out during the staff meeting, but my voice just went mum, like it barely wanted to leave my throat.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That happens to the best of us. Next time, your voice will know it’s safe to show up.

dialogue.speaker: Riley
dialogue.text: I hope so. For now, I’m glad there’s hot chocolate and a little peace here.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: If you squint past the bookshelf, you'll spot our mystery observer next to the window.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I saw your lips move, but I think you just mum something—say it a bit louder?

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Right, the guy in the flannel, he's been looking our way and jotting notes like we're the main exhibit.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That is oddly specific note-taking for a library regular.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Should I pretend to browse the magazines and see what he's sketching?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let’s see where this leads—just don’t turn into a hardcover spy on me.

meaning: To grimace; to form the lips into a grimace or grin; to convey a thought or meaning indirectly by one’s facial expression.
A grimace, a moue; an exaggerated facial expression.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Can you believe how tense the room got when Steven started talking about cutting the coffee budget?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I swear, Sheila did this big mump at him across the table, like she was about two seconds from saying something drastic.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Sheila knows how to send a message without a single word, that's for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Makes you wonder how many decisions have been influenced by her expressions alone.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If coffee's on the line, I might start working on my own tactics.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Just give me a heads-up before you go full-Sheila in the next meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen the way Ben mump-ed when Mrs. Carter handed out the pop quiz—his whole face just screamed how he felt.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Seriously? Was it that obvious? I missed it because I was digging for a pencil.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh, totally. You could feel the tension from our row. A couple of people had to cover their mouths to keep from laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Ben should win an award for best facial reactions in class. He never has to say a word.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s the little things that get us through pop quizzes. Honestly, his reactions are the only upside.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Next time I’ll skip the pencil hunt and just watch the Ben show instead.

meaning: To make a harsh noise.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe the noise my old Corolla made this morning.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Uh oh, did something break or was it just acting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: When I tried to start it, the engine just went 'murr murr murr'—it sounded awful!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That does not sound promising at all. Did you finally manage to get it running?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, after a few more tries and a little bit of luck, it finally cooperated.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s time for a check-up before it decides to quit for good.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That barista is working overtime, huh? Look at that line stretching past the door.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It's wild, right? I was hoping for a quick pick-me-up, not a whole waiting adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: We might as well take bets on which machine gives out first.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, the way that old grinder's rattling, my money's on that one.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you hear it just now? That sharp 'murr' cut right through everyone’s chatter.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, even the manager flinched. This might get interesting fast.

meaning: To make a harsh noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That wind is really pushing the branches against the window tonight—did you see the way they bent just now?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Yeah, and I keep hearing those weird, scratchy sounds out back—like something’s scraping along the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hang on, you mean that screech just now? It almost made me drop my tea.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Exactly! It was all like murre, murre, murre, nonstop for the last five minutes—no wonder it’s making the cat hide under the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s got to be the old gate—it never sounded that intense before, though.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I’ll grab my boots and check it out before it tears itself off the hinges.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That old generator’s really acting up today—did you just hear it stutter like that?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. It gave off this awful 'murre murre' when I tried to kick it into gear. Made my teeth itch just listening to it.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Every time it does that, I get worried something’s about to snap.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It wasn’t like this last week, so something’s definitely changed.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hand me that wrench, would you? I don’t want to risk leaving it like this overnight.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here you go. Let’s see if we can coax a few more hours out of it before it decides to call it quits.

meaning: To murmur, make a noise.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: You know, every time I come here, it's like stepping into a bubble where sound barely exists.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: Seriously, I worry even turning a page is going to echo off the walls.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Hold on, listen—there’s something faint drifting from the back corner.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: I hear it too, like someone trying to talk quietly, but not quite succeeding.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: There’s definitely a mustle behind those shelves—almost like a group whispering secrets.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: That’s the kind of thing that breaks the silence and suddenly makes everything else sound louder.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: The library feels unusually crowded this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I know, right? I had to hunt for an empty chair for ten minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You hear that group by the window mustle? It’s like they think no one notices their whispered conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, their voices blend with the tapping of keyboards and shuffling of papers.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I’m just hoping for a pocket of silence to finish this reading.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe if we move closer to the reference section, it’ll be quieter over there.

meaning: An exaggerated kiss, esp. one given on the cheek to a social acquaintance; an air kiss.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look who decided to brighten up this café with her presence! I almost didn’t recognize you with that stylish haircut.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, you always know how to make an entrance sound dramatic! I’ve missed bumping into you like this.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I’ve missed you too! How’s your new job treating you? Are you still surviving the endless meetings?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Barely, but at least I have some funny stories to share. We really need one of our epic catch-up sessions soon.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! How about a Saturday brunch at that place with the bottomless pancakes?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Count me in! Until then—mwah! Don’t let those pancakes out of your sight.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Look who’s conquering the pastry case—Sam, the ultimate croissant critic!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Guilty as charged, Rachel! Haven’t seen you in forever. Did you ever finish that photo project?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh, I did, and I practically survived on caffeine the whole time. Speaking of which, I’ve got minutes before my next meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: You’re always running at full speed. Let’s make time for a real catch-up soon—no coffee sprints required.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Deal! And here’s a little extra for your morning—mwah! Consider yourself properly greeted.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Now that’s the kind of energy I want in my coffee! Don’t let the world wear you down, superstar.

meaning: Of a horse, donkey, etc.: to make a soft noise, as when recognizing a foal or being offered a titbit.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You won't believe how lively the barn is at feeding time—come see what they're up to.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I'm all for it! The way they crowd around the gate always cracks me up.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Watch this—Charlie knows I keep the carrots in my jacket pocket. He always comes over first.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, hear that? Charlie just let out a gentle nicker when you reached for the carrots.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s his trademark; he’s never subtle about what he wants.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Honestly, little things like that are why I could hang out here every day.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: These carrots are disappearing fast—looks like Murphy's got a favorite snack today.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Did you hear that soft nicker when you reached out? He does that every time someone brings him treats.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It's so sweet! I think he trusts you now.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: He’s a sucker for anyone with snacks. See how his ears perk up?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I’m starting to see why people spend hours just hanging out in the barn.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Just wait until he tries to follow you around next time—we’ll need a wheelbarrow full of carrots.

meaning: Mincing, affected; without force, drive, or spirit.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: So, picture this: I’m sitting there at the grand old Lyric Theatre, and the moment the curtain rises, the lead just waltzes in all niminy-piminy—arms fluttering, voice floating without a hint of substance. I nearly sunk into my seat with secondhand embarrassment.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Oh Clara, you always notice the quirks! Was it distracting enough to steal the show, or did the plot pull you back in?

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Thankfully, the story had enough weight to keep me invested, and the supporting cast really picked up the slack with some bold choices.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: There's nothing like a sharp ensemble to rescue a performance! I guess you’ll be recommending the supporting roles, not the headliner, then.

dialogue.speaker: Clara
dialogue.text: Exactly! By intermission, I was more interested in what the side characters would do next—real breath of fresh air compared to that fragile entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Well, you've certainly painted a picture. Maybe I’ll go for the drama and stay for the underdogs!

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: That was quite an evening at the community center, wasn’t it? My expectations were all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I know! The set changes were impressive, but I kept waiting for someone to stir things up.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Right? Some of their lines just came out so niminy-piminy, especially during the big confrontation scene.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That’s exactly what struck me—it just felt flat where it should’ve been dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Maybe next time they’ll embrace the chaos a bit more and just go for it.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I’d love to see them break out of their shell. It’s got potential if they do.

meaning: To whisper, to gossip.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Check out Ben and Olivia by the copier—they’ve been nipper-ing longer than it takes my coffee to brew. Something’s definitely up.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Seriously? They looked like they were just quietly chatting, but now I’m curious.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Last time Ben got that animated, we ended up with a surprise fire drill.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Please don’t jinx it, I’ve barely started my emails for the day.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If we find confetti in the supply closet later, I’m blaming those two.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Deal. Until then, I’m staying parked right here with my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You could almost hear a pin drop out there, the way everyone’s gone quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Funny you say that—just before you walked in, the air was thick with nipper about why Sam dashed into the conference room.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No way, I missed it! Did anyone actually figure out what’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I don’t think so. People were just craning their necks and speculating in hushed tones.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Typical—these days even a coffee spill turns into a full-blown mystery around here.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Well, keeps things interesting. Maybe someone will crack the case before lunchtime.

meaning: No; used esp. to rebuff or contradict.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So you’re telling me Jake actually finished the project all by himself? That doesn’t sound like him at all.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Nuh-uh, I was in the library and saw him getting a ton of help from Max and Olivia.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That explains so much! I wondered how he pulled it off.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, he definitely didn’t do it solo, no matter what he says.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess I shouldn’t be so surprised now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, that’s just classic Jake trying to make himself look good.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Guess what? I finally beat that impossible boss in Elden Ring last night.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Seriously? You said you were stuck for weeks!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I know, but I watched a bunch of tutorials and figured out the perfect strategy.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: No way, I don’t believe you did it without help from someone else.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Nuh-uh, all by myself this time. My hands were shaking the whole way through!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Alright, I’ll believe it when you show me the footage—otherwise, I’m still skeptical.

meaning: An exclamation of pleasurable anticipation, with implication of sensual or gustatory satisfaction.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait till you hear this—Emma sent me a picture of the pumpkin cheesecake from that new café. Num, I can practically taste the creamy filling just by looking at it!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No way! I’ve been craving something sweet all week. That cheesecake might just tempt me out of my diet.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m telling you, if we get there after lunch, we might score a slice before the rush.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I’m all in. Maybe I’ll even grab one of those cinnamon rolls I keep hearing about.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s go all out—cheesecake, cinnamon rolls, and maybe a scone for good measure.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No self-control today! I’ll bring my best appetite; you grab us a cozy corner.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I can’t walk past this bakery without eyeing those pastries in the window.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously, their cinnamon rolls are just calling my name right now.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You’re making me want to go in—should we split one, or get two and risk a sugar coma?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s go all out and each grab our own. I’m feeling bold today!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Num, I can already taste that gooey center and the icing melting—this is going to be so worth it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Lead the way, pastry queen, before I change my mind!

meaning: Of food: delicious, yummy, especially tasty or tempting.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You look way too happy—was dinner at your aunt's as good as you hoped?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. She made her famous lasagna, all gooey and loaded with cheese.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Lasagna sounds great! Did she go all out with dessert too?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: She did! There was a huge lemon meringue pie just waiting on the counter.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Aunt Linda's lemon meringue is legendary. Don't keep me in suspense—how was it this time?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Seriously, it was so nummy—light, tangy, and just the right amount of sweet. I had to fight for the last slice!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, this lemon tart is absolutely nummy—I could eat ten of these!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ten, huh? That sounds like a serious endorsement. What makes it so good?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The pastry is super crisp and the filling is the perfect mix of tangy and sweet. I can’t put my fork down.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Sounds like the kind of thing that would vanish in seconds at family gatherings.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: For sure! If you want a bite, I’ll reluctantly share—I make no promises about the rest though.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’re speaking my language. I’ll grab a fork and see if it lives up to the hype!

meaning: Of a (small) dog: to yelp, bark. Hence, of a child or small or insignificant person: to speak in a cheeky or peevish manner; to whinge.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Another sleepless night, thanks to that noise parade outside my window.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I know! I nearly spilled my tea when it started up—thought the bin lorry had reversed into my garden.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: No dramatic crashes, just Mr. McKay's terrier out to nyaff at anyone in a high-vis vest. The postman barely made it down the path.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s wild how such a pocket-sized beast can cause such a fuss every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: If only I could channel that energy into my Monday motivation.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: We’d conquer the world—or at least get through the emails before noon!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at that scruffy dog again, barking its head off as soon as we go by the hedge.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: He’s got more attitude than half the people in our whole block, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Always nyaffs at us, like it’s got something urgent to complain about—honestly, reminds me of Finn when he gets wound up in math class.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Between that dog and Finn, I can never decide who’s noisier when things don’t go their way.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe they’re in secret competition for the title—tiny but mighty loud.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Well, if there’s a trophy, I wouldn’t want to be the judge for that contest!

meaning: Expressing the speaker’s feeling of superiority or contempt for another.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Ugh, that test was brutal. I don’t want to see my grade at all.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I checked mine as soon as the results posted. I kind of knew I'd ace it.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Nyah, must be nice to be so sure of yourself. I bet you don’t even have to try.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Hey, it’s not my fault if I prepared better. Maybe you should take notes next time.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Or maybe next time I'll surprise you with a higher score.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: If that happens, first round of coffee is on me. Deal?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Looks like my name’s at the top of the leaderboard again—third week in a row.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Nyah, leaderboard means nothing if all you can do is impress with flashy numbers.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Funny, coming from someone who keeps refreshing the scoreboard every five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, some of us care about what actually matters around here.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Sure, keep telling yourself that while I pick my prize.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: Whatever, Megan. Next round, I’ll put your so-called record to shame.

meaning: Representing a grunting sound made by a pig or (occasionally) a similar sound made by another creature. Also representing a human imitation of such a sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That pen over there has the tiniest piglets I’ve ever seen!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Right? They keep shuffling and rooting around for snacks.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Every time I visit a farm, I end up watching the pigs the longest.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: They're hilarious! It’s like they’re in their own little world, pushing each other and making a racket.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you could do a good pig impression, I'd be seriously impressed.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, get ready for my best farm performance... oink oink!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, watch this—oink oink! Bet I can start a pig stampede.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: You really got their attention! That big one just lifted its head.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe I’ve missed my calling as a barnyard entertainer.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If you start rolling in mud, I’m getting my phone out.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Relax, I’ll leave the muddy fun to our curly-tailed friends.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Fine, but let’s swing by the llamas next—think you can charm them too?

meaning: The repetitive rhythmical sound characteristic of a deep-toned brass instrument in a band; a sound or musical accompaniment resembling this.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should've seen the parade last night—the oompah from the band had everyone dancing in the street, even the mayor was tapping his feet!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously? That must have brought the whole block alive. Were there floats too?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, tons! There were lights everywhere and kids tossing confetti, it felt like the entire city showed up.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Man, parades like that never get old. I can just picture the energy.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time it rolls around, I’m making sure you’re in the front row with me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You read my mind—count me in for the next parade adventure!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know, last night’s festival was unforgettable—I can still hear the band with that deep brass oompah oompah echoing through the park.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: It really brought everyone together, didn’t it? I couldn’t stop smiling the whole time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There’s this contagious energy in the air whenever musicians start up like that.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Yeah, music with that kind of rhythm makes even a chilly evening feel warm.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s settled then—we have to catch the next band performance downtown.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Count me in! I’ll bring the snacks if you find the perfect spot to sit.

meaning: The quality of being exciting, energetic, or sexually attractive; energy, vigour.

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: So, did you end up watching the talent show last night?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Of course! Honestly, I liked the jazz band, but the solo guitarist from last round just had so much more oomph.

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: I totally get what you mean—the energy just felt different, right?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Exactly, it’s like the whole room was alive during her set.

dialogue.speaker: Jess
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s her stage presence, or just the way she connects with everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Now I’m counting down to see what the finale brings next week!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Last night’s concert just blew me away—the way the band started that first song had everyone jumping.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously! And the guitarist totally stole the spotlight with those wild solos.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: For real, his stage presence had the whole crowd mesmerized. Did you catch the way he worked the audience?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That’s what I’m saying—he brought so much oomph to every note, it felt like the place was on fire.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It’s been ages since I’ve seen that kind of spark at a local show!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Next time they play, I’m grabbing front row seats. I need that kind of thrill again.

meaning: Expressing sudden pain.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: This bookshelf is refusing to budge, Jake. Can you give me a hand with the other side?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Alright, let's lift together on three—one, two—ooyah! That corner just got my ankle.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounded brutal. Do you need to sit down or keep going?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I’ll shake it off, just caught me by surprise.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Let’s watch out for those sharp edges. That thing is a menace.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, next time I’m bringing knee pads to moving day.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: This is definitely the heaviest box so far. Think you can handle your side, Emily?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's not going to beat me, but I might need you to steer if it gets wobbly.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, steady on the count of three. Here goes nothing—one, two, three!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Ooyah! My knuckle just smashed into the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounded rough! Want to take a breather before we do the next flight of stairs?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Give me a sec to shake it off. These boxes just don’t want to cooperate today.

meaning: Expressing surprise, excitement, or a similar emotion.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Guess who I ran into at the coffee shop this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No idea—give me a hint!

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Remember our old math teacher, Mrs. Bennett?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously? I haven't seen her in ages. How is she?

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: She looked exactly the same, and she still remembers our disastrous group project.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Ou! That takes me right back—what a time that was!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess what just happened on my way home today!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No idea—did something exciting happen?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I bumped into our old music teacher, Mrs. Parker, right in front of the bakery.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Are you serious? I haven't seen her in years!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Ou, I know! She even remembered my name and asked how you were doing.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That's amazing. I hope we can catch up with her somehow!

meaning: Expressing sudden physical pain.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This bookcase is way heavier than it looks from across the room.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Let’s tackle it together, but let me take the bottom—your stairs are brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, but be careful by the railing—it always catches my sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: I see it. If I get stuck, I’ll call for backup.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Ouch! That corner went right into my shin.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Hold up, let’s set this down for a second. You need me to grab some ice?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If you can reach that heavy lid, I’ll get the rest of this sorted.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No problem—wait, ouch! That thing slipped and smacked my thumb.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounded painful. Want me to grab a bandage just in case?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Nah, it’s just a little bruise. You'd think after all these projects I'd be more careful.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hey, these old storage lids are sneaky; happens to the best of us.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Alright, shaking it off. Let’s see if this thing will behave now.

meaning: Of a dog: to bark.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Looks like there’s a fresh face on Cedar Street—did you spot the moving truck yesterday?

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Oh, I did! And I saw a big brown dog peeking through their fence when I biked by.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s the one! The tail was going wild. I wonder what its name is.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I’m hoping it’s friendly. I’d love to let Luna meet it if it’s not too jumpy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Careful, though—I dropped my keys earlier and it definitely noticed.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Ouff, ouff! I bet that gave you a shock. Dogs have the sharpest ears on the block!

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I swear, the wind nearly knocked my hat off on the way over here.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's been wild out there—I almost chased my umbrella down the street yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Hey, speaking of wild, did you notice Molly’s ears perk up just now? She’s got her detective face on.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: ouff ouff! There she goes—every time a squirrel even thinks about our yard she sounds the alarm.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: At least someone’s keeping an eye on the critter invasion!

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: She's relentless—I should be so vigilant about my own snacks.

meaning: In early use: used in imitation of a sound denoting various sentiments.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You won’t believe it, Ben—my dream internship called to offer me an interview!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s amazing, Sophie! I know how much you wanted that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Thanks! There’s just one snag... it’s the exact day I promised to help my mom move.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh man, talk about bad timing. Both are super important.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, ough, why do these things always happen all at once?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe you can find a way to do both—let’s think through your options.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess who I bumped into at the coffee shop this morning?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No clue—who was it? Someone we know?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was Mrs. Thompson! She still remembers our old science fair project.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Wow, Mrs. Thompson! That takes me back.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Ough, just thinking about it makes me feel so nostalgic.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Same here. Those were some unforgettable days for sure.

meaning: Used to represent the sound of an impact, blow, explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: My day took a wild turn in the kitchen this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounds intriguing. What did you do this time?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I was just trying to open a jar of tomato sauce, thinking it would be easy.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let me guess: you gave it a twist, it fought back, and then—paff—the lid shot off and sauce went everywhere?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You know me too well. My shirt may never be the same.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That's one way to add excitement to pasta night!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: So there I was, just trying to open that stubborn jar, and out of nowhere—paff! The lid smacked right into the wall and scared the cat half to death.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No way! Did you actually manage to get any of the contents out, or was it a total loss?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: A little made it, but most of it ended up on the floor. The cat wouldn’t come near the kitchen for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can totally picture that! Bet your kitchen looked like a crime scene.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let’s just say I spent more time cleaning than cooking last night.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Classic Jake adventure—I’m adding this to your list of legendary kitchen mishaps!

meaning: Expressing disgust or disdain.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess what just ruined my afternoon at Mason’s Deli.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Don’t tell me—did they mess up your sandwich again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, this time they completely ignored me, even though I was right at the counter.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Ugh, that’s the worst. You’d think they’d notice a regular customer.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I just stood there while they joked around behind the counter, not even a glance my way.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Pah, I’d lose all patience with service like that.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You know that reality show everyone at work keeps raving about? Pah, I can’t believe people actually waste their evenings watching that.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Wow, you really don’t hold back, do you? What’s got you so worked up about it?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s all so fake! They just argue on camera for attention and call it entertainment.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I mean, sometimes that over-the-top drama is the fun of it. It helps me unwind after a long day.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Maybe I just prefer a good documentary or a classic film to noisy bickering.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Fair enough! Next time, I’ll save you a seat for movie night instead of reality TV marathons.

meaning: To pamper with food; to fatten.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You look like you just came back from a food festival—there's a certain glow about you!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Not far off—I was at my aunt’s all weekend, and she had me taste-testing every recipe she knows.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That explains it! What did she make for you this time to earn that honor?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Oh, everything from her legendary pies to those rich casseroles. I practically rolled out of her house.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Classic Aunt Linda—she loves to pamp you whenever you visit!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I know, right? At this rate, I’ll have to sign up for a marathon just to balance out her hospitality.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Every time I scroll through my phone, I see photos of you traveling or eating at new places! Is your schedule finally freeing up this week?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You know me—can't resist a food festival! But yeah, I could absolutely use a cozy dinner with you and your famous home cooking.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Perfect! I've been itching to try out a couple of hearty recipes. You're in for a treat, but I hope you arrive hungry.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Hearty, you say? Last time I waddled home from your place. My jeans still haven't forgiven me.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Well, brace yourself because I plan to pamp you even more this time—I've got three types of pies warming up already.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Dangerous words, Liv! I guess I better skip lunch if I want to survive tonight's feast.

meaning: Representing a short resonant sound, such as that produced by the striking of metal, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: This screw’s been giving me trouble for ages; can you hand me that metal mallet?

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Here you go! Try not to smash your finger like last time.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No promises. Okay, steady... I’ll give it a firm tap.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Wait, let me move my coffee out of the way first. Things tend to go flying when you’re on a roll.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, here it goes—pang! That sounded way sharper than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Pretty sure the neighbors heard that one! Did it finally come loose?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If I can just get this last screw to fit, we might actually finish this birdhouse before sunset.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Try the flathead screwdriver—it usually does the trick with those stubborn ones.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Good idea. Let me just wedge it in a bit more…

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Pang! That echoed off the vise like a mini gong.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, at least nothing flew off the table this time!

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: We’re making progress—and keeping all our fingers, which is a bonus!

meaning: To hurl or throw (something) violently, so as break it against something or smash something with it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you redecorate your living room with shattered glass on purpose or was there a wild party I missed?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I wish it was just creative interior design. Nope, it’s a recent disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Okay, now I'm dying to know what caused that mess.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: My cousin stormed in, grabbed a flowerpot from the table, and just pash—straight at the wall. Didn’t even miss a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Only your family could turn Sunday brunch into a demolition derby.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, next time I’m serving bubble wrap instead of croissants.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at this mess! It’s like someone tried to pash the salsa jar across the kitchen tiles.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No way—seriously? How did that even happen?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I don’t know, but there’s glass in the sink and on the floor. The counter is covered too.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Ugh, that’s going to take forever to clean up. Should we grab the broom first or go in with paper towels?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Definitely broom—don’t want a shard in my foot before breakfast.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, I’ll suit up. This feels like a crime scene in here.

meaning: Representing a patting sound; with a pat.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Somehow, that report just exploded on me again today.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Ugh, paperwork disasters strike again? What happened this time?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I misread the deadline and handed in the wrong version. My manager was not impressed.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oof, I know how much you care about getting things right.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: *pat, pat* Hey, you’re still doing your best. One bad day doesn’t define you.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Thanks for saying that. I guess I'll survive after all.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m so worn out from work today, Mark. I barely made it to the end.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Long day, huh? Anything in particular sap your energy?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just one thing after another all day—meetings, deadlines, and not even a single pat on the back!

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: You definitely deserve some recognition. Want to grab a coffee and decompress?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect. I seriously need to unwind for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Alright, caffeine and good company coming right up!

meaning: To breathe hard, as from exertion, or with difficulty; to puff, to pant; to become short of breath.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That last staircase felt never-ending, didn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: My legs are still shaking. Whoever designed that building must really love cardio.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Just give me a sec—pech pech—I need to catch my breath before I even think about moving again.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Take your time. I’m not sure I could take another step right now either.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Why do we always end up racing each other to the top?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Because one of us always says, ‘Last one up buys coffee!’ I’m holding you to it this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I can’t believe we actually made it over that hill—my legs are still shaking.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: *Pech, pech, pech*… Next time, you’re carrying my backpack. I might just lie down here for a minute.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: If I carried your backpack, you’d have to drag me the rest of the way! Want some water?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Only if you can pry it out of my pocket—I’m not moving an inch.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Deal. But next time, we’re taking the scenic route. Flat and paved.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Remind me of this moment if I ever suggest stairs again.

meaning: A kind of home-made firework consisting of a small cone of damp gunpowder which is lighted at the top.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: The air feels so empty without the usual crackle of summer fireworks, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It really does. I keep thinking about all those nights on the porch, sticky with lemonade, watching flashes in the sky.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: And the best part? Trying to guess which one would fizzle out and which would bloom big and bright.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You know, my grandad always made those backyard fireworks displays feel like a full-on spectacle.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Oh! Especially those squat little paper ones. What was his nickname for those again?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: He always grinned and called them peeoy—remember how we'd all huddle close, one spark and they'd sputter just enough to make us laugh and jump back?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: The smell of smoke always takes me right back to those chaotic summer nights in your garage, Sarah.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Honestly, it’s amazing we managed to pull off any kind of backyard fireworks show without setting our parents’ garden on fire.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Do you remember the one that would just sputter and die before even looking exciting?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Oh, that had to be the peeoy! I swear we spent more time arguing about how to light it than actually watching it do anything.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s classic. I always expected something big, but it just fizzled and let us down every time.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: We really should have taken it as a sign to stick with sparklers, but where’s the fun in that?

meaning: To make a light, rapid, repetitious sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So out of nowhere, the keyboard started going 'petter petter petter' while I was finishing the last report—felt like my fingers were racing the clock.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Ha, sounds like you were seriously on a roll! Was it that deadline making you type so quickly?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Absolutely—every tick of the clock just made me go faster. The office was so quiet, but my keyboard definitely wasn’t.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I bet everyone around could tell there was a power-typist in action.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, someone even looked over their cubicle wall at one point and gave me a thumbs-up.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Now that’s the kind of motivation we need for those end-of-day sprints.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Something’s making a racket over by the radiator again. That’s twice this week.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Are you sure it’s not just the pipes? Older places love to complain.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No, listen—petter, petter, petter—there it goes! Does that sound like pipes to you?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: That’s actually kind of haunting. Maybe a mouse discovered a shortcut.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I wouldn’t blame it—warm spot on a cold night. As long as it stays hidden, we’re good.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Fair enough. If things start moving on their own, then I’ll worry.

meaning: Expressing contempt, disgust, or derision.
The thin cry of a bird, esp. of the kite.
Of a bird, esp. a kite: to cry in a plaintive manner.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You would not believe what I found in the office fridge this morning—a container of week-old fish left wide open.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Oh, pew! That explains why the whole breakroom smelled like something crawled in there and gave up.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It was so bad I had to hold my breath just to get my coffee out.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Honestly, whoever keeps doing that needs a stern note taped to their lunchbox.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No kidding. At this point, I’d pay good money for detective work to figure out who it is.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: If air freshener could speak, it’d probably be screaming for help right about now.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You will not believe what Greg wore to the meeting—bright orange pants with a neon green shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Pew, now that's a fashion crime if I've ever seen one.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I know, right? I had to stop myself from laughing out loud.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Honestly, some people have zero self-awareness.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He definitely knows how to make an entrance, I'll give him that.

dialogue.speaker: Simon
dialogue.text: Yeah, but maybe next time he could try making one in style.

meaning: Representing the plaintive call of some birds of prey.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You won’t believe the noise I heard overhead while I was jogging this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious—what kind of noise are we talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It wasn’t like anything I usually hear, kind of eerie and echoey, almost like it was calling out for something.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Maybe it was one of those big hawks? Can you try and make the sound?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, it went something like this: pewewe… pewewe… I swear, it gave me goosebumps.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: That’s honestly impressive! If I’d heard that above me, I’d walk a little faster too.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That call just echoed across the whole valley—did you catch it, Ben?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I heard it! It kind of gives me chills. Sounds like something looking for a friend.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
