dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s it! That’s exactly the noise. I had no idea those birds lived around here now.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Looks like your backyard just got a new entertainer. Next time, you might want to keep an ear out and see if you spot them, too!

meaning: Representing the sound of a blow, punch, shot, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That car flip had my heart racing—my popcorn nearly went flying!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. The way everyone moved in sync during that warehouse fight was unreal. Was that the highlight for you?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It’s up there for sure, but the showdown with the masked guy just before the finale really amped me up.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Right! And in the chaos, the hero just ducked and—out of nowhere—

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: pow! The masked guy went flying across the room. Everyone around me gasped at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Scenes like that are exactly why I keep coming back for these late-night premieres.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Man, that boss battle last night totally blew my mind. I can't believe how intense it got!

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Seriously! I thought my controller was going to break from how hard I was pressing the buttons.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: And just when I thought we were done for, the hero landed that crazy aerial spin—

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: —pow! Right in the enemy's face. I jumped off my seat!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That moment practically had me yelling at the screen. Best final move ever.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: No kidding. I’m still replaying it in my head every time I close my eyes.

meaning: The sound made by a bell.
To make a sound like a bell.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My stomach’s staging a protest—if that oven doesn’t finish soon, I might actually start eating this cookbook.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Patience, master chef! Good things come to those who wait—and don’t gnaw on pages.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wait, pring! There it goes—timing couldn’t be better.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Music to my ears! Let’s see how your masterpiece turned out.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, moment of truth—oven mitts on, here we go.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: If it tastes half as good as it smells, we’re in for a treat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that? Pring! Sounds like something’s happening down the hall.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah, it definitely caught my attention. Any idea what triggered it this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe lunch is ready, or someone needs help at the front desk again.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Could even be another delivery dropping by. It’s been a busy morning.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Should we check it out, or do you want to wait a minute and see if someone comes in?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let’s take a quick look—my curiosity’s not going to let me concentrate anyway.

meaning: Used as a call to a cow or calf, or to command a horse to stop, stand still, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: Easy now, Charlie, proo, proo! See, he always listens the moment I call out like that.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: That catches his attention faster than anything else I’ve seen.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: You should have seen him last week—one call and he planted all four feet, wouldn’t budge.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Guess I’ll have to pick up a few tricks from you.

dialogue.speaker: Ellen
dialogue.text: With these big guys, it’s all about timing and giving the right signal.

dialogue.speaker: Mike
dialogue.text: Well, don’t be surprised if you hear me trying that out in the next field over!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Proo, Ginger, proo! Look at her ears perk up every time I say it—she knows exactly who's in charge.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, Ethan, you sound like you're casting a spell or something with that voice.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Well, if keeping Ginger from nosing through the feed bucket is magic, I'll wear the wizard hat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe you should teach me your trick before she starts eyeing my shoelaces again.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Next thing you know, you’ll have all the cows lined up just from a whisper.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If that happens, I’m putting you in charge of the morning rounds from now on!

meaning: An exclamation of contempt, disbelief, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what Evan just told me—he says he built his own drone from scratch in one weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Prut, Evan can barely assemble a sandwich without help. Now he’s an overnight drone engineer?

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: He had pictures on his phone and everything, showing the parts and the finished drone.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Unless those pictures have timestamps, I’m not buying it just yet.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: He actually offered to bring it to the park on Saturday and show us how it flies.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Alright, if that thing actually lifts off, I’ll eat my words—and maybe ask him to build me one too.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Did you see Carl’s post about winning the lottery? Prut, as if that would ever happen to him.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously, he actually said that?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yeah, he even uploaded a picture holding a huge fake check.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds so much like Carl, always trying to pull something wild.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Emma fell for it, you know. She’s telling everyone he’s rich now.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: This is going to make next week’s office party a circus.

meaning: Expressing contempt, impatience, or disgust, or used to depreciate or dismiss some statement or notion.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Would you believe it, Greg? They expect us to log every pen we take from the supply cabinet now.

dialogue.speaker: Greg
dialogue.text: You've got to be kidding. What are we, children who can’t keep track of our own pens?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I'm serious. Management even sent out a memo about it this morning, and they're acting like it's some huge solution.

dialogue.speaker: Greg
dialogue.text: As if losing a few pens was the downfall of the entire company.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Pshaw, like tracking stationary ever helped productivity. We’ll end up wasting more time on paperwork than actual work.

dialogue.speaker: Greg
dialogue.text: If they keep this up, I’ll need a spreadsheet just to get through my morning routine.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Guess what I overheard at lunch—apparently Ben is buying that old mansion on Maple Street.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Pshaw, Ben wouldn't set foot in a place that creaks. He's all about those shiny new apartments downtown.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He might surprise you! I heard he’s been looking for a project to keep him busy.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: A fixer-upper haunted by squirrels? I'd pay to see that.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Maybe he’s on a secret quest for adventure—or just lost his mind.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Let's just say I’ll believe it when I see Ben with a toolbox instead of his fancy briefcase.

meaning: Expressing caution, surprise, or impatience.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So, you're not going to believe what I just saw outside the coffee shop.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Try me. The last thing you noticed was pretty wild, remember that raccoon in the backpack?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This tops that! Someone just parked their car on the sidewalk like it was totally normal.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You must be joking. On the sidewalk? In broad daylight?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I wish I was joking! There are people just walking around it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Psht, I guess some folks really don’t care about rules, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hold on, did you see that shadow move by the fence just now?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I did, actually. Should I grab the flashlight and check it out?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Psht, don’t just go running out there like it’s nothing!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Relax, I’m just going to peek—nothing dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Seriously, let’s use some common sense for once.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Alright, alright. I’ll be cautious—you can count on it.

meaning: Used to attract attention or give warning, esp. surreptitiously.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I can’t believe the printer jammed right before my big report was due—you’d think we work in a sitcom.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Tell me about it, last week mine just ate half my spreadsheet and spat out confetti.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Psst—Jason, stop, that’s Ms. Carter over by the copier.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Oh, wow, glad you caught that. I almost started on my paper jam rant.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: We both know she has a zero-tolerance policy for 'printer comedy.'

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Better stick to small talk about paper trays for now.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You weren’t followed, right? I really need this to be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Relax, I took three different routes here. No one trailed me.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Still, I have a weird feeling. That guy at the counter keeps glancing over.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: He’s probably just waiting for his coffee. Let’s not get paranoid.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I hope you’re right, but I’m not taking any chances. Keep your eyes on that notebook.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Psst—Olivia, don’t look now, but he’s headed this way.

meaning: Expressing a whispered signal for silence.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe how many cookbooks they have here on this shelf.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Did you spot that big Italian one at the end? I bet it’s packed with pasta recipes.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Let me get it—hang on, this book is heavier than I thought!

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Pst, Lucy! There’s a reading group right behind us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, whoops—got a little too excited. I’ll keep it down.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: No worries! Let’s see if we can find one on desserts too, nice and quietly.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Pst! Not so loud, you’ll get us noticed by the librarian!

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Oops, my bad. Didn’t realize everyone was so focused in here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Well, you kind of echo through these aisles. It’s like instant surround sound.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: I guess I’m not really cut out for secret meetings among the books.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe we should hand you a whispering certificate after today.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Let’s see if I can earn it—silent victory dance later if I pass!

meaning: An exclamation of contempt or disdain.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Can you believe Evan strutted into the meeting like he owned the place?

dialogue.speaker: Mason
dialogue.text: Ptish! All he ever does is take credit for other people’s ideas, like he’s some kind of genius.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Right? When he claimed the promotion was basically in the bag for him, I almost laughed.

dialogue.speaker: Mason
dialogue.text: If he actually did half the work he claims, I’d eat my hat.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I’ll be shocked if the boss buys into his act for much longer.

dialogue.speaker: Mason
dialogue.text: Let’s watch him try—he’s bound to slip up sooner or later.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—Jason’s already spreading wild stories again in the break room.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let me guess, he’s claiming credit for the Wilson account or some nonsense like that?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Apparently, he told everyone the whole deal was his idea. Ptish, as if we don't all know better.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: He really does love the sound of his own voice. It’s almost impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He can keep talking; nobody’s buying it anymore.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: At this point, the coffee machine’s got more credibility than he does.

meaning: Representing the sound of a person spitting; (hence) expressing disgust or contempt.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Just my luck! I think I stepped in something gross.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let me guess, another surprise left by the neighborhood dogs?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's squishy and it smells—not a good combination.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That's the third time this week someone’s dodged their responsibility around here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I swear, if I find out who keeps doing this, they're getting a strong word from me.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Ptui! People like that ruin things for everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just took a huge bite of that sandwich from the back of the fridge and, I swear, one second in and I was making a face, then ptui—I spat it right out on the plate! It was beyond gross.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounds like a disaster. Did it taste weird the moment you bit into it, or did it sneak up on you?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, the texture was off immediately. Kind of mushy with a strange tang. Should’ve trusted my gut before biting in.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: I had a run-in with some old yogurt last week. Completely ruined my appetite for the day.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Guess we both need to double-check expiration dates from now on. My taste buds can’t take another surprise like that.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: If my lunch starts looking at me funny, it’s going straight to the trash from now on.

meaning: To walk or move slowly and heavily; to trudge.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Wow, these hills just keep on coming—my backpack feels like it’s gained twenty pounds.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Seriously, who decided we needed a nature challenge today? My boots are probably as tired as I am.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: All I can manage now is to pudge from one tree to the next. I’m not sure if I’m still hiking or just dragging myself.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: If you’re pudging, then I’m definitely right behind you. We should start a new hiking trend.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: As long as the trend involves more snacks and fewer hills, I’m in.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Deal! Let's claim that shady patch up ahead as our new snack HQ.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That's the last time I wear these sneakers on a day like this—my socks are soaked.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Same here. I could barely pudge through that mess on Main Street, cars splashing everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You'd think we'd learn after last time, but nope. My legs feel like lead.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If one more car had splashed me, I might've just set up camp on the sidewalk.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Let's find somewhere warm and dry—maybe that bakery on the corner?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Lead the way. I could go for something sweet and a hot drink right about now.

meaning: To blow out (air, one’s breath, smoke, etc.), esp. in a short abrupt blast or blasts.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: My hands are turning numb just holding this coffee out here.

dialogue.speaker: Liz
dialogue.text: If you could bottle up this air, you’d have instant refrigeration.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I might start breathing out just to see the little clouds form.

dialogue.speaker: Liz
dialogue.text: Give it a go—just one puff and you’ll feel like a steam engine.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: All aboard the Sam Express, next stop: frozen fingertips.

dialogue.speaker: Liz
dialogue.text: Let me know if you need a conductor’s hat, I think I still have one from Halloween!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I see you’ve claimed every inch of the kitchen counter for your baking experiment, Owen.

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: If I’m going to master sourdough, I need space for the chaos—and flour everywhere, apparently.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Something smells a bit... toasty. Is your starter supposed to be bubbling like a swamp?

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: That’s just part of the process—sometimes it gets feisty and I have to give it a little puff to let the gas escape.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, your baking show is way more entertaining with all the drama in that jar.

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: Just wait, the finale is going to be epic—assuming the bread makes it out alive.

meaning: The sound of repeated puffing by a steam engine; (esp. in children’s language) a steam locomotive or steam train.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Look at that—it’s really rolling in, all covered in steam! You don’t see that every day.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It’s like something out of an old movie. My camera can barely keep up with the action.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: I always remember the sound most of all—puff-puff, puff-puff, echoing down the tracks. Makes the whole platform feel alive.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That rhythm is almost hypnotic. You can’t help but get swept up in it.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Let’s get closer, before the conductor starts waving everyone back.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just try to keep up this time! I don’t want to miss a single wheel turn.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You know, just the sight of old railway tracks still makes me think of summer trips with my granddad.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, I can picture it now—the big steam locomotive rolling in, chimney billowing, and that classic 'puff-puff' echoing down the line as it slowed at the platform.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That sound always set my heart racing. It felt like the start of a real adventure every single time.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Exactly! All the kids would scramble to the windows, trying to get the best look at the engine.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Funny how that memory sticks. Sometimes I swear I can catch that rhythm in the distance, even when there's no train around.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If only we could hop aboard again—there's nothing else quite like it.

meaning: To force, thrust, or propel in a specified direction.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That spin you pulled near the sideline totally threw off their defense.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I didn’t even plan it. I just reacted when I saw the gap open up.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Seriously though, how did you even get the ball to Liam so quickly? It looked impossible from where I was standing.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just had to punk it straight down the line and hope he was ready. There wasn’t time to overthink it.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Liam sure was ready—he took that pass like it was nothing. That was clutch.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It’s all about trusting your teammates’ instincts, right? Glad it paid off this time.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: My hands are slipping—this mattress refuses to cooperate! Can you get a better hold on your side?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I've wedged my arm underneath, but it's jammed against the banister. Maybe if we twist it a bit?

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Twist, huh? Alright, let's rotate on three. One, two—hang on, I'm stuck on the step here.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, let's pause. If we angle the top first, I think it'll clear the rail. Ready to try again?

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Yeah, just give me the word. I think I've got enough grip now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, go! Punk it up toward me and we’ll finally get this beast upstairs.

meaning: To make a dismissive or contemptuous sound with the lips.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Well, group assignments strike again. Guess who I'm stuck with—Chris.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Oh, come on, you act like it's a tragedy every time this happens.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I mean, last semester was a disaster. I did the report, and he barely answered his texts.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Maybe he'll surprise you and actually join the group chat before the deadline this time.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: If he actually helps out, I’ll eat my notes. I’m not holding my breath though.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Pup! Just don't work yourself up yet, Alex. Let's see what happens first.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Guess what the lunch crowd couldn’t stop talking about today.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let me guess—more wild theories about the quarterly results?

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Nope, this time it’s all about Brian supposedly getting a secret promotion.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Brian? That rumor’s making the rounds again?

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Apparently, someone spotted him coming out of the boss’s office all smiles.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Honestly, pup, people will spin a story out of anything these days.

meaning: To turn upside down, overturn, or capsize; to pitch or tumble head over heels.
Of a cat: to purr. Also in later use, esp. of an engine: to make a sound resembling a cat’s purr.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You really chose the wildest day for your first skateboarding attempt, didn't you, Ben?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t remind me! I hit that curb and the next second, I just went purl over the board. My shoes were in the air before I even processed what happened.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I wish I'd caught that on camera! Are you feeling okay now?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Mostly just my pride is bruised, honestly. The board is fine, though.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Typical—at least the board's tougher than you. Ready to try again or are you retiring already?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m not backing down. Let’s see if I can ride more than ten feet this time!

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: I still can't believe how that rapid just snuck up on us—one moment we’re steady, then suddenly, purl! There we went, entirely over and into the water.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’ve never seen you move so fast trying to rescue your sandwich box.

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Well, that was perfectly good lunch floating away! I had to try.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Fair point. I was too busy making sure my glasses weren’t lost to even notice.

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: All things considered, we made it out with only our dignity soaked.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Teamwork at its finest—next time, let’s pick the calmest river on the map!

meaning: An act of purring; the low vibrating sound made by a cat, usually when pleased or contented.
Of a cat or another feline animal: to make a low, continuous, vibratory sound taken to be expressive of satisfaction or pleasure.
Used as a call to pigs or turkeys. Formerly also in extended use.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess who decided my book was his new pillow this afternoon? Oliver sprawled right across the pages!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Classic Oliver! Did he let you keep reading at least, or was it instant nap time for both of you?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He flopped down, pressed his nose to my arm, and then it happened—purr rolling louder and louder, like he was trying to vibrate the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds like peak happiness for both cat and human. I swear, sometimes their contentment is contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, I lost my place in the chapter but gained a perfect little moment instead.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s the kind of bookmark I’d never complain about. Oliver knows how to pick his moments!

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Would you look at that, Oscar—Socks has claimed the armrest as his throne again.

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: He sure knows how to choose the comfiest spot in the room.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: If you offer a belly rub, he'll be your loyal subject for the rest of the night.

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: I just gave him a scratch behind the ears, and now listen—he’s got that gentle purr going. I think I’ve won his favor.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: He doesn’t let just anyone in his royal circle.

dialogue.speaker: Oscar
dialogue.text: Guess I’ll have to make sure I stay in his good graces from now on.

meaning: The dunlin (Calidris alpina) in its winter plumage, formerly thought to be a separate species.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: The mudflats were teeming with birds this morning; I swear I’ve never seen so many at once.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You must have caught them at just the right tide; some of the smaller waders tend to blend right in.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There was a flock of little grey-brown ones bunched together—tiny, with quick, darting moves. I couldn’t quite place them.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Ah, you spotted a group of purre! They flock in huge numbers this time of year, all looking rather subdued as they scurry along the shoreline.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No wonder they caught my eye—there’s something charming about how synchronized they are.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Wait until you see them take flight; the way they shimmer in unison is something I never get tired of.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I went birdwatching by the estuary this morning and the shoreline was full of tiny grayish birds.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: You must have seen the purre along the water—they're dunlins in their winter plumage, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That's fascinating! I always thought they looked different in the summertime.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: In summer, they have those warm rusty tones; it's almost like looking at a different bird entirely.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No wonder I nearly missed them—they blend in so well this time of year.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: It makes spotting them even more satisfying when you're out along the shore.

meaning: Expressing contempt, impatience, or disgust.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: This group project feels like it's never-ending, especially with all the extra work landing on us.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Honestly, I'm not surprised. Jacob's barely shown up for half our meetings.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: And when he does, he just scrolls on his phone like we're invisible. It's exhausting.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Push, that's classic Jacob. The guy promises to help, then vanishes when anything's due.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He's got some nerve, that's for sure. I guess it's just us, then.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Yeah, let's just handle what we can ourselves. At least we know the job will actually get done.

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: Look at this—Mark left all his stuff sprawled across the table again after we just cleaned up yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Not again! Does he really expect everyone to just step around his mess?

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: And what's worse, he borrowed my charger and didn't even bother to plug it back in when he was done.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Push, it's always like this with him. He acts like putting things back is some huge request.

dialogue.speaker: Natalie
dialogue.text: Honestly, it's like he's allergic to being considerate.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Guess we get to clean up after him—again. What a surprise.

meaning: Of a device, engine, vehicle, etc.: that makes a rapid intermittent sound, esp. one characteristic of a small internal combustion engine.
To make a rapid intermittent sound characteristic of a small internal combustion engine.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Listen to that! There’s a little put-put, put-put coming from the driveway—I think someone’s trying to start their old moped again.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, I just heard it now! Is that the blue one with the basket on the front?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Yep, that’s the one. Every time it fires up, it makes the whole street sound like it’s from a different era.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: It’s got character, I’ll give it that. Wouldn’t be the same around here without that odd sound every morning.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: True. Back in high school, my neighbor had a motor just like that—we used to count how many tries it took to get going.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Maybe we should make a game out of it again. Gives us something to look forward to on these quiet mornings.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what I got running this afternoon—Dad’s old lawn mower from the shed!

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: No way! Was it a struggle to get it started after all these years?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It took some muscle, but eventually it sputtered to life, put-put-putting across the yard like it had its own agenda.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: That's a classic! Reminds me of when my neighbor used to cut his grass—could hear that sound two blocks over.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: They really don't make engines with quite that... personality anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Next time you fire it up, let me know—I’ll bring popcorn for the show.

meaning: To make a rapid, intermittent sound, esp. that of small internal combustion engine.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: There it goes again—something's making noise right by the garage.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You hear that putter every Saturday. That's just old Mr. Nelson revving up his lawnmower.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: He really sticks to his weekend routine, doesn’t he?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Rain or shine, that sound is like our neighborhood alarm clock.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: At least he keeps his grass tidier than anyone else on this street.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If neat lawns were a competition, he'd win just for consistency.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something's making a racket by the driveway again—guess the neighbors are at it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh? What kind of noise are we talking about this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It sounded like one of those tiny engines struggling. Not quite a car, not quite a leaf blower.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: So it started to putter, all uneven, like when Dad would try to fire up his old minibike after winter?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s the exact noise—kept going for a couple minutes before it finally went quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I bet that’s Mrs. Collins with her ancient scooter. That thing has more personality than horsepower.

meaning: Representing the sound of laughter.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You know that moment when you try to act cool but end up tripping over your own shoelaces? That happened to me in front of my entire class today.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: No way—py hy, py hy! I can just picture your teacher's face trying not to laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Worse! He actually asked if I needed a helmet for future hallway walks.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: At least you’ve set a new standard for stylish entrances.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Apparently, I’m the new trendsetter in clumsy chic.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Hey, every fashion era started somewhere. Yours just began with a stumble!

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Ha! Py hy! You should've seen my face just now—I almost sat down on my cat instead of my chair.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That sounds like chaos! Is Luna okay?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: She’s perfectly fine. She just gave me the most dramatic glare, like I ruined her entire afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That glare is iconic, honestly. You’re lucky she didn’t launch a full protest.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: I think the only protest will be in the form of fur on all my clothes for the next week.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Consider it a fashionable reminder of your clumsy moment.

meaning: Of a duck: to make its characteristic harsh sound.
A state of hoarseness or croakiness in the throat.
Representing the characteristic harsh sound of a duck, or a noise resembling this.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look over by the reeds—something’s causing a ruckus near the water.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Is it those ducks again? They always seem to take over the whole pond.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, and they look extra lively today, flapping around like they own the place.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You can hear them even from here—quack, quack, like they’re having a serious conversation.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe they’re debating over who gets the last crumb someone tossed in.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: With all that noise, I’d say it’s a full-blown duck parliament meeting!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Look at that little duck family gliding in the pond, Sarah. They seem completely unbothered by all the joggers passing by.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Haha, yeah! Oh—listen! That one just let out the loudest 'quack' right as that dog walked past. I think it's trying to defend its territory.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, if I were that small, I'd try to sound big and tough too.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Maybe if we hang around a bit longer, we'll get to hear an entire duck chorus.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Now that would be something—nature's own little concert right here on a Saturday morning.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: If only they'd harmonize instead of just yelling at each other!

meaning: Representing the characteristic harsh sound of a duck, or a noise resembling this.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you hear that just now? The duck by the pond went quake, quake so loudly, it startled all the others!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I did! That one always makes such a racket compared to the rest. He's a real character.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, every time he starts up, I wonder if he's trying to boss the whole group around.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe he's just showing off. The others seem to pay attention—at least for a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He's got everyone trained. Even the geese seem wary whenever he gets noisy.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If he ever wants to lead a parade, he’s got my vote. That’s confidence in action!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Just now at the park, I got surrounded by a whole gang of ducks—one of them let out this ridiculously loud 'quake quake' right at my shoes! It startled me so much I nearly dropped my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That must have been hilarious to see! Were there people around watching you get ambushed?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. There was a little kid nearby who started giggling at the whole scene. Honestly, those ducks had no chill.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Now I kind of wish I’d gone for a walk with you. Sounds like the local wildlife was extra bold today.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You missed out, Ben! The lead duck even stared me down like I owed him breakfast or something.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Next time I’m bringing breadcrumbs—and maybe some earplugs, judging by your story!

meaning: To find (a thing) by feeling about.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Great, my ring just vanished under the couch. This is why I can’t have nice things.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t panic, Emily. We’ll get it back, even if we have to move every cushion in this place.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I’ll try reaching under here, but it’s so dark I might end up grabbing a lost sock instead.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Hang on, I’m just going to quafer around by the wall—sometimes things roll farther than you think.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you find that mystery gum wrapper again, please spare me the details.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Aha! Got the ring! Honestly, this couch is like a black hole for small stuff.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This closet is a maze—I’m basically quafer-ing through piles of shoes and winter coats to find my headphones.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Try checking that little basket on the shelf. You tossed some stuff in there last week when you were cleaning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just checked, but all I found were old chargers and an empty gum container.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Oh! Weren’t you listening to music while sorting those board games? Maybe you set your headphones down over there.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Nice memory—that’s it! They were under a Monopoly box.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Success! Your search technique is honestly next-level.

meaning: The sound of the cry of a raven.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: That mossy path beyond the creek turns into a different world at dusk—I can’t believe how the shadows stretch across the ground.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You braved that place at sunset? Something must've stood out to send that shiver down your spine.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Yeah, at first everything just felt still, then all of a sudden from the treetop above, 'qualm, qualm!' cut through the air and I nearly jumped out of my boots.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I can picture it! Sounds like the forest was ready to test your nerves with its own soundtrack.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Even after the noise faded, my heart was still thudding—those woods know how to hold onto a moment.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Next hike, I’m grabbing my flashlight and coming with you. Two sets of nerves are better than one in that kind of place.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: It’s almost eerie how still everything is out here—like the world’s holding its breath.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Seriously. You’d never guess we’re only a few miles from town. I keep hearing something up above though—maybe a bird?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: There it is again! Whatever it is, it’s got a pretty commanding call, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Did you catch that? It just went 'qualm, qualm' and the sound totally cut through the silence.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: That raven’s really letting us know whose woods these are. Adds some drama to our trek.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Nature’s got a flair for the theatrical—beats any playlist I could’ve brought along.

meaning: Representing a harsh croaking or honking sound made by certain birds and animals.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that sound echoing from the marsh just now?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: For sure, it kind of startled me! What on earth is living out there?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It went like, 'quank, quank'—like it’s trying to be both dramatic and a little annoying at the same time.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s actually a perfect description! I’d say that’s got goose written all over it.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Yeah, either that or some mysterious marsh monster with serious vocal skills.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe we should count our steps—never know when a feathery performer might demand an encore.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe what I saw on my walk at the park this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Oh? Something strange or just the usual ducks fighting over bread?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No, it was this big goose making the loudest noise—like, 'quank, quank!' It made everyone stop and stare.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Those geese can be really intense! Bet it startled a few people.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: For sure! A little kid even dropped his ice cream when it happened.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Next time you go, let me know—I want to see this noisy goose in action!

meaning: Of a bird or other creature, esp. a rook, crow, or domestic fowl: to utter a harsh call, to squawk.
The black-crowned night heron, which has a deep, hoarse call.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: The chaos outside today almost made me spill my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: What happened this time—was it the neighbor's dog again?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Worse, actually. There was an enormous black bird hopping on the picnic table.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That sounds a bit Hitchcockian. Did it do anything odd?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It kept staring at me and making these ridiculous, raucous sounds—I nearly dropped my plate.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh, I know the type! Suddenly you just hear, 'quawk!' right when you least expect it.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at that flock gathering by the old oak—must be something tasty down there.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No kidding! And one of those crows just gave a giant quawk right as it landed on the branch.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That sound always makes me jump—they never fail to announce their arrival.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: They're a loud bunch, for sure. You can't miss them even if you try.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Last time I brought bread crusts, they all swooped in within seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Next time, they might just start demanding snacks before you even unpack!

meaning: Representing a choking sound or a death rattle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This salsa is no joke—I swear it's got more kick than last time!

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Are you sure you don’t want some milk? You look like you’re breathing fire.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: *clutches throat, coughs* Queck… queck… *wheezes and tries to catch breath*

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Whoa, Megan! Here, take some water—don’t scare me like that.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: *drinks water, shaky laugh* Remind me not to challenge your homemade recipes again.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Deal, but next time, I’m keeping a glass of milk on standby for you just in case!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You really outdid yourself with this chili, Chris—my mouth’s doing cartwheels.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Only the bravest can handle my secret ingredient. Think you’re up for a second helping?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Oh, wait—hold on—*coughs*—this bite's fighting back.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Whoa, that was a solid 'queck'; you need some water?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah—thanks! That one tried to take me out for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: You've officially survived round one of the chili gauntlet!

meaning: An audible release of air from the vagina, typically during or after sexual intercourse.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You'll never guess what happened during Pilates today—right when I rolled up into shoulder stand, I totally queefed and everyone looked over!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh, Lucy, that must've been so unexpected! How did you even manage to keep a straight face?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Barely! I just stared up at the ceiling and pretended nothing happened, but inside I was dying.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, yoga and Pilates classes are like a minefield for awkward noises. You're definitely not alone.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: True. At least now I can add ‘unexpected sound technician’ to my resume.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If they ever hand out medals for keeping it together, you deserve gold!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can't believe how much we laughed last night—there was a moment I thought I'd just melt from embarrassment.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You mean the queef moment? Honestly, it just made things more hilarious. I promise it didn’t faze me at all.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Seriously, your sense of humor is pretty much saving my sanity right now.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Hey, if we can’t laugh together at silly stuff, what’s the point?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thanks for always making things easy to talk about.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Anytime—awkwardness is way less scary with you around.

meaning: To make squelchy sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Remind me why we thought a shortcut through the park was a good idea after yesterday’s storm?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Because we didn’t want to be late—and you said you liked the smell of wet grass.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, now my sneaker’s sunk in this mud—quelch—lovely. I hope the rest of the path isn’t like this.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sound was something else. Bet you didn’t know shoes could do that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Pretty sure my socks are making new noises too, thanks to you.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Hey, look on the bright side—you’ve got a memorable start to your day now! Let’s dodge the really swampy bit up ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Well, my brand new sneakers are about to get properly initiated by this marshy mess.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: If you survive this stretch, just imagine how heroic your shoes will look at the finish.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing... whoa, this part looks almost bottomless.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Ugh—quelch! You just turned that mud into a percussive instrument. Was that your foot or a small animal making that noise?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No animals, just my dignity slowly getting sucked down with my left sock.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Let’s call it a spa treatment—nature’s way of exfoliating footwear and pride alike.

meaning: To grunt, croak, groan, sigh, etc.; to grumble, complain.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Guess what landed on my desk—another surprise task from Linda, due tomorrow morning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You have got to be kidding me. Doesn’t she realize we already have too much going on?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. I haven’t even finished yesterday’s pile.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I don’t know how we’re supposed to keep up at this rate.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Maybe if we split up the work, we can make it through without pulling an all-nighter.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Quirk... splitting it up sounds like the only way we’ll survive. Lead the way, I’m right behind you.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If I have to proofread this proposal one more time, my brain might just leak out.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Quirk... Every time I open that file, my shoulders tense up. It's like the never-ending task from the twilight zone.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You and me both. My eyes are starting to cross from staring at these charts all day.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe we should lobby for eye massages as part of our benefits package.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: At this point, I’d settle for a strong cup of coffee and five minutes away from the screen.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Race you to the break room before someone calls another meeting.

meaning: To make a whirring sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Something’s off with my old desktop; listen, the sound is getting wild again.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Is it doing that thing where the tower kind of rattles, or is it something new?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It's more high-pitched this time. Starts slow and then speeds up whenever I open a program.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh, I know that noise—quiz, quiz, quiz whenever it gets busy. Sounds like the fan’s working overtime.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I was worried it was about to give out completely, but that would make sense.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Let’s pop the case open and see if the fan needs a good dusting or maybe a drop of oil.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Do you catch that weird noise? It’s been sneaking up behind the silence for the last hour.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Yeah, now that you mention it, it’s hard to ignore. It started around the time we stayed late.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It keeps going, quiz, quiz, quiz, like some little gremlin’s got a secret engine over there. Think it’s coming from the copier?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That's definitely possible, but it might also be the mini fridge acting up again.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let’s play detective—I'll check the copier if you want to investigate the fridge.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Deal. Maybe we'll finally solve one of the Great Office Mysteries tonight.

meaning: To tremble, wriggle, writhe; to throb, pulsate, palpitate.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: The rainstorm last night was absolutely wild—I swear my window was vibrating all night.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Mine too! At one point, the whole pane started to quop with every clap of thunder.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I know exactly what you mean; I thought it might burst with the next lightning strike.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Every time the wind picked up, I felt like my room was alive.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Next time I’m sleeping with earplugs and a pillow over my head.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit—ready for the next stormy symphony!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: My heart nearly jumped out of my chest when I lifted the old blanket in the attic and saw a nest of pale, wiggling worms underneath.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Oh wow, Megan, just imagining that makes my arms quop. That’s the kind of thing that gets under my skin for hours.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I almost dropped the whole box! They were moving in the weirdest way—so many squirmy little bodies all at once.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If I ever saw that, I think I’d end up tossing the box straight out the window. I can’t deal with stuff like that.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I ended up sweeping them outside, but I couldn't shake the feeling for the rest of the day.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Yeah, now I’m going to think twice before poking around in my own attic. Those surprise worm parties are not for me!

meaning: A harsh swish.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: This wind is wild today—my umbrella nearly flipped inside out!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. These branches overhead keep whipping around like they’re trying to snag my scarf.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: One of them just swung so close—raish—it startled me for a second!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You jumped back pretty quick! I don’t blame you, that sounded intense.

dialogue.speaker: Eric
dialogue.text: Honestly, at this rate, I might just let the wind take me for a spin.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If you do, at least try not to land in the muddy puddles—you know those are waiting for someone.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you can reach that toolbox, my arms might survive this clean-up.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes—whoa, that tarp just went raish when I brushed past! Did not expect that.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That sound makes me jump every single time—this garage is full of surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Seriously, I'm about to wear earplugs if we dig any deeper in here.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Better brace yourself if you go near those old curtain rods next.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Noted. One cautious step at a time from now on.

meaning: To vomit.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Never should’ve had that chili dog before Space Blaster. The second we stopped spinning, I bolted and—ralph—right behind the souvenir stand.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh no, Jake! Did anyone see you, or was your epic escape unnoticed?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I think a couple of kids saw, but I tried to play it cool. Honestly, my head’s still spinning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You survived the wildest ride at the park and got a story to tell. That’s a win in my book.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, my stomach definitely won’t forget it. Could use some ginger ale, though.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let’s hunt some down before you start eyeing the trash cans again!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You disappeared for a bit at the party last night. Everything okay?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, I wasn't feeling too great after all that spinning on the dance floor.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh no, did you end up having to ralph in the middle of all that?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, yes. It wasn't my finest moment!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: At least you survived the night. Next time, maybe avoid the punch.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Absolutely! Water only for me at the next party.

meaning: To eat greedily or noisily.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This burger should come with a warning label—my mouth is already watering just looking at it!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Seriously! I barely finished unwrapping mine before I started inhaling it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whoa, Jake, slow down or you’ll ramp straight through the whole meal before I’m even halfway done.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: What can I say? It’s impossible to hold back when it tastes this good.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At this rate, I’ll need a head start on dessert just to keep up with you.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted—just don’t blame me when there’s nothing left but crumbs!

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Look at the size of these tacos! My stomach’s been growling all afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: If these taste half as good as they smell, I might never leave this place.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Ella, you’re already halfway through yours—ramp ramp ramp—you’re making those tacos disappear!

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Don’t judge me until you try a bite; they’re unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Guess dinner conversations are pointless with you around tacos.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: A silent table just means the food's worth it—pass the salsa!

meaning: Riotous or disorderly behaviour; a rowdy celebration or excursion, a spree.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Would you look at the footprints on my ceiling? That’s the last time I let Corey take charge of the playlist.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Wait, footprints on the ceiling? What even went down after I left with Jess?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, you missed an absolute randan once the conga line started—someone even tried to juggle oranges with a mop.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: No way! I should’ve braved one more hour, clearly. Sounds like a spectacle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I don’t think my neighbors will forgive me for a while. The mop’s still jammed behind the TV.

dialogue.speaker: Paul
dialogue.text: Classic. Next time, I’m not missing the mayhem—or the ceiling parade!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen the randan we got into after the gig—Dave climbed onto the pool table and started belting out ‘Wonderwall’ while everyone just lost it.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That paints quite a picture! Did the owner try to kick you all out, or were they just as into it?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, she just laughed and handed out more crisps. I guess she was enjoying the show as much as we were.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That’s brilliant. The kind of night you remember, even if Dave’s only memory is being cheered on by strangers, I bet.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, he needed the group chat photos for a recap this morning—still insists his singing was 'legendary'.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Next time your crew’s up for another adventure like that, give me a shout—I won’t miss out on a story like this again!

meaning: Representing a loud and repetitive banging noise, esp. that made by knocking or drumming.
To vituperate, rail against, or upbraid a person.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I don’t know about you, but something kept jolting me awake in the middle of the night from the apartment above.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: That's odd—I actually slept straight through. Was it loud?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Very. It started just after the clock struck twelve and didn’t let up for ages.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: It couldn’t have been just footsteps, right? Maybe someone decided to reorganize their kitchen at midnight?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: It was way more intense than that—just this relentless ran-tan over and over, almost like someone hammering without pause.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: If it happens again, I’m marching up there with a cup of coffee and some serious questions.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Finally, some peace and quiet—my afternoon tea almost tastes better when the house is this still.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Hold up, do you hear that weird thumping outside, or am I imagining things?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I did sort of notice something, but I brushed it off as the old gate creaking again.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: No, listen closely—it’s more like a ran-tan echoing against the bins. Someone’s really going at it!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Oh, now I hear it! Whatever’s causing that noise is definitely not a creaky gate.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Should we peek out the window before it turns into a one-person percussion concert out there?

meaning: Senses relating to a blow, stroke, or loud noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you just catch that noise from the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, I did. That made me jump a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It seemed to come straight from the front door area.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe the wind got a little too excited or something fell?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No way, that sounded way too intentional for just the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously, it was a clear rap, like someone wanted to get our attention and then vanished.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You know, these thunderstorms always make me want to bake. There's just something cozy about the rain.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Totally get that. And your cookies are basically legendary at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did that just come from the front porch?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: What did you hear? I didn't catch anything over the mixer.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There was a sharp rap just now—almost like someone knocked but with more urgency.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious. Let's have a look before the cookies go in!

meaning: A rustling or scraping noise.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you hear that noise coming from the backyard?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard something weird. Do you think it's an animal?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I'm not sure. It sounded like something brushing against the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Should we check it out, or just wait and see if it happens again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Wait, listen! There's a 'rash rash' sound coming from the bushes now.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Okay, that's definitely close. Let's be careful if we go out there.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That sound nearly made me drop my notes—did you catch it?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I did! Came out of nowhere, right by the magazine rack.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can’t see anyone from here. Think it’s a mouse or just the building settling again?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: There’s only one way to find out. I’ll be back in a sec.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Well? What’s the verdict, detective?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: False alarm—it was just a stack of newspapers sliding down. You know, all that 'rash, rash' when the paper edges scrape together.

meaning: A disturbance, a commotion.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My coffee break ended up taking longer than I planned, sorry for the wait.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That’s not like you. Did something happen at the café?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sort of—everyone inside started peering out the window all at once.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Did you see what grabbed their attention?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It was hard to see with everyone pressed against the glass.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: The whole street felt turned upside down with all that rasteling outside—no wonder you got delayed.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: That’s the third time in ten minutes someone’s burst out those doors—what’s going on out there?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I don’t know, but there was such a rasteling a couple minutes ago near the pastry counter that I nearly spilled my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Maybe the new guy knocked over a stack of trays again. The last time, muffins went everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If chaos is happening, at least it’s keeping things interesting around here.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: True! Watching all the commotion makes for better entertainment than the crossword.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let’s see if anything else wild happens—I’m keeping my eyes peeled this morning!

meaning: One of the basic patterns or rudiments of drumming, consisting of a triplet preceded by a two-stroke drag and followed by an accented beat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My sticks were tripping over each other on that fast exercise; my hands feel like they’re in a knot.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Did you mean that twisty pattern our instructor kept drilling us on? I saw you practicing it earlier.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, the one with that odd swing right before the accent—no matter how much I try, it keeps throwing me off.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s pure ratamacue trouble! When I first learned it, my hands felt like they were having a full-on argument. Now, it just grooves once you let your wrists do the talking.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So you just let it flow, rather than forcing each part? Maybe I’m overthinking it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Exactly, think less, feel more. You’ll have it ticking along smoothly before you know it.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That last part you played really had my foot tapping. What was going on with your hands there?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Caught your attention, huh? That spot always gets people curious.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Wasn’t that the thing you called a ratamacue? The way you tossed it in sounded slick.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: You’ve got a sharp ear! It takes practice to make it flow, but once you nail it, it really spices up a groove.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: No kidding, it makes the whole rhythm pop. I’d trip over myself trying that.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: If you bring a pair of sticks next time, I’ll walk you through it—no tripping required.

meaning: Representing or imitating a series of short, sharp, rapping or tapping sounds, as produced by firing a gun, knocking at a door, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Something just rattled the living room wall—were you messing around in the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: Not me this time. I was trying to find the missing screw on the porch.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, the sound nearly knocked my book off the table. It was like a mini earthquake.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: Wait, are you talking about the sharp tapping just now?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, suddenly there was this rat-a-tat echoing through the vents—I thought maybe someone was at the door.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: That’s odd. I’ll go check the front step and see if we have unexpected company.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won't believe what jolted me awake at 2AM last night.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh no, what happened? Another one of those odd building sounds?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was different this time. It sounded like someone was knocking, quick and sharp.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yikes. Any chance it was just the neighbor coming in late again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I thought that too, but it was right outside my door, not down the hall.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That would freak me out—a sudden rat-a-tat at your door in the middle of the night is never a welcome surprise!

meaning: Representing or imitating a series of short, sharp, rapping or tapping sounds, as produced by firing a gun, knocking at a door, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Just as I settled in with my book last night, the heater pipes started with that tattartattar again—made me jump out of my skin!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That old building never fails to keep you on your toes, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Seriously! It’s like living in a percussion section some nights.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I bet you’ve memorized every mysterious sound in that place by now.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Pretty close—and yet, every time I think I know them all, there’s a new one.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It’s like your apartment’s got its own soundtrack. Keeps things interesting, I guess!

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: These late-night shifts always make the building feel like a ghost town.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No kidding. Every little sound seems way louder when it’s this empty.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: If the printers start up on their own again, I’m officially out.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hold up—did you hear that out by the stairwell just now?

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: What did it sound like? Don’t tell me we’ve got raccoons again.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: It was like tattartattar, tattartattar—quick and sharp, as if something was rattling the door or banging around.

meaning: A drumming or beating noise; a tattoo.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There's something electric about the way live music fills the street, isn't there?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Absolutely! The energy from that stage is drawing everyone in.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: People are even dancing on the sidewalks—it's contagious.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Those drums have everyone moving, for sure. Want to head closer?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, I love how the rattan, rattan of the drums echoes through everything, like it’s keeping time for the entire crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That's exactly it! Let’s see if we can get right up by the stage.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you notice that weird rattan, rattan on your window around midnight? I thought someone was trying to send Morse code.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: No way, I missed it! Was it loud enough to wake you up?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It actually startled me, and for a second I wondered if a bird was involved again.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That would be a repeat offender—remember last spring’s nest situation?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, how could I forget? Even my cat was on edge for days.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Sounds like your house has a talent for attracting persistent percussionists!

meaning: A sharp rapping sound, esp. of a knock at a door or of reports from a gun, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That was odd—did something just hit the window or am I hearing things again?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You’re not imagining it. That sounded a lot like a knock, but who’d come all the way out here at this hour?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s just a tree branch after all. I swear, this wind makes the weirdest noises.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Except it stopped for a minute and now it's back. That's not something brushing; that’s too deliberate.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, shh—there it is again! Coming from the front door this time.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That sharp rat-tat has me thinking someone’s desperate to get our attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Feels like the world slows down when it rains like this, doesn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Shh—listen. There it is again, that sharp rat-tat against the window! Did a branch come loose?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That startled me for a second—I thought we were alone in here.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Maybe it's just the wind getting playful tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Could be, but I'm tempted to take a peek outside just to be sure.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s crack the blinds together—no ghost stories while we look, alright?

meaning: A sharp rapping sound, esp. of a knock at a door or of reports from a gun, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That was a sharp tat-tat coming from the porch—did you catch it too, or am I just jumpy tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No, I heard it as well. Makes you wonder who’s knocking at this hour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s old Mrs. Riley looking for her cat again, or possibly another package drop-off.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Considering the rain, I doubt she’d be out here. Want me to check, or do you feel brave?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’ll go see—I’ve got my slippers on duty tonight anyway.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If you find a mysterious parcel, just give me a holler before you bring it in!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: These old movies always make the apartment feel cozier, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Hold up, did you catch that? There was a quick 'tat-tat' against the front door just now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No way, I didn’t hear anything. Are you sure it wasn’t just the radiator acting up again?

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Pretty sure—it came from right by the hallway, not the pipes.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, I’ll go check. If it’s another delivery mix-up, I’m charging them rent.

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Careful over there, the suspense is thicker than this popcorn!

meaning: Representing the characteristic sound made by a frog, or an imitation of this.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe how peaceful the pond was after that rainstorm.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Sounds amazing—did you see anything interesting there?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Actually, there were a bunch of frogs all over the place, sitting so still on the rocks.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s awesome! I bet they made all kinds of little noises once it got quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: As soon as dusk settled in, they started up their wild frog orchestra.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I can just hear it now—ribbit, ribbit echoing across the water!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: The ground is so squishy after that downpour, isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Yeah, and look—there’s a whole orchestra of sounds coming from that pond.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Those little critters must be having a party out there.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Ribbit! Think they’ll let us join if we speak their language?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Only if you promise not to embarrass me with your frog impressions.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: No guarantees, but I’ll try to hop into the spirit of things.

meaning: To make a rattling, clattering, or jingling sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Are you almost ready? The picnic basket is packed and I can’t wait to get outside.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Give me one more minute! I’m searching for my wallet—pretty sure it’s somewhere in the hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Check the side table by the door! You left your coat there last night, too.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Found my coat, but the wallet’s missing. Maybe it slipped between the cushions or under the keys tray?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hold on, when I moved the keys tray just now, there was a rickle—sounds like something else is hiding under it!

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: You’ve got eagle ears! Let me check under there... Yes! Wallet rescued. Let’s go enjoy the sun.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That was quite the noise coming from the kitchen! Are you building a robot in there?

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: If only! Nope, just trying to fit all these groceries into the fridge somehow.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It honestly sounded like everything tried to escape at once.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: It feels like that whenever I buy too many cans, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Was that the bag with all the seltzers and beans?

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: Yeah, that’s the one! The bottles started to rickle together when I moved them—guess I should’ve packed lighter.

meaning: To flick through (papers, books, etc.); to thumb (a block of paper, a book, etc.), releasing the leaves in (usually rapid) succession.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This desk is starting to look like a paper avalanche—my notes are all over the place.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You’ve managed to create an archaeological dig site in here. Need an extra set of eyes?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Wait, hold on—riff, riff, riff—sometimes the right page just jumps out at you when you least expect it.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s some serious page gymnastics. Does it actually work, or is it just for style points?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think half my study habits are about hope. But hey—look who just uncovered the missing formula!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Score one for improvisational skills. You’ve turned chaos into results yet again!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: This archive cabinet is like a maze—I can never remember where the financial summaries end up.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Maybe something will look familiar if you open a few binders. Want me to check the left drawer while you take the right?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let me riff through these folders for a second… Ah, I just passed a stack with last quarter's stamp on it!

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That’s progress! Your speed is pretty impressive—wish I could spot things that quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I’ve had a lot of practice getting lost in paperwork. Here’s hoping the summaries are in this pile.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: If not, I'll owe you a coffee for the effort alone. Onward to the next stack!

meaning: A tumult, a racket; the sound of this.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Still can't believe how noisy things got last night, did you manage to get any rest at all?
