dialogue.text: Can you believe the ruckus from apartment 7B last night? The whole building shook.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously, I heard yelling and then a thud that rattled my window. Any idea what started it?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I stepped out for laundry and saw Mark and Jason screaming at each other by the stairs.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Those two again? Did it just end with shouting or did things go sideways this time?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It went from bad to worse in seconds. I could barely keep up with what was happening.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Right at the top of the landing, Jason just smash Mark—I mean, he went flying down the stairs. Unbelievable.

meaning: To utter through the nose.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You sound like you wrestled with a pile of dusty books this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ugh, I wish! Just my stubborn sinuses putting on a performance.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You sure you don't want to trade noses for a day?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: As tempting as that sounds, I'd hate for you to experience this stuffiness.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I swear, every time you talk, it's like there's a constant snaffle sneaking into your words.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If only my voice came with a volume knob just for my nose—that might actually help!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That sounds rough—I could hear your nose whistling from across the room.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, my head feels like it’s packed with cotton, and my voice is totally weird.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Does it hurt more to talk, or to breathe? You look like you need to be wrapped up in a blanket burrito.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: The talking part is battling my nose for sure—every word tries to escape the wrong way.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: When you speak, you kind of snaffle everything out—I half expect you to start reciting Shakespeare through your nostrils.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ha! I’ll take that as a compliment. Maybe I’ll audition for nasal Hamlet next.

meaning: To use abusive or impertinent language.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe what happened by the printer just now.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: What did I miss this time? It sounded tense from my desk.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Sarah and Kevin were arguing loudly—everyone in the hallway turned to look.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: I always thought they got along! Was it that serious?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It wasn’t just a small disagreement; Sarah really snapped at him about the reports.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: No wonder people froze up—she unleashed the full snash right in front of everyone.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, I just came back from the kitchen, and things were definitely heating up between Tom and Liz.

dialogue.speaker: Grant
dialogue.text: Oh no, not again. Did Tom throw one of his fits or was it just regular grumbling?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It was worse than grumbling. He was really getting in Liz’s face about that missing report, blaming her for everything going wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Grant
dialogue.text: That’s just exhausting to hear about. Liz doesn't deserve to be put on the spot like that every time something minor happens.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Seriously, Tom needs to cut out the snash if he wants anyone to work with him. It's making the whole office tense.

dialogue.speaker: Grant
dialogue.text: If he keeps it up, someone should really pull him aside before this atmosphere gets even worse.

meaning: To snuffle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Why do colds always hit hardest when there’s something fun planned? My whole face feels like it’s underwater.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s the universe’s way of keeping us humble. Anything else hurting or just your face being dramatic?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just this relentless sinus clog. Everything smells and tastes like… absolutely nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You are hereby granted access to my secret stash of extra-soft tissues. May they serve you well.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’re a lifesaver. I swear my nose is about to fall off with how much I’ve rubbed it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: And yet every time you breathe, I keep hearing that little snavel, snavel from your end. It’s kind of adorable, I’m not going to lie.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Hey Ben, do you need another tissue? You look like you’re fighting a losing battle with your allergies.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, Olivia, I can’t help but snavel whenever I walk past that dusty old rug in the hall.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s time we threw it out before it takes down anyone else.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’d be saving me from a world of suffering, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Should I bring a hazmat suit next time we clean the office?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If it means I can breathe, I’ll take any protection I can get!

meaning: A sharp clicking sound.

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: You always keep your toolbox so organized, Tom. Mind if I borrow the screwdriver for a sec?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: No problem, Julia. Just a second—let me open the latch. Sneck! There it is, right on top.

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: That toolbox has more character than my whole apartment. Thanks!

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: It’s seen a lot of projects over the years. Fixing up something again?

dialogue.speaker: Julia
dialogue.text: Yeah, my chair’s wobbling like it’s auditioning for a dance show.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Well, that screwdriver should do the trick. Let me know if the chair starts performing pirouettes!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you hear that noise by the back door a few minutes ago?

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard something. It was really quick, wasn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Exactly! It sounded so sudden, almost like something tapping or snapping.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: That might just be the lock making a sneck as it settles. It sometimes does that when the weather changes.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, that makes sense. I always forget how sensitive the old hardware is.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: No worries. If it gets louder, we’ll take a closer look to be sure.

meaning: Of a horse: to turn up, as in sniffing.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you see Max by the fence just now? His upper lip curled up so high, it almost looked like he was trying to smell something weird.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Yeah, that’s called a sneer in horses—they do it to get a better whiff of new scents. Max always does that when there’s something interesting in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s wild, I thought he was just making faces at us. It looks funny every time.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: It really does. Sometimes people think the horse is annoyed, but it’s just curiosity at work.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Now that I know why, I’ll be looking out for it. He’s more expressive than I realized.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: You should bring him an apple next time—maybe you’ll see him do it again up close!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That gray mare by the fence has such a dramatic way of moving her face—she always catches my eye.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: She really knows how to draw attention! Watch her ears—she's listening to everything.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh! Did you see the way she lifted her lip just now? It looked almost theatrical.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That's her special sneer—she loves to toss her head and point her nose up like she's the queen of the paddock.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: She’s got a lot of personality packed into those little gestures. I could watch her all day.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Right? She’s always putting on a show—never a dull moment with her around.

meaning: To cause to click or sound sharply.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: This latch is being a total pain—I swear it's stuck for good.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Let me see. If you push the handle down just a little while you turn it, sometimes it lines up better.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll give it a try, but don’t blame me if the whole thing comes off.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: It takes a bit of stubbornness. Almost like it wants you to negotiate.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Negotiating with hardware—never thought I'd see the day.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: There it is—hear that? Snick! Now that’s a satisfying fix.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This drawer refuses to slot into place, no matter how much I wiggle it.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Let’s see… if I line up these tracks and push here—snick! There it goes.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wow, you made that look effortless.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Sometimes it just needs a little persuasion and a lucky angle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, you’re on drawer duty from now on.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Deal! Slide the next one over and I’ll work my magic.

meaning: To laugh in a half-suppressed or smothered manner; to snigger.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: (snicker) That squirrel outside just tried to steal Caleb’s sandwich and got caught red-handed.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: No way—Caleb’s lunch is legendary. What did he do?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: He yelled, and the poor squirrel froze with the sandwich still in its paws before bolting.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Classic! That’s probably the bravest squirrel on campus now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: For sure—Caleb started giving it a lecture like it was a student in his class.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I seriously hope someone got that on video, we need to immortalize this moment.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I think I just set a new record for most embarrassing moment at work today.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Please tell me you didn't trip over the projector cord again.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Worse. I tried to compliment the new manager on her blouse, but I accidentally called her 'grandma'.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, no way! Did she hear you?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Not only did she hear me, but the whole room went silent—except for Emma in the back, who started to snicker.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If you need a hole to hide in, I’ll scoot over on the floor beside you.

meaning: (With) a snipping or clicking sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That wrapping paper corner is so sharp, Ben! You’ve definitely got a secret technique.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s just years of birthday presents? I do love making the edges perfect.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Are you cutting with those orange-handled scissors again? They sound different from mine.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yep, every time I close them—snicker-snack—they just glide through the paper. Super satisfying.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Now I kind of wish my scissors came with their own soundtrack.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Trade you for a bow! I’m on a roll over here.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, Jake, cape on and towel tucked—are you bracing yourself for my first official attempt at hairdressing?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You’ve watched at least two online tutorials, so what could possibly go wrong? Just spare my ears, alright?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing! Listen for that snicker-snack as the scissors glide through—this is your transformation soundtrack.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sound is weirdly satisfying, but for some reason my heart’s beating faster every time you make a pass.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If this goes well, I’m updating my résumé to include barber. Hold steady!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If I look presentable by the end, pizza’s on me tonight. Deal?

meaning: (With) a snipping or clicking sound.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I could hear you from the living room. Sounds like something serious is happening over here.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Nothing too dramatic—just giving these roses a fresh trim. My shears have seen better days.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, that snick-snack of the blades is unmistakable! It almost makes gardening sound high-tech.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: If only the plants appreciated my sound effects as much as you do.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Should I grab a pair and add to the orchestra, or do you have it covered?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Come join me—there are plenty of thorny branches left to conquer.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This is the shortest my hair’s ever been—my stomach’s doing somersaults right now!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’re going to pull it off, Megan. Change is fun, remember?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Too late to chicken out; hear that snick-snack? The scissors are already working their magic.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It’s official, there’s no escape! Those sounds always remind me of makeover shows.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Watch out, I’ll be the star of one in a minute if this turns out well.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Already calling dibs on the first selfie when you’re done!

meaning: A sneeze, sneezing-fit.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Are you okay, Ben? You look like you're about to sneeze your head off.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, sorry—having a total snick-up right now. These allergies are brutal.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yikes! Do you need a tissue or something stronger?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: A tissue would be great, but I might need a hazmat suit at this rate.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Hang on, I think I have a few in my bag—one moment.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Thanks, Rachel! Hopefully the sneezing calms down soon.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wow, the minute I stepped into the library, I was ambushed by a ridiculous snick-up—my nose totally betrayed me in front of the history section.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Classic Emily moment! Do you need a tissue or just moral support while the books glare at you?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, moral support works, but if you have a tissue, I won't say no.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You’re in luck—my backpack is like a walking pharmacy. Here you go.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You’re a lifesaver, David. Maybe the biographies will forgive me if I keep my nose under control now.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: If not, you can always blame the 19th-century dust—it's a sneaky accomplice.

meaning: To draw air through the nose with short or sharp audible inhalations.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something’s definitely off in here. My nose is working overtime.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: *sniff* You’re right, there’s a weird tang in the air. Almost like burnt toast and… is that vanilla?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe somebody tried making dessert in the toaster oven again.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That would explain the chaos last Friday. The fire alarm nearly gave me a heart attack.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Should we risk a look in the kitchen, or leave it to the bravest soul?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If it smells any stronger, I’ll be grabbing my coffee and heading for the fire escape!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something smells off in here—did you leave something on the stove again?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Not that I remember, but now that you mention it, the air does feel a little strange.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Maybe check over by the window? I can’t really tell where it’s coming from.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Let me investigate... *sniff sniff* Oh, I think the neighbor’s grilling outside. Smells kind of smoky but not terrible.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Phew, for a second I thought we had another kitchen disaster on our hands.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: At least this time it’s just barbecue, not burnt popcorn!

meaning: To snivel or snuffle slightly.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: *sniffle* Can't believe my nose picked today to act up, right before the group presentation.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You sound miserable, Emily. Want me to ask if you can sit out for a bit?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No, I think I can push through. I just need something to clear my head.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I’ve got some peppermint gum in my bag, if that helps at all.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That honestly would be amazing. You’re a lifesaver, Jack.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Just looking out for my teammate—let’s crush this presentation, sniffly nose or not!

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Ugh, every time I think my nose is clear, I just let out a little sniffle. It’s like my body is holding onto winter all by itself.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seems like your sinuses totally missed the memo that spring is here.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: No kidding. At least I can finally taste food again, so there’s progress.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That’s huge! If you need a stash of tissues, I’ve got a spare pack in my bag.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: You’re my hero. Maybe I should just move in with a box of tea and write off the day.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, cozying up with tea and a blanket sounds like world-class self-care to me.

meaning: To sniff, in various senses.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alex, why are you staring so hard at that spice jar? Lost your label-making skills again?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I know, it's ridiculous. I've tried to snift the jar a few times, but I still can't figure out what it is.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Have you checked the pantry for clues? Maybe there’s a matching jar somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Good point. But honestly, all these mystery jars look identical to me.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Sounds like you need a spice intervention! Let’s line them up and solve the case together.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Deal! With your help, maybe we’ll finally crack the code and rescue dinner tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Look what I found at the market! This candle has the quirkiest label—I couldn’t walk past it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let me see! It looks fancy. Do you think it really smells like 'Whispering Meadows'?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You be the judge. Here, snift snift—wow, that’s definitely something.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That hits you right in the nose! It’s almost too fresh, if that’s possible.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess this is what spring would smell like if it did push-ups.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’ve just given my living room scent goals. I might need to steal this idea!

meaning: To sniff, snivel, snuffle.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You look like you just wrestled with a pollen cloud! Tough morning, Ben?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ugh, you have no idea. I woke up with my nose in full rebellion mode.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Is it just today, or have you been fighting it all week?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Pretty much nonstop since Monday. Every few minutes, it’s snifter here, snifter there, like I’m auditioning for some sniffly role.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That sounds miserable! Maybe you need one of those steam things, or a super strong mint.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: At this point, I'd try anything. I’ll see if I can track down some mint on my break.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Wow, Jake, you look like you’ve just run a marathon through pollen season.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. My nose is holding its own Olympics right now.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Do you want me to grab you another packet of tissues? I think you’ve demolished the last one.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Might as well build a fort out of them at this point. At least it would help shield my sneezing.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Honestly, I can hear you across the café—all that snifter, snifter with every page you turn.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If loud snuffling was an art, I’d be a world-renowned painter by now.

meaning: To laugh in a half-suppressed, light or covert manner.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Trust you to be the only one to spill coffee all over your notes two minutes before the big pitch—snigger—I swear, Alex, you must have nerves of elastic.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: It was a disaster, Sophie, absolute chaos. I looked like a walking caffeine ad gone wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least you didn’t drop the projector on your foot again; that’s got to count for something.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: A small victory, I suppose. But my notes looked like modern art, and everyone kept glancing at my blotchy shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, you always wanted to make a splash at work—maybe not quite so literally, though.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Next time, I'll try to keep the coffee in the cup and my dignity intact!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Why do the most embarrassing things happen to me? I waved enthusiastically at a complete stranger who wasn’t even looking my way.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Snigger—your hand was still in the air when you realized, and I had to turn away so you wouldn’t see me cracking up.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Oh, very supportive! Next time I’ll just pretend I was stretching or something.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You always keep things interesting. Life would be so dull without your legendary moments.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If you start filming me, I want a cut of whatever you earn from my embarrassing highlight reel.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Deal—I'll even throw in a director’s chair with your name on it, superstar!

meaning: To laugh in a half-suppressed, light or covert manner.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Would you look at Mr. Briggs balancing his coffee cup on that ancient stack of textbooks? It’s like a Jenga tower waiting to fall.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: One wrong move and we’ll have a caffeinated disaster all over his Shakespeare notes.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Last week he spilled his tea on the attendance sheet. He just blamed 'the tragic fate of paperwork.'

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: I swear, he’s got more plot twists than the plays he makes us read.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: (tries to stay quiet but loses composure) Oh—sniggle—don’t make me laugh! We’ll both be sent to the principal’s office at this rate.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Too late, that sound was heard across the whole library aisle. You’re a menace, Lauren.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So, do you want to hear how I nearly became the office meme today?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Did you finally fall off your chair in the middle of a presentation?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Worse. I tried to unmute myself on the call, but instead I blasted my phone alarm at full volume—twice.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No way! Classic move. Please tell me someone recorded it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Everyone turned to stare like I’d just launched a rocket. Stop that, Lucas—don’t you dare sniggle.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I’m trying to look sympathetic, but you’re really not making this easy for me!

meaning: To laugh in a suppressed manner.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Guess who managed to spill coffee over her laptop during the quarterly report review... twice.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No way. Twice? Was this all in front of the director?

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Oh yes. And I tried to play it cool, but the second time, the director just stared at me in total disbelief.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I can totally picture that. Did everyone else just pretend nothing happened?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Snirt—hang on, I'm losing it over here. Your luck with electronics is legendary.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Add coffee to the list of office equipment I shouldn’t be trusted with!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: *snirt* Oh, come on, Ryan, did you have to draw that tiny mustache on the CEO’s photo—right while she’s staring at us from the slideshow?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I couldn't resist, Megan. Her serious face was just begging for a doodle upgrade.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, thanks for making this meeting infinitely more dangerous for my composure.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If you lose it, I’m blaming the marker, not me.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You’re lucky I’m a master at barely-keeping-it-together mode.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let’s see how long your skills last if I add a monocle next.

meaning: To snuffle; to breathe or speak through the nose, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wow, you sound like you’ve spent an afternoon in a freezer.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Don’t remind me—my nose hasn’t worked properly since breakfast.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Was it that drafty spot by the window again?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Probably. I swear, just breathing feels like a workout.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every other word you say comes out with a bit of a snoach lately.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: If I start sounding like a cartoon villain, just hand me another tissue.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wow, you’re waging an epic battle with that tissue box over there.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Don't remind me. It feels like my nose is on strike.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every time you try to say something, you just sort of... snoach and sigh. It’s oddly impressive.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: If there were awards for creative noises, I’d be a contender today.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hang in there! Should I grab you some peppermint tea or another box of tissues?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Tea sounds amazing. Maybe it’ll chase away my inner walrus for a while.

meaning: To sob.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I thought I could handle anything today, but it just all piled up on me.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Sounds like it’s been really overwhelming. Want to tell me what happened?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I was called out in front of everyone for a mistake I didn’t make, and then—snob—my mind just went blank.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: That’s so unfair. You didn’t deserve that at all.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Thanks for listening, Michael. I just needed someone to understand.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Anytime, Emma. Don't hold it in. I'm here for you, no matter what.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You’ve got that look again, like something’s weighing on your mind.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: I tried to get through art class without freaking out, but I ended up making an even bigger mess.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Art’s supposed to be messy! But I can see it’s more than that—want to let it out?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: *snob* I just felt so embarrassed in front of everyone, and now I keep thinking about it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, nobody there was judging you like you think. You’re one of the bravest people I know.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: That… actually helps a bit. Thanks for listening to me spiral.

meaning: A knock; a smart blow.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Something just startled the cat—did you catch that sound from the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it. It was pretty sudden. You think someone's at the door?

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Maybe? I can't tell if it came from inside or out. It didn't last long.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I swear it was a snock—real quick, just for a second—then silence.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious. Only one way to find out.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Alright, let's take a look together. If it's trouble, at least we'll both know!

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Ugh, the filing cabinet is stuck again. Why does it always do this when I'm in a hurry?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Try giving it a gentle tap—sometimes that helps mine at home.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes... one good snock—there! It opened.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Nice work! Maybe you should fix all the stuck drawers in the office.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: If it just takes a little encouragement, I think I can manage.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Remind me to call you next time my desk gets stubborn!

meaning: To strike sharply and smartly; to break in this way.
A sharp blow or impact; the sound made by this.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That old ruler has survived years of art projects—are you really about to test its limits on that stack of cardboard?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: All it needs is a quick wrist action—ready? Snop! Did you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I felt that through the table! You didn't even hesitate.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Timing is everything. Once the tension builds, the rest happens fast.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You just might have revolutionized my approach to cardboard cuts.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hey, sometimes you have to risk a relic for the perfect slice.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Alright, Lucy, here goes—if this lid doesn't come off now, I'm giving up. One, two—snop! Did you see that? Finally!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: That was loud! What did you do, karate chop it?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Nope, just a firm twist, but I think the stubborn lid met its match.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, at least you didn’t send pickles flying across the kitchen this time.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Last time was an accident, I swear. Now, who wants the first pickle?

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Count me in, as long as you leave the dramatic openings to me next time!

meaning: Of animals, esp. horses: to turn up, as in sniffing.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you look at Max over there? He sure has his nose up in the air this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: He’s pacing in circles, too. Maybe something caught his attention on the breeze.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It could be those new bales of hay we unloaded earlier, you know how picky he is.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: True enough. He can spot any change from a mile away—and he never lets it slide.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s stand back a bit and see what he does next, don’t want to startle him.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Watch his muzzle now—he just snored and perked up his ears, he must really be curious about what’s new.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You'd think with this much wind, the horses would be hiding, but look at Max trotting around.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: He hasn't taken his eyes off that patch of trees since we got here.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Maybe he spotted something moving. Did you catch what it was?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Just a glimpse—a flash of gray, could be a squirrel or something.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: He snore'd so sharply, you'd think he was challenging whatever it was to come closer.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Max always has to put on a show for his audience—even the wildlife.

meaning: Of the nose: to turn up, as in sniffing.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You can't tell me you've never had durian before—it's supposed to be the king of fruits!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Durian? *snort* Just the thought of it makes me want to leave the room.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: And here I thought you were the adventurous one in this friendship.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I’m happy to climb a mountain, but a fruit that pungent is a whole different challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Alright, brave explorer, maybe I'll try a safer snack next time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit—bring on the apples and peanut butter!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: The roses are practically showing off today—look at all that color.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: *Snort.* Honestly, they're a bit much for my taste.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Classic Grace, giving the bouquet a nose in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: I just have high standards for flower fragrance, that's all!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If we walk past the lilacs, are you going to critique them too?

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Only if they try to overwhelm me. Onward to the next floral contender!

meaning: Of the nose: to turn up, as in sniffing.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wow, something just drifted over here—can you smell that from the corner?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh, I definitely catch it now. Smells like they burned another batch of coffee beans.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's so strong it could probably wake up the whole block.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: My nose practically twitched on its own—it's that intense.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You just did a perfect snurt right there, Lucas! I wish I'd caught that on camera.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Hey, that’s my secret technique for surviving morning walks—don’t judge!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You know, the bakery on Maple has a new lemon tart in the window—I nearly stopped in my tracks when I saw it.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Did you get one, or were you just tempted by the display again?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I was about to, but Mrs. Thornton was already there, eyeing the pastries like a hawk.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: She always has something to say about their baking. I bet she inspected every crumb.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, she did—and when I mentioned the lemon tart, she shot me one of her infamous looks, barely glancing at the display.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let me guess, she did that little snurt with her nose? She only does it when something doesn't meet her impossibly high standards.

meaning: Snuff.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wow, there’s a whole archive of oddities up here. Did you see this little engraved box behind the lantern?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Let me get a closer look! Those patterns are so intricate—it almost looks royal.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There’s something inside. The lid slides open so smoothly, it almost feels ceremonial.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Careful, Megan! Whatever’s in there, it’s older than both of us put together.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If I were a fancy lord, I’d just go—snush!—and carry on with my day like nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: You’d make a convincing noble. Maybe a little too convincing with that performance!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can’t believe that towel caught fire so fast! My hands are still shaking.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That was pretty dramatic. Good thing you reacted quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, one second there was a little flame, then—snush—it was out and we could breathe again.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You handled it like a pro, honestly. I probably would’ve panicked.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Trust me, my brain was running a mile a minute the whole time!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Well, crisis averted. Let’s keep the rest of dinner a little less exciting, yeah?

meaning: Uttering a series of short, quick, usually high-pitched sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That squirrel just did a full somersault off the branch! These park critters are putting on a show today.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: No kidding, and over near the bench—look at those birds fussing over that crust you tossed.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: They're acting like I dropped a treasure chest instead of a bread heel.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Did you catch that one robin just now? It started snuttering the second another bird swooped in, all flustered and hopping in place.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Haha, guess I triggered some feathered drama. Maybe if I toss another piece, they'll call a truce.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Honestly, I'm not sure if they're fighting or composing the soundtrack for our afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should've seen the chaos by the pond earlier—a whole family of ducks darted straight through my picnic!

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Oh, I caught that too! The tiniest duckling was snuttering the entire time, weaving between sandwiches and flapping like it owned the place.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I had no clue something so small could make such a fuss.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: When one of the sandwiches fell, it got even bolder—charging in circles and making those sharp little bursts.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time I’ll bring popcorn just to see what happens.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Count me in! Maybe we’ll witness a full-on duckling parade by the lemonade.

meaning: To catch the breath in a convulsive manner as the result of violent emotion, esp. grief.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You've been clutching that photo for a while—something happen today?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I got a call from Mom... (sob) Grandpa passed away this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh Rachel, I can’t imagine how hard that must be.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He was always there for every birthday and holiday.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If you want to talk about those memories or just sit with me, I’m here.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Thank you. I just... I really need that right now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It just hits me all over again every time I look at his photo.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Losing someone like that leaves such a deep ache. How are you holding up right now?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Some days I feel like I’m managing, but today—everything feels so raw.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You don’t have to go through this alone. I can just listen if you want to let it out.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I thought I could talk about it, but—sob—I can barely find the words.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: It’s okay, Emily. Take your time. I’m here for you, no matter how long it takes.

meaning: To sigh.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: Wow, you look like you just ran a marathon—what's up?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It feels like I did. Today was a disaster from start to finish.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: Yikes. Was it the meeting or something else?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Sock... First my presentation wouldn't load, then someone spilled coffee all over my notes. I just couldn't catch a break.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: That's harsh. You definitely deserve a guilt-free dessert tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You know what, that's the best plan I've heard all day.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Didn't expect to see you camped out at your desk this late.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I know, right? It feels like the deadlines just keep multiplying on me.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Any chance you can delegate some of that or is it all stuck with you?

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Sock... If only. It seems everything urgent lands in my inbox when everyone else logs off.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That’s brutal. Maybe you need a walk or a coffee run to reset for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: You know what? That actually sounds like the perfect escape right now, thanks.

meaning: A dull, heavy sound; a thud.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If that bookshelf falls apart again, I’m blaming the instructions.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Did you just hear that? Sosh! Something heavy must've hit the floor upstairs.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Great, as if we didn’t already have enough chaos with all these boxes.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let’s hope it wasn’t your plant shelf taking a dive.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Those succulents have survived worse, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let’s finish unpacking before the furniture declares war on us.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That vibration nearly rattled my coffee—what's going on in there?

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Ugh, sorry! I was trying to grab my laptop and everything on the table shifted.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Did anything end up broken or is the universe just giving us a warning shot today?

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: All good, thankfully. It was just my thermos taking a nosedive—I caught it, but my stack of books wasn't as lucky.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: No wonder the floor made that massive sosh; I thought you dropped a bowling ball!

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Honestly, with the way that textbook hit, it might as well have been one.

meaning: The sound made by a heavy, soft body falling upon or otherwise coming in contact with a surface; a heavy, awkward fall.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If we can get this bean bag up the stairs, I'll buy you pizza for a week.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That’s a tempting offer, but you know these things are like trying to hug a walrus.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Okay, ready? Let’s heave on three. One, two—wait, get a better grip!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ve got this side... or at least I think I do.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Watch your feet, it’s wobbling! Steady, steady—

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Soss! And there it goes, flattening my last hope of free pizza.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe it—just now, I tried to balance that giant beanbag on top of the dresser, but as soon as I stepped back, it went soss right onto the floor. I nearly jumped out of my skin.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Seriously? No wonder I heard that thud from the kitchen! Did anything else come down with it?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Thankfully, just the beanbag took the dive. I think it’s plotting against me at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Well, your acrobatics are definitely keeping things interesting around here. Should I start supervising your furniture rearrangements?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hey, I’ll have you know it’s all part of my process. Maybe next time I’ll tackle something a little less ambitious.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Or stick to beanbags—at least when they fall, nobody gets hurt except your dignity!

meaning: A heavy blow; a thump.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If this couch gets any heavier, I’ll have to start charging rent for lifting it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, I’ve got the tricky end. Let’s pivot right before the hallway or we’re doomed.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Alright, nice and slow… watch out for the lamp behind you!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Too late—souse! That was the leg hitting the wall, wasn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yikes, that sounded brutal. Let’s check for battle scars after we’re done wrangling this beast.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Agreed. Next time, I’m insisting on bean bag chairs only.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You are not going to believe my morning—chaos from the moment I hopped out of bed.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let me guess, it involves you versus gravity again? What happened this time?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: One second I was speed-walking with my coffee, and the next, my foot caught on the edge of the hallway mat.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And then—souse! Right into the side table, isn't it? That mat’s been plotting your downfall for weeks.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’m starting to think it’s got it out for me. At least my mug survived the ordeal.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That mat’s more dangerous than rush hour traffic for you! Maybe invest in shoes with better grip next time.

meaning: To slap or smack (a person, esp. a child) with the open hand.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just got off the phone with Mrs. Adams—Ethan was sent out of class for talking back again.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Not again. That’s the third time this month, isn’t it? We need to figure out how to handle this before it gets worse.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’ve been reading parenting blogs all afternoon, and advice is all over the place. It seems like everyone has a different opinion.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Seriously, and the arguments get pretty intense. People get really passionate about their discipline strategies.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Some posts even go on about how a quick spank would fix everything, but that’s just not something I’m comfortable with.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Same here. I’d rather sit down with Ethan and really try to understand what’s going on in his head.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Kyle, did you see the way Grace threw her food at dinner? Your aunt said we should handle it the old-school way.

dialogue.speaker: Kyle
dialogue.text: She literally said, 'Just give her a quick spank and she'll never do it again!' I can't believe that's still advice people give.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Yeah, that kind of thing makes me cringe. I’d rather talk to her and teach her why it’s not okay.

dialogue.speaker: Kyle
dialogue.text: Same here. I just don’t think it fits with how we’re trying to raise her.

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: It definitely doesn’t. She learns so much more when we stay patient.

dialogue.speaker: Kyle
dialogue.text: Let’s try another chat with her tomorrow—who knows, maybe this time it’ll sink in.

meaning: To start up sharply or actively; to engage in a dispute.
A tiff or dispute; a quarrel.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Things got interesting in the conference room after lunch today.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Oh? I had my headphones in all afternoon. What did I miss?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Right when the project update started, Alex and Jamie spat over whose design was supposed to be finalized. It got pretty heated.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: No wonder everyone looked so tense when I walked by.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, even Sarah had to step in and calm things down before it got worse.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Office drama seems to be back in full swing, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That was some energy in the break room just now. Seemed like sparks were flying between you and Stephen.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Yeah, things escalated faster than I expected. You know how firm he is about his opinions.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I watched you two spat over the new workflow changes—you both seemed pretty invested in your sides.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I guess it’s hard to stay quiet when you care about how things are done. We’re both stubborn.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Maybe when things cool off, you could grab coffee with him and hash things out.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Not a bad idea. I’ll let things breathe for a bit first, but thanks for the suggestion.

meaning: With a sound suggestive of splashing and smacking.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, there goes my spoon—straight into the batter with a splack! That was not part of my baking plan.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whoa, that sounded dramatic! Did it get you, or just the counter?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Mostly the bowl, but now my recipe card looks like modern art.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Guess this batch is going to have extra flavor and extra style.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If style means chocolate splashes, we're nailing it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hand me a dish towel and let's rescue your masterpiece before it becomes a kitchen legend.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Fetch that big blue bowl, will you? This brownie batter is starting to get wild.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Coming right up. Are you sure there’s enough chocolate in there? It looks extra rich.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Only one way to find out! Here goes—batter to pan—splack! Did you see that?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That was a dramatic pour! I think the pan approves.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If the results taste half as good as they sound, we’re in for a treat.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Next time, you’re in charge of the epic sound effects, too.

meaning: To splash continuously or noisily.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That storm came out of nowhere—my shoes are never drying out at this rate.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The backyard is probably turning into a swimming pool. I left the cushions outside, too.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you hear that loud sound? It’s coming from the side of the house.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hold on, I’ll check through the mudroom window—sounds like something’s gone wrong out there.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If the downspout is clogged again, we’re in for a mess.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You’re right—the water’s overflowing and making a relentless splatter all over the patio stones.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at that downpour! Our backyard looks like a tiny lake now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I’m glad we got inside before it started. No way I’m stepping out in that mess.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Did you hear the splatter against the patio? It’s almost rhythmic, like the rain’s putting on a show of its own.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: It totally drowns out the TV. I never realized raindrops could be that loud.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: All the more reason to make some hot chocolate while we wait this out.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Best idea I’ve heard all day. I’ll grab the mugs!

meaning: To trudge or plod splashily through mud or water.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Great, now my sneakers are going splodge with every single step. This trail wasn't nearly this muddy last week.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You practically painted your jeans with that last splash. Should've brought a change of clothes!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Seriously, I should've expected this after all that overnight rain.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, at least the ducks are getting a kick out of it. Look at them waddling around like this is paradise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I kind of envy them right now. Wet feet don’t seem to bother ducks one bit.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If only we could trade our socks for feathers, right? Let's try to avoid the next swamp disguised as a path.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: My legs are getting a serious workout on this puddle gauntlet.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: And my jeans are competing for muddiest in show. I knew I should've worn rain boots.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you see that kid jump across the stream earlier? He made it look so easy.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, we're out here improvising every step and hoping we don’t faceplant.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every move I make is just splodge after splodge—my shoes basically gave up being dry ages ago.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I vote we find the nearest bench and wring ourselves out before we attempt the next lake-sized puddle.

meaning: The dull, splashing sound of the impact of a hard object striking or struck by something wet and soft; the impact itself.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: These puddles are really turning the street into an obstacle course.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Oh—splosh! There goes my sneaker, straight into the coldest puddle imaginable.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That did not sound forgiving. Are your toes still in there or did they swim away?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: They're hanging in there, but I might need a rescue mission for my dignity.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let’s zigzag around and hope for dry socks at the finish line.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, I’m wearing rain boots—fashion sense aside.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Bet you can't beat my stone-skipping streak at this pond.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Is that a challenge? Move over, I'm about to make these ripples fly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Okay, let’s see what you’ve got—my last one bounced four times!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Watch and learn. I found a real smooth one this time.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Here it goes—splosh! Whoops, more of a belly flop than a skip.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Looks like your champion stone just wanted a swim instead!

meaning: Sloppy. Also, characterized by splashing or sploshing.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Whoa, what happened in here? It looks like a tornado went through the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: I tried to make soup, but I think I underestimated how much it would splash.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: There’s a sploshy puddle under the counter and we’re definitely going to need extra towels.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Sorry! I’ll help clean up if you hand me the paper towels.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, maybe we use a bigger pot.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Or maybe just order takeout and save ourselves the mess!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, that’s one way to redecorate the kitchen—tomato splatters as far as the eye can see.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Honestly, I turned around for two seconds and suddenly it got all sploshy—my shoes squelched when I stepped back.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Classic Jake move, but I appreciate the sound effects.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If only soup could stay in the pot where it belongs.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At least the counters are getting a thorough test of their waterproofing.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Grab a mop and let’s see if we can bring this place back from the brink!

meaning: A large or solid splash or spatter of mud, etc.; a large or glaring patch of colour.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Well, that was a perfect splotch right on my jacket—why did I think hopping that puddle was a good idea?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Honestly, that was impressive. The puddle is probably proud of itself right now.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Great, now I look like I lost a paintball fight.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’d win awards for unique fashion if there were a contest for this.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I should probably take this jacket off before it becomes modern art.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s swing by my place; I’ve got a laundry stick that works miracles.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: My legs are absolutely caked—remind me next time to just wear boots for these after-storm walks.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought my jumps could save my shoes, but that last puddle was too ambitious.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Take a look behind you—there’s this massive splotch on your calf, and it looks kind of artistic from here.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously? That explains the chilly feeling back there. At least the mud went for some creative expression.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: We could open a modern art exhibit in my bathroom with the way we’re tracking colors inside.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Deal—I'll contribute my masterpiece after I wipe these off at the door.

meaning: To plunge.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: The sun’s really glinting off the lake today, Blake. It looks almost too good to pass up.

dialogue.speaker: Blake
dialogue.text: It looks awesome, but last time the water nearly froze my toes off.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, I’m feeling daring! Here goes nothing—splunge!

dialogue.speaker: Blake
dialogue.text: Whoa, Megan, that was epic! How’s the water?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Chilly but totally worth it! Seriously, you’re missing out.

dialogue.speaker: Blake
dialogue.text: Alright, you’ve convinced me. I can’t let you have all the fun!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That water looks like it could wake up a hibernating bear. Are you sure about this?

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: I'm positive! Last one in has to buy ice cream later.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Ice cream after this? I might turn into a popsicle!

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: You’re just scared. Want me to show you how it’s done?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you splunge in with style, maybe I’ll be brave enough to follow!

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Alright, watch closely—this is how legends are made!

meaning: An ostentatious display or effort.

dialogue.speaker: Ava
dialogue.text: I just saw you carrying that huge box into your apartment—should I be worried?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Only if you're allergic to confetti and glitter!

dialogue.speaker: Ava
dialogue.text: Allergic? That sounds like you’re plotting something wild.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let’s just say Saturday’s game night is getting an upgrade.

dialogue.speaker: Ava
dialogue.text: Wait—are you turning this into one of your legendary themed extravaganzas again?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You bet! This time, I’m going for a full-on splurge with costumes, prizes, and a chocolate fountain—prepare to be dazzled!

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: So, the big charity auction is coming up—are you ready to turn some heads this year?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: You know me, Jessica. I'm still deciding between playing it safe or making a statement.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Judging by last year’s velvet suit, I’d say you love a good statement.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I might top myself—thinking of bidding on that neon sculpture and maybe renting a red carpet entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Now you’re just tempting fate. If you pull that off, no one else will stand a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Hey, if I’m going in, it’s going to be a real splurge this time!

meaning: To squirt or spirt out (liquid).

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Why do salad dressings always get stuck near the cap? This bottle's making me work for it.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Try shaking it first, but maybe keep it pointed away from your shirt.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing—wish me luck.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: You’ve got this, but I’m taking a step back just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh great, it did a perfect 'splurt' across the counter. That’s talent, right there.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Your aim is impressive, if only you were trying to decorate the kitchen instead of your salad.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: My burger is seriously lacking in mustard over here.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: One sec, let me wrestle this bottle open for you.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Don't trust those—last week I wore more mustard than I ate.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Relax, I've totally mastered the slow squeeze.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: *Splurt!* Well, that was more dramatic than I planned.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Congrats, now your shirt gets a taste too!

meaning: A noise or fuss.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—someone just dropped a whole tray of glasses in the cafeteria.

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: Yeah, it caused quite the splutter—everyone turned around at once and even the manager rushed over.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I bet the poor person’s mortified right now.

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: They looked so flustered, but the staff seemed to handle it quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, that certainly jazzed up lunch break today.

dialogue.speaker: Miles
dialogue.text: No kidding! You never know when a bit of chaos will liven things up around here.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Did you hear that racket in the hallway just now? It sounded like the building was about to come apart.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, I almost dropped my coffee when something thudded against my door. Any idea what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: There’s a real splutter of noise out there—shouting, bags dropping, and I swear someone’s arguing with a parrot.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Only in this building, honestly. Maybe it’s another moving day disaster.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Or it’s the whole fifth floor running late for something—remember last time?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I do, and I still have nightmares about the trombone traffic jam. Maybe we should just peek through the peephole and see the show.

meaning: Semen. Also: any unpleasant viscous substance.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh man, there’s spooge all over the keyboard! I’m not touching that until you tell me what happened here.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Seriously? I haven’t touched your desk since yesterday. Maybe you knocked something over during your midnight snack raid.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: My snacks are never this disastrous. Last time, it was just crumbs—not...whatever this is.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, point taken. Hand me the paper towels and let’s go full biohazard on this mess.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If you find my missing highlighter stuck in there, I’m not claiming it.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, let's both keep snacks and science experiments out of the study zone.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If I find another spider nest behind these paint cans, I’m moving out and you’re on your own.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You think that’s bad? The amount of dust back here could kickstart a whole new ecosystem.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hold up—what did I just touch? There’s some weird spooge on this shelf and it just got all over my fingers.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That is so foul. Please tell me it didn't touch any of my boxes.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Your boxes look safe, but I might need to amputate my hand.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You deal with that, I’ll get the disinfectant—and maybe some gloves for both of us.

meaning: Mud; slush.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at those puddles! My sneakers barely survived the walk from the bus stop.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You should have seen my shortcut—it turned into a slip n' slide without the fun part.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Lucky you! I ended up plunging half my foot into a pool of sposh by the swings. Now my sock is making this weird squelchy noise with every step.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Nothing says 'park adventure' like soggy toes. Next time, flip-flops might be the move.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If only flip-flops didn’t launch dreck up my legs—then I’d consider it.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, gravel path it is. Here’s to keeping our socks only mildly damp today.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Look at this trail—it's more like an obstacle course after last night’s downpour.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I know, right? My boots are barely holding up, and we haven’t even made it to the pond.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Oh, yikes—listen to that! Sposh! Every step feels like it’s trying to swallow my feet whole.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’re braver than me. I’m already imagining having to hose off at home.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: At this rate, we’ll be wearing the trail instead of walking it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe we should detour before we both become part of the scenery.

meaning: A scream or outcry.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You ever get that feeling late at night when everything’s just too quiet? That was me yesterday around midnight.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Uh oh, that sounds like the start of a horror movie. What broke the silence?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I was halfway up the stairs when suddenly—spraich—this noise just erupted from outside, sounding all wild and desperate.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No way! If I heard something like that, I'd probably trip over my own feet.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I definitely froze for a second. I had no idea what could make a sound like that.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Now I’m never walking past your street at night—thanks for the mental image!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: What was that bang from the hallway? Sounded like something crashed.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: My heart's still racing—I nearly tripped over your sneakers in the dark.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Those old sneakers strike again. Did you manage to keep your balance?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Almost took a tumble, but I just flailed around a bit like a cartoon character.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You always make a scene. Did you accidentally alert the entire building?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Pretty much—couldn't hold back this wild 'spraich!' I bet the neighbors jumped, too.

meaning: A light, tinkling sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: There’s something extra comforting about having a cup of tea while the rain taps away outside.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Listen to that gentle sprinkle on the rooftop—almost like the world decided to add some music just for us.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: It’s the perfect background, honestly. Makes everything feel a bit softer.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: I swear, rainy afternoons like this practically beg for a cozy blanket and a good story.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If only every day came with its own soundtrack like today.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: We might as well enjoy this little symphony while it lasts!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: This window seat always makes me feel like I’m in a quiet bubble, away from the rush outside.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Right? Oh, check this out—I finally bought that wind chime for my balcony. When the breeze comes through, you can hear a gentle sprinkle, sprinkle drifting in.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That sounds magical. I bet it makes evenings at your place feel so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Definitely. It’s like my own bit of nature’s music whenever I crack open the sliding door.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Now I’m tempted to get one for myself! Maybe something with little glass beads.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let’s go shopping after this—I’ll show you where I found mine. The sound really lifts my mood.

meaning: To fuss or bustle; to be in a flurry or in breathless haste.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’ve been spuffling around the house all morning getting ready—can you tell? There’s flour in my hair and ribbons stuck to my socks.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: I can definitely tell, Megan! It’s like the crafting supplies exploded in here. Want some help with the decorations?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yes, please! I thought I could handle it all, but I might have gotten a bit carried away with the banners.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: We all do sometimes! Let’s tackle the table centerpieces next—that should calm things down a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Good idea. If I keep moving in circles, I’ll never finish before the guests arrive.

dialogue.speaker: Laura
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, we’ve got this! And it already looks amazing, thanks to all your effort.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should have seen me spuffle around the kitchen this morning, trying to put together breakfast while hunting for my laptop charger.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh no! Did you at least manage to find it before you had to run out the door?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Just barely! I discovered it wedged behind the toaster, where I'm pretty sure it did not belong.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That's classic—my headphones mysteriously end up in the fridge when I’m in a rush.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, mornings seem to be designed for chaos. Maybe I should start prepping things the night before.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It sounds good in theory, but somehow, the universe finds a way to test us anyway!

meaning: To knock or beat severely; to squash, squeeze flat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You would not believe the disaster that just happened in my garage.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh no, what went down?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I was trying to reorganize the shelves, and somehow the toolbox toppled right onto my old radio.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Did it take much damage?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That poor radio got absolutely squab—there isn’t a single button left intact.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oof, that thing didn’t stand a chance against your toolbox of doom.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, that's a new look for a delivery. Did the box go a few rounds with a sumo wrestler while we were out?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: It's barely holding together at the corners. What did you have shipped, a bag of bricks?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Nope, just some kitchenware. But by the looks of it, someone really gave it a good squab before it landed here.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: That's rough. Maybe your bowls will have a new mosaic pattern—unintended, of course.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Part of me doesn't even want to open it and face the ceramic aftermath.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Hey, if it's a disaster, let's film the unboxing. At least we can get some sympathy views online!

meaning: A wrangle, dispute, brawl; a petty quarrel.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you catch what happened between Jake and Emma in the hallway earlier?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No, I must have missed it. What was going on?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: They had a little squable about who left the science project on the bus. Everyone around was trying not to laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Classic Jake and Emma, always finding something to argue over.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, their arguments are more entertaining than most of the shows I watch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Maybe they just like an audience. Keeps school interesting, at least!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If that wasn’t some serious tension in the breakroom earlier, I don’t know what is.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. Nobody touches the last donut without consequences, apparently.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I swear, Chloe and Mark could’ve started a food war over it.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Honestly, I was half-expecting someone to pull out a whiteboard and draw battle lines.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It turned into this weird little squable, didn’t it? All that over a sprinkle donut.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m bringing my own pastries just to avoid the drama tornado.

meaning: To make a shrill noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: All night, those old pipes were acting up again—honestly, it sounded like something out of a horror movie.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Pipes can make the creepiest sounds. Was it more of a bang, or like a screech?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It started with a rumble, and then out of nowhere, there was this piercing noise. I nearly dropped my phone.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You have to give me your best impersonation. How bad was it, really?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Picture this: total silence, and suddenly—squail!—echoing through the whole hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No way! That actually made me jump. If my house did that, I'd sleep with the lights on.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: You won't believe what happened last night—I heard the weirdest noise coming from the alley behind my house.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Oh, was it that sound where something seems to squail out of nowhere? I got chills hearing it last week when I was walking the dog.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Exactly! It was so sudden, I nearly dropped my coffee mug.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: This neighborhood gets lively at night, that's for sure. I keep checking to see if it's some kind of animal or just the wind.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Maybe we should set up a camera and see what's roaming around after dark.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Good idea. And next time, I'm bringing earplugs just in case!

meaning: To scream loudly or discordantly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That open mic night at the bar was nothing like I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Oh, now I need details! Did something unusual happen?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let's just say the last performer really took things to a new level.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Do tell! What did they do?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Right as everyone's attention drifted, she grabbed the mic and let out this unbelievable squall that had some people ducking under their tables.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: That must've been a shock! I kind of wish I’d seen everyone’s faces.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You wouldn’t believe the chaos near the fountain this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: The fountain? Don’t leave me hanging—what went down?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: A flock of pigeons just swooped in out of nowhere, scattering everyone in every direction.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like a scene from a comedy, honestly. Anyone get caught in the middle?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: There was this little girl clutching her ice cream, and she froze when they flew past—her face was priceless.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Bet that startled her so much she let out a squall louder than the pigeons themselves!

meaning: A harsh croak; a squawk.
Of birds: To croak harshly; to squawk.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Would you look at that seagull? It's marching up and down the pier like it owns the place.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: No kidding! It's practically glaring at anyone who walks by.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that? It just let out the loudest noise—everyone turned around.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, that almost sounded like it was complaining at us for being here.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was more like a squark than a squawk; really caught me off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Well, if I sounded like that, I'd probably get my way around here too!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There it goes again! Something is absolutely having an opinion out there.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: You're not kidding. I think it's perched right on the fence this time.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It sounded just like, 'squark! squark!'—like it’s demanding a five-star meal or something.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
