dialogue.text: Best not let it near a restaurant, or the chef will run for cover.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If it keeps up, I might need to add earplugs to tomorrow’s shopping list.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I'll start charging admission for this backyard concert at this rate.

meaning: To be fussily busy.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The dining table looks like a battlefield after a food fight.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Tell me about it—Jackie's been darting between the oven and the sink with no breaks.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you see her balancing three pans at once? I almost offered her a third hand.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Right? And she somehow managed to reorganize the spice rack in the middle of all that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Only Jackie would find time for kitchen redecorating during meal prep.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: She just can’t help herself—always squatter from one thing to the next, like the queen of multitasking chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If today at work taught me anything, it's that coffee can only get you so far.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That sounds intense already. Was it one of those days where everything hits at once?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Worse—Chloe kept darting around our area, rearranging stacks of files and peppering everyone with questions about their progress.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Let me guess, not a lot of actual work gets done when she starts up like that?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Exactly, it’s like the whole atmosphere gets whipped into a frenzy and no one can concentrate.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Chloe really has that squatter mode down—always bustling and nudging people, but somehow making everything feel more hectic.

meaning: To call or cry with a loud harsh note; to squall or screech hoarsely.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you just hear that squawk from the tree above us? I thought something wild was about to swoop down on my salad.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Seriously! That bird must have some serious lungs, huh? I always forget how loud they can get.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's like they're giving us a soundtrack for lunch. That’s next level picnic ambiance.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: At least it keeps the squirrels from sneaking up. Nobody’s braving that kind of noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If only we could recruit that bird to announce our snack breaks at work.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Imagine the chaos! Our office would never be quiet again.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Would you look at those seagulls by the water? They're practically wrestling over that one fry.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: They’re so bold. It’s like they have no fear of us at all.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No kidding. Remember the time one tried to snatch chips right out of my hand?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: How could I forget? I still laugh thinking about your face when they swooped in.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It wasn’t just the swooping, it was the way they squawked—so loud and dramatic, like they were demanding a five-course meal.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Honestly, they make better beggars than most street performers I’ve seen. Next time, I’m guarding my lunch with both hands!

meaning: To emit a short or slight sound of a thin high-pitched character.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I swear, working late in this empty office is starting to get to me.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Let me guess, the shadows feel like they're moving, or is it something else?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something else. Every time it gets quiet, I start hearing all sorts of little sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: You’re not imagining things, right? Sometimes old buildings make the weirdest noises.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Could be. I thought maybe it was the air vents, until it happened near my desk again.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Hold on—was it kind of like this? *squeak* That’s my chair’s signature move every time I sit down.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You know, this old house makes the strangest sounds after sunset.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I noticed that yesterday—almost felt like the floorboards were trying to talk to us.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: (leans back in the antique rocking chair) Squeak! There it goes again, right on cue.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Seriously, your chair has too much personality at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I’m starting to think it’s auditioning for a part in a haunted house movie.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If it gets any louder, we’ll have to start charging it rent!

meaning: To utter (or give out) a more or less prolonged loud sharp cry, esp. by reason of pain or sudden alarm; to scream shrilly.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you just see that shadow dart across the kitchen floor? I could swear something's hiding in here.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Don't tell me you're about to blame our midnight snack craving for a ghost sighting.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Go over and check behind the trash can. I’m not going near it with bare feet!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Aaah—squeal! Megan, something just zipped past my toes!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I knew it! Was it the mouse again or am I not imagining things after all?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Pretty sure you've got company—you owe me a new pair of socks if it chewed these.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wow, remind me never to wander around your house after dark.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: You think I'd actually make it up? I still can't believe what happened last night.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, you have my full attention. Lay it on me—what did you see?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I was walking past the hallway, and suddenly the old mirror started rattling against the wall out of nowhere.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If that had happened to me, I’d have jumped right out of my skin.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I just froze for a second, and then I let out this ridiculous squeal—my sister won't let me live it down!

meaning: A disease affecting fowls.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The coop’s been unusually quiet today—my hens just huddle and barely peck at their feed.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: That’s odd. Did you notice if any have runny eyes or look fluffed up?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: A couple of them seem droopier than normal, and Penny keeps wheezing.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Sounds like squeck might’ve finally reached your flock. I saw it hit my neighbor’s hens last month.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I was worried it might be something serious. Should I bring in a specialist, or is there something I can do right away?

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: I’d get on it quickly—separate the sick ones and give everything a good clean. Better safe than sorry when it comes to the flock.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Something’s up in the coop—Eggbert’s barely moved all morning and the rest are looking restless.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That sounds rough. Are you noticing any odd noises or changes in how they’re acting?

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Definitely—weird coughing, ruffled feathers, and not a single egg in two days.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Yikes, that matches the squeck outbreak Dad battled last year on his farm. He said the flock turned sluggish overnight, just like yours.

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.text: Ugh, that’s exactly what I was afraid of. You think I should separate the newcomers now?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Isolation helped Dad’s hens bounce back faster—plus, a good bedding change wouldn’t hurt. Let me drop by with some special feed mix this evening.

meaning: Representing a high-pitched squealing or squeaking sound produced by an animal, musical instrument, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Guess who came home with the tiniest surprise from the pet store—yes, I totally caved.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If it fits in your palm and eats lettuce, I'm already obsessed. What did you get?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Meet Peaches, the fluffiest little mouse. She has the most expressive ears and loves her wheel.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounds adorable! What kind of noises does she make when she's excited?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: She does this tiny squee, especially when I open her treat jar. It's honestly the cutest thing I've ever heard.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Now I absolutely have to see Peaches in action—she sounds like a total heart-stealer.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you look at that, Ben—those mice are all tangled in that tiny hammock!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Haha, they're like little acrobats. I think one just did a backflip!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: And did you hear that when they spotted the treats? Squee, squee! They get so excited, it's hilarious.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It totally cracks me up when they do that. They're full of surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, if they weren't so tiny, I'd try to smuggle one of them home in my pocket.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If you did, I'd demand visiting rights every weekend!

meaning: A heavy crushing fall or blow acting on a soft body; the sound produced by this.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: These trails really turn into an obstacle course after a downpour.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Tell me about it—I nearly twisted my ankle just dodging that last puddle.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Whoa, there goes my foot—squelch! Definitely underestimated that mud.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Looks like the mud’s claiming another victim today.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Guess I’m bringing half the park home on my shoe now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At least you’ve got a good story for your muddy trophy collection!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Look at this mess—it's like the park turned into a chocolate milkshake overnight.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: No kidding! My shoes are already plotting their escape route.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing—I'm going through the thick of it.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: Brace yourself! That patch looks even deeper than the rest.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Ugh, did you hear that massive squelch? I think the mud tried to claim me as its own.

dialogue.speaker: Sara
dialogue.text: Too late to turn back now—you might need a rescue mission before we're done here.

meaning: The sound made by soft mud yielding to sudden pressure.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Would you look at this path? It’s like the park tried to turn into a swamp overnight.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Told you these boots were going to earn their keep today. This trail's got nothing on us.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Famous last words. My sneakers are already regretting this adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Just stick close—if one of us goes down, we both go down. That’s the deal.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Wait up, there’s a suspicious brown puddle right in front of you.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Too late—squidge—ugh, that was a direct hit. My sock may never recover!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at that—our favorite shortcut is totally soaked.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Guess the trail isn't letting anyone off easy today.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Well, my boots are already halfway ruined. Should I just go for it?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If you’re feeling brave, I’m right behind you!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing—famous last words, right?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: There it is—squidge—nothing says adventure like muddy socks.

meaning: A giggle or sniggle.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: Did you see Mr. Peterson trying to quietly move that cart? It made such a noisy squiggle, I almost lost it!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, Chloe, it looked like he was battling a haunted shopping trolley.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: I couldn't even look up without risking a total meltdown.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: One more sound like that and we'll both have to stifle emergency laughter.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: At least we know to avoid that aisle unless we're ready to cover our faces with books.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Deal. Next time, headphones are mandatory for library defense!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If that cat tries to climb on top of the shelves again, I might just lose it.

dialogue.speaker: Dylan
dialogue.text: You almost dropped your coffee last time over that furry daredevil!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I know! Every time it wobbles up there, a squiggle escapes me before I can even pretend to be composed.

dialogue.speaker: Dylan
dialogue.text: The barista’s face when you burst out is priceless—she probably thinks you’re part of the circus.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Don’t tempt me or I’ll start juggling sugar packets.

dialogue.speaker: Dylan
dialogue.text: Great, now I’ll never be able to order a cappuccino without bracing for a show.

meaning: A half-suppressed laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So, tell me you didn't really wear two different shoes to your meeting today.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: I wish I could deny it, but when I looked down halfway through the presentation—squirk—I realized my fashion sense had hit a new low.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I can't decide if I'm horrified or impressed by your commitment to accidental style trends.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Hey, at least I set the bar so low that no one else has to worry about dress codes anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm picking out your shoes just to save the office from confusion.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Deal—as long as you don't make it a matching socks contest, too.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You know, Sarah, every time I walk past the campus fountain, I remember the day you tripped over your own shoelaces and splash—straight into the water. *squirk* Just the thought gets me every time.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Ugh, Ben! You really have to keep reminding me of my most epic flop? My dignity is still drying off.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Hey, I only bring it up because it brightens my day. Besides, you made a splash in more ways than one.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: At least I was memorable! Better than blending in with the library furniture like you used to.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Touché. Though I’d say you definitely outshone any old armchair that day.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Fine, but next round of stories is about your embarrassing moments—starting with that karaoke night disaster.

meaning: To wriggle or writhe.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you see that worm in the garden bed? It just disappeared under the soil so fast.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah! I watched it squirm all over the place before it found the right spot to dive under.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Nature is wild—those tiny creatures are more determined than half the people I know.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Honestly! Sometimes I wish I had that much energy just to get moving in the mornings.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Next time I can't get out of bed, I'm going to picture myself as an adventurous worm.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Just don't forget where you planted yourself or I'll never find you for brunch.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You’ll never believe how awkward my dentist appointment was this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Oh boy, did something weird happen while you were there?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Yeah, the chair was making these creaky noises, and the hygienist wouldn’t stop chatting while she was cleaning my teeth.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That has got to be one of the most uncomfortable situations. Did you say anything?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I wanted to, but all I could do was squirm and hope it would be over soon.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously, that sounds like a nightmare. I’d have had trouble sitting still, too!

meaning: To squeeze, to squash.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Check this out—when I squeeze this stress ball, it makes the most satisfying squish.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: That does sound pretty relaxing. Is that how you stay calm during finals?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Exactly! It seriously helps whenever I get stuck on a tough question.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Maybe I should try that. My leg’s been bouncing for the past hour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Here, give it a go. You might be surprised at how much it helps.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Thanks! If this works, I’ll have to bring my own next time.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at this—there's no way this sandwich can take any more cheese!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It’s practically a masterpiece, but I have no idea how you’re going to keep it together.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I’ve got a trick up my sleeve—watch me just squish it down a bit… okay, crisis averted!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Nice move! Just hope you didn’t send any pickles flying across the table.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Only a little lettuce casualty, but I call that a win.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Honestly, the best sandwiches are always a little wild anyway.

meaning: With the splashing or squashing sound made in walking through water or soft mud.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, every step’s a little symphony of squish-squash! These old sneakers had no idea what they were signing up for.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Your sneakers? My socks are basically swimming right now.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Should’ve brought those rubber boots your grandma got you last Christmas.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Don’t remind me! They’re still sitting, untouched, in my closet.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe we detour around that giant puddle ahead? I’d rather not test the depth.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Agreed, let’s keep our feet just a little bit dry if we can!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Check this out, there’s a whole patch of mud blocking the shortcut to the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Looks a little messy, but if we tiptoe along the edge, maybe we won’t get totally covered.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing—if my sneakers disappear, you owe me a new pair.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Every step you take, it’s squish-squash all the way! You’re braver than me.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: At least my socks will have a story to tell after this adventure.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Well, if you make it through that, I guess my turn is next. Here comes double the mess!

meaning: To squirt.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Hand me the mustard, will you? This sandwich needs a little kick.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Here you go! The lid's on pretty tight, just a heads up.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: No worries, I've wrestled with worse. Let me see if I can get it open.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Watch out, that bottle's been in the back of the fridge forever.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Alright, deep breath... here goes nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Whoa! Did you hear that? It went squit all over my shirt!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Could you take over juicing these lemons? My hands are getting tired already.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Hand them over! Let’s see if my legendary arm strength is up to the challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Just watch out for seeds in the pitcher—those sneaky things always find a way in.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No promises, but I’ll try to be careful. These lemons are way juicier than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If you squeeze them right, you’ll get every last drop. Show me your secret technique!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go—squit! Ha, caught that jet just in time before it hit the wall.

meaning: To squirt out, to squish.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Why does the mayo bottle always refuse to cooperate when I need it most?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Give it the classic karate chop on the bottom, that's how my grandma handles it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I went for it... and look—now it just did a massive squizzle all over the cutting board.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whoa, that’s a Jackson Pollock sandwich if I ever saw one.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Art was not on the lunch menu today, but here we are.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let me grab some paper towels—your masterpiece needs a cleanup crew.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Look at this! I squeezed too hard and the mayo just squizzled out all over the counter.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Classic kitchen chaos! My turn with the pickles never goes any better.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Want me to risk adding more, or should I keep the mayo at bay?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Go for it—living dangerously sounds like fun right now.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Alright, steady hand this time. Let’s see if I’ve learned my lesson.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You’re a sandwich artist in action, Olivia. Appreciate the risk for flavor!

meaning: Soft and soggy; squelchy.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: If I knew the park would turn into an obstacle course, I’d have packed an inflatable raft instead of running shoes.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Honestly, every puddle out here looks deeper than it actually is—my socks are regretting this decision already.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: My favorite bit is right here, where the path is all squodgy and every step sounds like I’m squashing jelly.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You just made me want to turn back before my foot disappears entirely.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Oh, come on, think of it as adventure training. Or at least an excuse to buy new trainers.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Deal, as long as the next adventure comes with sunshine and solid ground.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Brace yourself, I tried to make that chocolate lava cake recipe—don’t judge me until you taste it.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Ooh, risky! Hand over a slice, I’ve got my fork ready.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing. I’ll be hovering for your feedback.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: (Takes a bite) Whoa, that’s… a bold texture you’ve achieved there.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wait, bold as in good, or bold as in 'what happened in the oven?'

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Let’s just say the center is especially squodgy, but honestly, I kind of dig it.

meaning: To collapse into a soft, pulpy mass.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen my lunch today—my avocado hit the bottom of my bag and went sqush right into my sandwich wrap.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That must've been messy! Did it get on everything?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It totally did. My chips didn’t stand a chance either.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like your lunch turned into an abstract masterpiece.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, I stared at it for a good minute just debating if it was even edible anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If it wasn’t oozing too much, you’re braver than most if you still tried to eat it.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: My lunch bag had a surprise waiting for me today—definitely not the kind of plot twist I wanted.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That sounds ominous. What happened in there?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I forgot I threw in a super ripe tomato and then set my laptop right on top of everything.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh no, did it survive the squishing or did it explode?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: As soon as I opened the bag, I knew I was in trouble. The inside looked like a crime scene.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That's the worst—one wrong move and suddenly your lunch goes sqush and your whole day is messier.

meaning: To crush, or break irreparably; to destroy.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—my skateboard from when I was a kid! Think the wheels still turn after all these years?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Ben, just one glance at that and I can see it’s been stramash’d. Both trucks are bent and the grip tape’s peeling off in chunks.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No wonder I stopped riding it. I remember one bad fall at the skatepark—maybe that did it in.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That checks out. There's no way you'd get far before it comes apart even more.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Guess it’s time to finally retire this relic, then.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Yeah, let’s send it off to the scrap heap with honors. It had a good run!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won’t believe what happened while I was cleaning today.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Uh oh, what did you break this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: My grandma’s porcelain vase slipped right out of my hands.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: No way, was it that fancy floral one she gave you?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, that one! Shattered before I could even react.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Sounds like it stramash—totally destroyed, huh?

meaning: To play on (a stringed instrument) carelessly or unskilfully; to produce (notes, a tune, etc.) by such playing.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You keep glancing at my guitar—curiosity getting the better of you?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Maybe a little, but trust me, you don’t want to hear what I can do with that thing.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Come on, everyone starts somewhere. Give it a try, no pressure!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: If your ears start to bleed, you can’t say I didn’t warn you.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Just grab it and pick any chord, let your hands figure it out.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Alright, here goes nothing—*strum*—wow, did I just invent a new genre or what?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look what I just dragged out from under my bed—the old guitar from high school.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No way, that thing still exists? Bet it sounds as vintage as it looks.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I can barely remember any of the songs I used to play.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Doesn’t matter, just give it a go. Let’s hear something, even if it’s just a random mashup.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You asked for it—no refunds on whatever comes out.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Whoa, that was quite the strum—pretty sure even the cat is surprised!

meaning: To beat, strike, esp. with the hand; to thump, cuff, knock about.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I still can't believe how wild that dodgeball tournament got last night.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously, when Danny dove across the gym floor to tag Ethan, I thought someone was going to call for a medic.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Danny's competitive streak is no joke. The energy in that room was electric.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Yeah, and Ethan wasn’t backing down—he was dodging and spinning like his life depended on it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Watching those two go at it is better than anything on TV.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You could practically hear the suffet as they barreled into each other near the end—I half expected the dodgeballs to pop from the chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should've seen what went down at Maple Park this afternoon!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh, now you’ve got me curious—what’s the story?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There was this kid in a dinosaur hoodie just zooming after his dad near the fountain.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Please tell me the dino caught its prey.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Absolutely, he pounced and gave his dad a couple of suffet right on the arm—both of them were in stitches!

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That paints the best picture in my mind; wish I’d been there to witness the great dinosaur hunt.

meaning: To sigh.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's almost like everything at work decided to go wrong all at once today.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I thought my inbox was finally under control, then I blinked and got twenty new emails.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: On top of that, my project deadline got moved up. I barely had time to eat lunch.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That sounds rough. My coffee machine breaking this morning feels trivial now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If only there was a pause button for days like this.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Sugh... Maybe we’ll catch a break tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Another night fueled by coffee and spreadsheets—project season is in full swing.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: My desk looks like a storm just swept through. The pile just keeps getting taller with every email.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Managed to break for lunch at 3pm, which has to be some sort of record for me.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: sugh… It’s like we finish one task and three more pop up right behind it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If we survive this week, pizza Friday is officially back on the calendar.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Now that’s the motivation I needed. Let’s power through this.

meaning: To hum softly.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: These charts would look way better if we use more color, don’t you think?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Mmm, let me see... sum sum... Yeah, definitely brighten it up a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You always start making that sound when you’re deep in thought.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Guess it just happens without me noticing! Sorry if it’s weird.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Don’t apologize—it’s kind of reassuring, actually.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe it’ll help us power through this last spreadsheet!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: (softly) Sum, sum, sum... This tune keeps following me around while I cook.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you pick up a new song, or is that one of your classics?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s one my mom used to sing whenever she was in the kitchen, so I guess it stuck with me too.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: No wonder it feels so warm in here. Your humming is basically its own secret ingredient.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If only it could help the soup turn out right every time.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Well, with vibes like this, I’ll take my chances on today’s taste test!

meaning: The sound of something heavy and limp falling.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that? There was this strange 'sumph' from the living room, like something heavy just dropped on the floor.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it! Should we go check it out or just ignore it and hope for the best?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Ignoring weird noises is how people end up in horror movies, Ethan.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Fair enough. Want me to go first, or do you want to lead the way?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let’s both go, but you have to promise not to push me toward danger if it’s something scary.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Deal. But if it’s just the cat knocking over the laundry again, I’m making her apologize to you.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If I can get this duffel bag over the stairs, I’ll officially win the trophy for clumsiest mover.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That thing looks like it weighs as much as a small horse. Sure you don’t want a hand?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Almost there—wait—ugh! *sumph* There goes my perfect record for not dropping anything today.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That sounded dramatic. Is the bag or the stairs worse off?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thankfully, no major casualties—just some very squished sweatshirts.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Your laundry may need CPR, but at least you survived the Great Bag Tumble of the afternoon.

meaning: The ‘spitting’ of a cat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Guess who almost lost a finger in the kitchen? Your majestic princess nearly attacked me for walking past her food bowl.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, I heard her sussing under the table earlier. She gets extra dramatic when she thinks someone’s after her snacks.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, I can’t tell if she hates sharing space or just me personally. It’s like living with royalty.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: She tolerates us as her loyal subjects, nothing more. Have you noticed she only acts up when it’s about food?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Absolutely, she turns into a tiny dragon at mealtime. The other times, she only ignores me.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Maybe we should just bow whenever she enters a room—keep all our fingers intact that way!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I reached out to scratch Bella’s chin, and she whipped around with this fierce look and started sussing at me—totally caught me off guard!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like she wasn't in the mood for company at all.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Not even a little! I froze for a second, then slowly backed away so she wouldn’t turn it up a notch.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Last time I tried that with Jasper, he practically launched off the couch—no warning, just instant attitude.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Guess we’re lucky we only got the theatrics and not the claws.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Lesson learned: cats set the rules, and we just try to keep up!

meaning: To sigh, sough.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Suther... My shoes might just protest if I take one more step today.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: That sound tells me you've had a marathon out there.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Everything that could pile up at work did, and rush hour wasn’t any kinder.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Well, the couch is all yours. Let the world wait for a bit.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Appreciate you, Liam. Just a few minutes to catch my breath would be magic.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: I’ll cue up that nature documentary and put the kettle on—let’s make this evening a soft landing.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: *suther* There goes my energy for the week—today really took it all out of me.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Sounds like you got steamrolled. Want to tell me what happened?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Everything at the office exploded right before lunch, and I still haven't caught my breath. It's just been one thing after another.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I know that feeling. My brain's still rattling from back-to-back meetings.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: We need a break. How about we order some pizza and binge something silly?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I’m all in. Let’s reboot our brains and let today be someone else’s problem for a while.

meaning: A hard blow; a whack, bang.
To fling, dash; to brandish (a sword).

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: So I finally tried assembling that bookshelf on my own last night. The instructions made it look way easier than it actually was.

dialogue.speaker: Jenna
dialogue.text: Oh no, let me guess—it ended with a swack and parts flying everywhere?

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Pretty much! When I tried to hammer in the shelf peg, the whole side panel jumped off the floor.

dialogue.speaker: Jenna
dialogue.text: Classic. Did you at least get it standing, or did it turn into modern art?

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: It’s technically standing, but I wouldn’t put anything heavier than a feather on it just yet.

dialogue.speaker: Jenna
dialogue.text: Guess it’s time to call in backup before someone else gets a bookshelf battle scar!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: So, your DIY streak continues—did you manage to install those new shelves today?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I gave it my best shot, but let’s just say it didn’t go exactly as planned.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Don’t keep me in suspense—what went down this time?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Well, I was holding one end steady and trying to nail up the bracket... which turned tricky fast.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Suddenly, the hammer twisted in my hand and—swack!—it slammed right into the wood instead of the nail.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Classic Jake! Is the shelf still standing, or do I need to bring over some spackle?

meaning: To strike, hit, smite (occasionally used of kissing).

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should've seen Jake's reaction when the dodgeball came flying his way during P.E. today.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Oh, I was right there! That ball went swap against his arm so loudly, even Coach winced.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He dropped his water bottle and just stood there laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Classic Jake move—never fails to turn it into a performance.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, P.E. is ten times more fun when those moments happen.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let’s hope tomorrow brings just as much entertainment; I need the amusement!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You would’ve died laughing if you’d seen what happened during chemistry today.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Spill it, Emily. Don’t leave me hanging.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So, Ryan was trying to impress everyone by stacking beakers three high.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Classic Ryan. Did he actually pull it off or did chaos reign?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was total chaos. Just as he reached for the last beaker, Hannah sneezed and bumped the table.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I can already picture it—beakers tumbling and then swap, right on his forehead! That’s pure gold.

meaning: To strike, hit, smite (occasionally used of kissing).

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That round of dodgeball was pure chaos—my sneakers are still squeaking from all the running.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Pure chaos is right! Who knew you could duck that fast?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Just as I thought I was safe behind the bench, I suddenly felt swop—a ball came out of nowhere and got me square on the shoulder.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You should have seen your face! You looked completely betrayed by physics.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I thought the world had paused for a second before the sting kicked in.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm bringing a camera just for moments like that!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You know that mug I told you is strictly off-limits? Guess who decided to test the boundaries this morning.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Uh oh, let me guess—Oliver got bold again?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Right as I reached for it, he launched himself onto the counter like some sort of ninja.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: And then—swop! His tail flicked it clean off, didn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Absolutely nailed it. I swear, I’ve never seen a cat look so satisfied with chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Oliver really considers himself king of your kitchen, doesn’t he?

meaning: Expressive of the fall of a heavy body or blow: with a crash.
To dash or cast violently.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, here comes the dramatic pancake flip—you might want to step back just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, last time you nearly redecorated the ceiling. Focus, chef!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: This time I think I’ve nailed it. Three, two, one—catch if it flies!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh no, that pan is wobbling! Careful, Ethan!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Whoa—almost lost it! Did you see that jump? My heart just skipped a beat.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Yeah, and then came that massive swash when the pan landed! My nerves can’t take much more of your kitchen acrobatics.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you just feel the floor shake too? Something definitely hit the ground down there.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No kidding. It sounded like more than just the cat knocking over stuff this time.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Should we risk going downstairs, or want to let the dust settle first?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I don't know, part of me says let's just hope it wasn’t the bookshelf again.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That noise was unreal—like, swash! Came out of nowhere and echoed through the ceiling.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, you’ve convinced me. Let’s go play detectives and see what disaster awaits us downstairs.

meaning: To flutter and splash in water like ducks or geese; to splash water about or splash about in water.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Those ducks by the willow look like they’re having their own little party right now.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You’d think they owned the place the way they strut and waddle around the shore.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Last time I brought crumbs, they practically lined up for a snack.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: They’re bold, I’ll give them that. And the little ones are always chasing after the biggest splashes.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, just look now—one of them is flapping its wings and starting to swatter right in front of the others.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: That’s classic. Now the rest are jumping in—I guess it’s a free-for-all this afternoon!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at that—sun's out, ducks are having a field day. This lake might be my new favorite spot.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Totally! The water looks way too tempting. I might have to go for a swim right alongside them.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Those ducklings over there are hilarious. Just swatter-ing around in a group—makes me want to jump in and make a splash too.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’m taking notes from them. If you're not making waves, are you even enjoying the lake?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Exactly! Just try not to get out-splashed by a duck, that might bruise your ego.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted! Watch out, I'm about to make some serious ripples.

meaning: To flutter and splash in water like ducks or geese; to splash water about or splash about in water.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Would you look at those ducklings over by the reeds? The way they switter in circles is making the whole pond sparkle.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: They’re such little whirlwinds! That water must feel amazing on a day like this.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It takes me back to when we dared each other to wade in — ended up just as lively as those ducklings.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: My shoes never dried out, but I couldn’t stop laughing the whole walk home.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’m tempted to roll up my jeans and test the water right now.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: If you do, I’m splashing in after you—race you to the biggest ripple!

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Those goslings over there are making quite a scene by the water’s edge.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I know, just look at them switter—it’s like a little water ballet gone wild!

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: You can practically see their excitement from here.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I’d love to have half that liveliness on a lazy afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Maybe if we joined them, we’d catch a bit of their joy.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Tempting, though I don’t think I’d be as graceful in the pond as they are.

meaning: To pipe, chirp, or twitter, as a bird.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at all that early sunlight catching the leaves. It makes everything glow.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: And listen—those finches sweet from that old oak, right above us.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It’s such a gentle soundtrack to start the day.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I could happily trade city traffic for these sounds anytime.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: We should wander down by the pond; maybe we'll spot more birds along the way.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Lead the way—I’m in no rush to leave this kind of morning behind.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Nothing like an early stroll to start the day, huh? The park feels like it's still waking up.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Absolutely. You can really notice the sounds—the ducks in the pond, the leaves rustling, and all those birds.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Hear that little one near the bench? 'Sweet, sweet'—it just keeps tossing its head back and letting that sound out.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I see it! I think it just hopped over to the blackberry bush, still singing its heart out.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That kind of energy is contagious. Suddenly my coffee feels a little more lively.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Makes me want to slow down and actually listen for once. Not a bad way to kick off a Tuesday.

meaning: To splash or dash about, as liquid.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This bench might not be the best idea now—my jeans are already damp.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: And check out those geese over there; the second the rain started, they began to swilk about like they own the pond.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: They make getting wet seem much more entertaining than it actually is.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If only we could enjoy rain the way they do, right?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Next time it rains, I’m bringing boots and joining them.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Just promise not to drag me into the mud with you, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Wow, the rain just will not let up. I got caught trying to carry groceries home and everything got drenched.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds rough! Did you at least have something to cover the bags?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I used my jacket, but it wasn't much help. My shoes got hit the worst—every step felt like I was hauling a puddle.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: I can just imagine your sneakers going swilk, swilk with every step down the sidewalk. That has to be the squishiest feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It's the soundtrack of soggy feet for sure. Next time I'm bringing boots even if the forecast says 'maybe.'

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Rain or shine, boots are always a good bet around here—lesson learned the damp way!

meaning: A hissing sound like that produced by a switch or similar slender object moved rapidly through the air or an object moving swiftly in contact with water; movement accompanied by such sound.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: These lilies look even brighter with the sun out, don’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Absolutely, I could sit by this pond for hours just taking it all in.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Look at all these perfect skipping stones! They’re practically asking to be thrown.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let’s see whose stone makes the most hops. I’ll pick the smoothest one I can find.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Alright, my turn—watch closely, I’ve been practicing my wrist flick.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That was incredible! Your stone just sailed across the water—swish!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Look over by the pond—someone’s got a fishing rod out.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Did you hear that swish when they cast the line? That always sounds so satisfying.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it kind of draws your attention every time.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Makes me want to try it myself, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You’d probably get the hang of it pretty quick.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: If nothing else, at least I’ll enjoy the sound!

meaning: An exclamation representing a rushing sound or movement, esp. through the air.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Watch this—swoosh! Right through the hoop, no rim, no backboard.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Okay, you’ve definitely been practicing. That was smooth!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I've got my lucky shoes on, what can I say?

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Lucky shoes or not, it's my turn to steal the spotlight.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Bring your A-game, Maya! The pressure’s on.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m about to turn the heat up—watch closely!

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that fly past the park benches just now?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Was it that bright orange boomerang again? I swear it's come out of nowhere twice already.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Either that or someone’s got a serious arm with their frisbee today.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let’s keep an eye out—I kind of want to see where it lands this time.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Heads up, I think it’s heading straight this way!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Here it comes—swoosh—right past us again! That thing’s unstoppable.

meaning: The sound of a smart stroke.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that? Tack! That return shot just sliced right past him—her timing is unreal.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No kidding! She makes it look so effortless, but you can tell there’s real skill behind every move.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It’s like she reads every spin before the ball even lands. Her reactions are lightning-fast.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I wonder if her coach studies her opponents, or if she just has that killer instinct.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Could be both, but she’s clearly put in the hours. It really pays off in moments like this.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Moments like that make me want to pick up my old paddle again. She’s definitely raising the bar tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: If I nail this shot, that's three games in a row for me.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Ha! Don’t get too confident—my comeback starts now.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Alright, your serve. Let’s see what you’ve got.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Okay, eyes on the ball, because this one’s going straight down the line.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Here goes—tack! Right past your paddle!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Whoa, that was precise! I didn’t even see it coming.

meaning: Used to accompany or draw attention to a dramatic entrance, announcement, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’ve had that mysterious smile on your face all week—are you about to reveal your secret project?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I might be, but only if you’re ready for something totally unexpected.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Now I’m even more curious. Should I prepare myself for confetti, fireworks, or both?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Even better. Just promise me you’ll keep your eyes closed until I say so.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My eyes are zipped tight. Don’t keep me in suspense too long!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright… ta-da! You can look—your very own hand-painted skateboard, just for you.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Take a seat, Alex! I’ve been working on something all afternoon just for this moment.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Now I’m super intrigued. Is it edible, wearable, or will it explode?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No explosions, I promise! But you might want to cover your eyes for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Alright, eyes are covered. Should I be bracing myself for greatness?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You absolutely should. Are you ready?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Open eyes and… ta-da! This is incredible, Megan! I can’t believe you painted this just for me.

meaning: A metal gong of oriental origin, spec. a Chinese gong, now used in western orchestras.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The way all those percussionists line up behind the orchestra—it’s like a secret world back there.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: No kidding! Sometimes I barely notice them until something really dramatic happens and they steal the show.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: See that enormous metal disc way at the back? It wasn’t there at the last show. I wonder what they're going to do with it tonight.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That thing looks intense. I bet it’s responsible for some of those thunderous sounds we keep hearing at rehearsals.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: When they hit it, you just get this powerful tam-tam that seems to vibrate through your chest. It’s almost impossible not to feel it.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Now you’ve got me excited for that moment—I’ll be listening for it the whole time.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Did you hear that tam-tam at the end of the symphony? I swear, the sound just rippled through the whole theater.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I felt the vibrations in the floor. Those moments really make a performance unforgettable.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: The way the percussionist timed it was perfect. It added so much drama and intensity to the finale.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: It’s impressive how one instrument can shift the mood of the whole room. I noticed everyone in the audience leaned forward when it was played.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Moments like that remind me why I love going to live performances instead of just listening at home.

dialogue.speaker: Michael
dialogue.text: Same here! Next time, we should try sitting closer to the percussion section for a different perspective.

meaning: To strike (a bell or the like) so as to cause it to emit a sharp loud ringing note.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This bell tower is really something, Jack. I can’t believe how old these bells must be.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let’s find out if they still sing! Ready? Here comes a proper ring—tang! That echoed all the way down the stone staircase.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sound just fills the whole space. My ears are still buzzing!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: You can almost picture a whole village hearing that every hour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Standing up here feels like stepping right into history.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Next stop: the old wooden pews. I bet they creak louder than the bell rings!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There’s that bell tower—just seeing it takes me back.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You’re reminding me of all the times it startled the birds and made Mrs. Sanders jump.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It got especially lively during the spring festival a couple years back, remember?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh, I remember! When Ben yanked that rope and—tang!—the sound ricocheted all the way to Baker’s Mill.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Everybody spun around so fast, not knowing what hit them.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Moments like that really put some spark in a quiet town like ours.

meaning: A blow, a knock.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That's the third time today I've whacked my elbow on this stupid doorframe.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Seriously, it's like that doorframe has a personal vendetta against you.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Every time I walk by, it's a solid tank—makes me jump every single time.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: No wonder you flinch when you pass by. That must sting like crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: At this point, maybe I should just pad the whole hallway.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Or invest in some serious elbow armor—you'd be unstoppable!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If this picture crashes down in the middle of the night, I'm blaming your measuring skills, Ben.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Trust me, my eye is sharper than any level. You just need to hold it steady.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, say when! I'm bracing myself for your legendary hammer swing.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Now! And relax, the wall's tougher than it looks.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Was that a wobble? Please tell me you didn't miss the nail.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Nope, I lined it up perfectly—listen… tank! That’s it secured.

meaning: Imitative of the sound of a flourish blown on a trumpet, or sometimes of a drum.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: There goes the color guard with their sparkling flags! This parade always surprises me.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Wait, listen—do you hear the band warming up? It's almost their turn to shine.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh, here they come—tantara tantara! The trumpets always steal the show when they make their entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I knew you’d love that flourish! It’s impossible not to grin when the music kicks off like that.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Seriously, the whole street feels alive now. No wonder everyone’s starting to dance.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit! Let’s see if the drummers can top that entrance.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you catch that blast from the brass section? Tantara! That’s what makes these parades so electrifying.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Absolutely! When the band comes marching through, you can feel the energy ripple down the street.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It really gets everyone on their feet—look at those little kids trying to keep up with the beat.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: This reminds me of our hometown celebrations; music always had a way of pulling the community together.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: If we ever get brave enough, we should sneak into the lineup next year with some tambourines.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Deal! But only if you promise to wear those ridiculous sparkly sunglasses again.

meaning: At full gallop; swiftly; headlong.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You won’t believe how exhilarating my ride was by the old creek trail yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Really? I bet that was a sight—did you take Molly out again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yep, Molly was in rare form. The landscape looked like a rolling painting, and there was hardly anyone else around.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Tell me you let her stretch her legs at some point. I know how she gets when she spots an open field.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, she was off like an arrow once we hit the clearing—her hooves barely touched the ground!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit! I can just picture you and Molly going tantivy under that huge sky, leaving clouds of dust behind.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If that race didn’t get your adrenaline pumping, I don’t know what would—those horses looked almost unreal as they charged down the track.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: My heart was racing nearly as fast as they were! Every time the announcer got louder, I swear the entire crowd held their breath.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, I half-expected Fleetwing to tire out before the finish, but he just kept accelerating.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: No kidding! That last burst when he went tantivy past the others—my jaw actually dropped. You could almost feel the ground trembling.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That’s the kind of moment you can’t plan for—it just hits you out of nowhere and then lives in your mind forever.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Makes me wish I’d kept up with riding lessons; maybe one day I’ll be the one tearing down the stretch in a wild finish like that.

meaning: A word imitating, and hence denoting, the sound of a trumpet or bugle.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You should have seen Main Street today—confetti everywhere and people cheering nonstop!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: I wouldn’t have missed it for anything. Which part had you grinning the most?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, the school band blew me away. They looked so sharp in those uniforms.

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: That was epic! Was it their music or something else that made them stand out?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It was the energy, but the brass section carried the whole crowd with them!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.text: You could just feel it when those trumpets blasted out—tarara—like they were announcing a king or something!

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: The game at the park drew quite a crowd with that marching band leading the halftime show.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Right? The moment those trumpets went tarara, everyone turned to look—the energy was unreal!

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I saw little kids trying to march along, completely out of step but loving it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I couldn’t help tap my feet—bands always manage to get the crowd moving.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Did you ever think about joining one when you were younger?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: To be honest, I tried out for the brass section, but all I produced was a sputter—my musical ambitions ended fast!

meaning: A word imitating, and hence denoting, the sound of a trumpet or bugle.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You’ll never guess what I did yesterday—I managed to catch the last half of the Main Street parade!

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: No kidding? That parade's the highlight of the season. Was the crowd as wild as people say?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Totally electrifying! There were so many kids up on shoulders and streamers everywhere, but the band totally stole the show.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: I bet the marching band sounded huge in person. Did you get close to the musicians?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I was right by the brass section when they marched past—everyone around me jumped when the trumpets blasted their fanfare.

dialogue.speaker: Nathan
dialogue.text: That had to be incredible—taratantara echoing down the whole street! Now I’m really wishing I hadn’t missed it.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—here comes the band around the corner! The energy just picked up tenfold.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: I've been waiting for this all week; check out those uniforms and feathered hats.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh, the trumpets are heading our way. This is the best part of the parade, hands down.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You know they're about to wake everyone up with that brass section. Here it comes.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Taratantara! That sound always gives me goosebumps, every single year.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Now that’s what I call a proper parade kickoff!

meaning: To touch lightly, pat, tap.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Would you look at that—this little kitten just hopped onto my lap again.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: She must have picked you as her human of the day. That's her third time circling you.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I'm going to give her a gentle tat, tat on her paw—she always seems to like that.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: She’s purring! Looks like you hit the jackpot with those soft taps.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Nothing like feline approval to make my afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Maybe if I offer her some treats, she'll share the love with me too.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hold on, Jake, there’s a little leaf stuck to your sleeve.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, really? I must’ve picked it up from the park bench.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Want me to brush it off for you before it gets lost inside your jacket?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Would you? I never notice these things.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, just keep still a moment... almost got it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hey, that felt funny—tat, tat—your fingers are like little bird feet!

meaning: An exclamation of impatience or contempt.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I pulled another late night editing the slides—my laptop nearly gave up on me.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You’re a lifesaver. The graphics look solid now. Did Ben finally send in his part?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Nope. He keeps saying he'll get to it, but all I see is an empty section.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Tcha, we’re seriously running out of patience with him at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I know. If he doesn’t upload by tonight, I’ll just fill it in myself.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly, you deserve extra credit for keeping this together.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This is the third time this week the bus is late.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Tcha, they seriously need to figure out their schedule.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: If we'd left a little earlier, we might've caught the earlier one.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Even then, there's no guarantee it would've shown up.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Honestly, walking might get me there before the bus does at this rate.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Grab your bag, let's put these waiting skills to better use.

meaning: An exclamation of impatience or contempt.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Tchah, every single time there's a team deadline, it ends up on my plate because nobody else bothers to step up.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: And you always pick up the slack—that's not fair at all.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: It's exhausting! Last week I stayed late three nights because of this.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Have you thought about putting your foot down and just not doing it next time?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Tempting, but I can't stand watching everything fall apart, either.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Still, something's gotta give. You deserve a break from being the reliable one all the time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: So, guess whose section of the report is still blank?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let me guess, Mark hasn't uploaded anything again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Bingo. And the deadline is tonight. I'm not surprised at all.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Every group project, huh? He always leaves us hanging.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: We keep picking up his slack and he never seems to care.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Tchah, I've had it! Next time, I'm not fixing his mess.

meaning: To sing (a tune) without words; to hum.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Every time the kettle boils, I hear your mystery melody drifting from the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Oh, that's just what happens when chores meet a little daydreaming. The soundtrack picks itself.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Is it something from the radio, or are you inventing a chart-topper right here over the sink?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think it's just me—teedle teedle teedle—making things up as I go while those mugs get their spa day.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Well, now the mugs are clean and the tune's stuck in my head. That's multitasking at its best.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: If the tune takes off, I expect a dishwasher dance routine from you next round.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You know, that melody keeps sneaking into my head whenever the house is this quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Really? I didn’t even notice I was making any noise. Was I humming again?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You definitely were! It’s bugging me because I swear I know it from somewhere.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: All right, let me try to piece it together for real. Give me a second...

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Go on, don’t hold back. Maybe if you hum the next bit I’ll figure it out.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Alright, here it goes—teedle teedle teedle—does that jog your memory at all?

meaning: A representation of the sound of a light laugh, usually derisive.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You should have seen the look on everyone's face when I spilled my soup all over the lunch table.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: No way! Was it the infamous tomato soup incident I heard people giggling about?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Tee-hee, guilty as charged! At least I gave everyone a lunchtime show, right?

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Honestly, you have a real knack for dramatic entrances—and exits.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Maybe next time I'll just bring a sandwich as a peace offering.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Or maybe a plastic tablecloth, just to be safe!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Of course it had to be me who knocked over the display at the store—everyone just stared.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Classic Emily move! Did you manage to stay upright, at least?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Barely! Tee-hee, nothing like a little public spectacle to keep life interesting.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hey, you’re just keeping the rest of us entertained—it’s practically a community service.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Well, if I ever need a side job, maybe I’ll take up slapstick.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You’d be a hit. Let me know before your next performance so I can grab popcorn!

meaning: Imitations of the cry of some birds.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Listen to all the movement above us—those branches are practically bursting with birds.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That one over there by the willow keeps hopping closer. I wonder if it's curious about us.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: If I try making a sound like this—tewhit, tewhit—maybe it'll come even nearer.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You almost had it! The head tilt means you got its attention at least.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: I'll take that as a compliment. Communicating with birds is harder than it looks.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Still, you managed to liven things up more than the squirrels ever could.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: These early runs really make you notice how alive the park is, don’t they?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Definitely. I love how you can actually hear things other than cars for a change.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Wait, did you hear that call from the trees just now? It stood out from the others.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah! It was kind of sharp—like, 'tewhit, tewhit,' echoing through the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It sounded so close. If I had binoculars, I’d try to spot the little singer.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Makes you wish you knew them all by sound. One day, we’ll be bird call experts.

meaning: Imitations of the cry of some birds.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something just swooped over by that pond—did you catch that flutter of wings?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I did! It was quick. The sound it made caught my ear too.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: With that slick black-and-white pattern, I’m guessing it’s one of those lapwings we saw in the guidebook.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, those! Haven’t you tried mimicking their calls before? They’re pretty distinct.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Of course! It’s something like this—tewit, tewit! That’s how I remember it, anyway.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Not bad for the middle of the park—if you keep that up, you might start a bird chorus.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: This trail always surprises me—there’s a different chorus of birds every time we come out.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Right? Just listen to that chatter above the marsh, it almost feels like we're walking through a hidden concert.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: Do you hear that sharp call? It goes 'tewit, tewit,' like it’s trying to get everyone’s attention.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Sounds like you’ve been practicing! I’d bet that’s one of the lapwings doing their thing nearby.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: Those calls always take me back to summer picnics with my family—my brother used to try copying them just like that.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Glad you brought me along; maybe today I’ll finally spot the elusive lapwing myself.

meaning: To make a noise with thumb and finger which resembles the whispering of ‘flip’.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: We’ve been stuck here longer than a Monday morning. My feet are falling asleep.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. I can practically recite the pattern on this floor by now.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: *snaps fingers* Thrip—maybe that’ll jolt the universe into moving this line.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If only that sound came with a fast-forward button. That was a solid snap, though.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Years of fidgeting in lines have honed my skills. Next up: inventing boredom-proof patience.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Let me know when you crack that secret. Until then, I’ll just admire your technique.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, I’ve tried every arm-gesture in the book, but Chris still hasn’t looked our way.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: He’s really zoned out. Maybe a sound will cut through the noise faster than frantic arm waving.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s see if this works—thrip—there, did you hear that pop? Fingers crossed it grabs his attention.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Hey, that was surprisingly crisp! His head just turned a little.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Finally, some progress! Maybe I need to perfect my technique to get a louder one.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: You keep practicing, I’ll keep watching for his reaction—this might actually work.

meaning: To beat or pulsate with more than usual force or rapidity, esp. as the result of strong emotion or excitement; to palpitate, pound.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I swear, watching you perform tonight was like seeing a totally different side of you.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: It felt unreal, Liv. All day I wondered if I'd actually get through it without tripping over my own words.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: So, when you walked out and everyone started clapping, what went through your head?

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: The noise and the lights just hit me, and my chest started to throb—like every nerve was suddenly on high alert.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You owned it up there, even if your insides were freaking out.

dialogue.speaker: Max
dialogue.text: Thanks for saying that. I’m still buzzing—it’s probably going to take me a while to come down from this high.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I can't believe I'm actually about to say this out loud, but you have to promise not to laugh.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Now I really need to know! My curiosity is driving me up the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
