dialogue.text: Yeah, and leftovers are actually better the next day anyway.

meaning: A wailing cry; a wail of lamentation.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: That sound cutting through the night—gives me chills every time I walk down this street.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yeah, the ululu just echoed again. You can feel the weight of the moment in the air.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It really does. I wonder how the family is bearing up inside.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: They've been gathering for hours now. Neighbors keep arriving with flowers and quiet words.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: I guess everyone comes together in moments like these, even when it's heavy to witness.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: No one walks away untouched on nights like this—you just feel it linger long after.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe what happened at the memorial yesterday. It was unlike anything I've ever witnessed.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Now you've got me curious. Was there something about the way people gathered or what was said?

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It was right at the end—everyone suddenly gathered and this wailing broke out all at once: ululu, ululu, rising up so raw and loud it filled the whole space.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That sounds honestly soul-stirring. I can almost hear it just from your description.

dialogue.speaker: Chloe
dialogue.text: It totally was. I stood there feeling everything swirl around me, like the whole room was joined by that sound.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That's a memory that'll stay with you. Moments like that change the way we see things, don’t they?

meaning: Used to indicate hesitating or inarticulate utterance on the part of a speaker.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: So, are you up for checking out that new bakery after work on Friday? Their pastries look amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Um, let me think about that. I might have to stay late to finish a project, but I'll try to make it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: The offer stands either way—if you can't make it, I'll bring you something sweet.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That's tempting, especially if they have those chocolate croissants. I'll text you as soon as I know my schedule.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Sounds like a plan; I’ll keep an eye on my phone for your message.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Thanks, Rachel. Here's hoping my boss isn't in a 'let's work late' mood.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I was thinking about trying that new pizza place this weekend—want to join?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Um, I think I promised my roommate I'd help him move, but I’m not totally sure what time.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: No worries, sounds like you’ve got a busy day lined up.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Yeah, it tends to happen. I’ll see if I can work something out.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If the timing works or plans change, just let me know—I’ll save you a seat!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Will do. That pizza had better live up to the hype!

meaning: An inarticulate sound, expressive of hesitation, doubt, or dissatisfaction.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: If you’re aiming for something new, the cafeteria’s beef stew special looks... adventurous today.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Adventurous is a strong word. What’s in it that makes you say that?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Well, it’s got chunks of beetroot, green peas, and, umph... there’s definitely something mystery-meat-ish about the texture.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oof, mystery meat never inspires confidence.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Exactly. Last time, I spent half my lunch break just picking things out.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe we should play it safe and grab a sandwich instead—my treat if you promise not to dissect it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If we go for tacos again, I'm blaming you for my cravings later.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Well, you did say you loved them last time, but I can suggest something else.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Umph... tacos are tempting, but maybe I went a little overboard before.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s steer clear of the taco spot this time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Thai food could be a nice change of pace.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Spicy noodles, here we come! Lead the way.

meaning: An inarticulate sound, uttered instead of a word that the speaker is unable to remember or bring out.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Did you finish that documentary I recommended last night?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yeah, I did! The part about the lost city was so intriguing.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Right? And the narrator’s name was… ur… it’s at the tip of my tongue! He’s really famous.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean David Attenborough! He has such a distinctive voice.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Yes, that’s it! I knew I’d recognize it if I heard his name.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: He makes even the tiniest details sound fascinating. Such a legend.

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: I was watching that old sitcom last night and, ur, what's his name—he popped up in the coffee shop scene unexpectedly.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Oh, really? Are you talking about the guy who always wears those funny hats?

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: Yes, him! But I just can’t remember his name right now.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Was it Malcolm Evans, maybe?

dialogue.speaker: Jessica
dialogue.text: That’s it—Malcolm Evans! Thanks, that was driving me crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Glad I could help! That scene was hilarious, by the way.

meaning: Indicating the sound of an explosion.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Can you believe that last firework? It shot up, stalled for a second, and then—voom—the sky turned electric blue!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That one nearly made me jump off my blanket! I’ve never seen sparks spread out that wide before.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: My little brother was covering his ears the whole time, but I think he secretly loved it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Ha! I bet he was peeking through his fingers. The bigger the boom, the more he pretends it’s too loud.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: If next year’s show is anything like this one, I’m bringing earplugs and an even better camera.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Right? And I’m claiming a front-row spot before someone else does. Those fireworks deserve to be seen up close!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Can you believe how that last firework went off? It soared up, and then—voom—the whole sky just burst into light!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No kidding, Emily! I nearly dropped my popcorn when it happened; didn't expect it to be so intense.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It felt like everyone around us stopped breathing for a second, just taking it all in.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I know! The echo kept bouncing off the buildings—made it even more dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: And then those sparkling trails kept raining down... it was almost magical.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That show definitely set the bar for all the future displays. Still can't get it out of my head!

meaning: The roaring noise of a motor vehicle accelerating or travelling at speed.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Would you look at that crowd near the old parking lot? Something wild must be happening.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You know, I bet it’s the monthly car meet. Those muscle cars always draw a crowd.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Let’s squeeze in here—oh, check out that blue Camaro revving up.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: He looks like he’s about to show off. People are already holding their phones up.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: There he goes! Vroom! That sound just rattled my bones.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That’s what I call putting on a show. Nobody does it better than these car guys.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Would you look at that red coupe! That thing looks like it’s begging to hit the open road.

dialogue.speaker: Lisa
dialogue.text: No kidding, Ben. The way the light bounces off it—just wow. Does it actually perform as well as it looks?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. There’s a turbocharged engine under that hood; it’s built for power.

dialogue.speaker: Lisa
dialogue.text: I can’t even imagine what kind of sound that thing makes when it finally gets going.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: When they rev it up, it goes vroom and echoes across the whole parking lot.

dialogue.speaker: Lisa
dialogue.text: That’s seriously cool. Makes me wish they’d start it up right now.

meaning: Of a dog, esp. of a puppy: to yelp.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Something just made the weirdest sound outside the window.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Yeah, I noticed that too. It was quick, almost like someone stepped on a squeaky toy.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I hope it's not a raccoon again. This sounded smaller, though.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Smaller is less trouble, hopefully. Maybe it’s just a neighbor’s pet exploring.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I swear I just heard a tiny 'waff'—that totally had puppy energy.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm grabbing a flashlight! If there’s a puppy out there, we’re finding it.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There he goes again—did you catch that tiny waff coming from under the sofa? Baxter must have spotted his own tail.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: He's at it nonstop lately! I bet he thinks he's the fiercest guard dog in the world.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Honestly, he acts so tough, but one sneeze and he jumps three feet back.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit, though. Puppy confidence with a dash of comedy.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Want to try your luck luring him out? Squeak the toy and see who wins: his bravery or curiosity.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Challenge accepted. Prepare for a very wiggly Baxter making an entrance!

meaning: An exclamation expressing delight or exhilaration.

dialogue.speaker: Katie
dialogue.text: The scoreboard just updated, Matt! We’re only three points down now.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: No way—this could actually turn around! Did you see that last shot?

dialogue.speaker: Katie
dialogue.text: Absolutely nailed it! Wahey, this game’s suddenly electric!

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Everyone's on their feet—I've never heard the crowd this loud.

dialogue.speaker: Katie
dialogue.text: If they score now, it's going to be total chaos in here.

dialogue.speaker: Matt
dialogue.text: Bring it on! I love a night like this at the stadium.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You look like you just found out you won the lottery! What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Okay, brace yourself—I just got accepted into my top-choice grad program!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No chance! The one in Edinburgh you kept talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Yep, that’s the one! The email popped up right as I was grabbing my coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Wahey! That’s absolutely brilliant, Emma!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Thanks, Jake! I still can’t believe it’s real.

meaning: A musical effect achieved on brass instruments by manipulation of a mute and on an electric guitar by means of a pedal controlling output from the amplifier.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Last night’s rehearsal turned into a total sound experiment.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: No kidding? Did something epic happen with the instruments?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Totally—Sam plugged in a new pedal just before we ran the last song.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Oh, was that the effect that made his solos swirl all over the place?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Yeah, he kicked it on and suddenly every riff had that wild wah-wah shimmer, like the sound was dancing.

dialogue.speaker: Chris
dialogue.text: Now I wish I hadn’t missed it—those moments are what make practice worth it.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: You would’ve loved the show last night—during one song, the guitarist went absolutely wild with his pedal, making these incredible wah-wah, wah-wah noises that had the entire crowd grinning.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That sounds awesome! Was he playing one of the funkier tunes, or did he throw that in during a solo?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: It was right in the middle of his solo. The way he layered the sound just made everything pop.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, that pedal gives so much personality to the guitar. It’s impossible not to groove along when you hear it.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Absolutely! It always reminds me of those classic records—makes every gig memorable.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Next time you go, count me in. I need to catch that kind of energy live!

meaning: To bark.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Looks like it's another adventure for Toby and me around the block.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I bet he’s going to spot every pigeon and sprint after leaves again, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Absolutely. And the moment he senses the neighbor’s cat, he gets all fired up.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I can just picture it: wap wap wap, tail wagging like crazy!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: That chaotic energy keeps things interesting, that’s for sure.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Hey, at least your walks are never boring with Toby around.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You should've seen Max today—he spotted a squirrel and went full "wap! wap! wap!" before the poor thing even had a chance to blink.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Max, the tiny one with the big attitude? I can totally picture it! Did the squirrel get away?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely. It just dashed up the oak tree like it’s done it a thousand times. Max was left there, looking all triumphant.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That’s hilarious. Rosie pulled the same stunt yesterday, except she started up when a leaf blew past our porch.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I swear, little dogs think they're running a top security operation.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It’s their world and we’re just living in it—one noisy patrol at a time.

meaning: To utter the loud harsh cry characteristic of cats or of new-born babies.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I could barely get any sleep with all the noise coming from the alleyway last night.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Oh no, was it the neighborhood cats fighting again?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Worse, there was this one cat that started to waul nonstop—so loud, it made my windows shake.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: That sounds brutal! I’ve had to use earplugs because of that before.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I’m tempted to invest in some myself if this keeps up.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The things we endure for city living, right? Hang in there!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you hear those strange noises from the alley last night? I could barely get any sleep.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, that waul was so loud, it sounded like a whole pack of cats having a standoff right outside.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I know! I even thought it might be a baby at first, the cry was so sharp.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whatever it was, it sure had strong lungs. My dog was barking like mad in response.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I’m going to try playing some white noise tonight so I don’t wake up every hour.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let me know if that works—otherwise, we might need to investigate what's causing all the commotion out there.

meaning: To utter the loud harsh cry characteristic of cats or of new-born babies.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: My sleep got interrupted again last night—did you catch those sounds coming from the backyard?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If you mean the racket around 2 a.m., absolutely. It startled me out of my book.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I peeked through the curtains, but all I saw were shadows darting by the fence.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: The way it echoed, I’d bet something was out there about to wawl right under our window.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Whatever it was, I hope it’s moved on—I’m not ready for another night like that.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I’ll leave the porch light on tonight, just in case our uninvited guest decides to pay another visit.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: There it goes again—what is making all that racket at this hour?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: You’re right, it’s been going on and off since I came in. Pretty intense, isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Yeah, it actually made me jump the first time I heard it. Whatever it is, it’s got some lungs.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It’s either a neighborhood cat having a dramatic moment or there’s a very unhappy baby somewhere nearby.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: My money’s on a cat this time. It sounds weirdly familiar—the sort of sound that echoes in alleys at night.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Exactly, you know the noise—sudden and sharp, like 'wawl' just ripping through the quiet. Gives me goosebumps every time!

meaning: To cry as a cat or utter a similar sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something just made my hair stand on end by the door—did you notice that noise?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Nope, I must have missed it. Was it loud?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Not really loud, more like a whimper mixed with a squeak. It was so strange.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s just Felix doing his late-night serenade—he’ll go 'waw waw waw' when he’s moody.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Felix has some serious character; I love how dramatic he gets.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: He was born for center stage—he’ll perform every evening if you let him.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did something just yowl from under the couch? That sounded dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it too. Is Daisy feeling chatty again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She does this every afternoon—just sits there and goes, 'waw, waw,' like the world owes her a favor.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: She definitely has a flair for the theatrical! That sound would make anyone jump.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Once she gets started, there's no stopping her until she gets a cuddle or two.

dialogue.speaker: Henry
dialogue.text: Well, if that's the secret code for extra snuggles, I guess we're on Daisy duty now.

meaning: Used as a command to a horse (or occasionally to a person) to make it stop or slow down.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Charlie, Rusty’s picking up speed again—he’s nearly at a trot!

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: Way! Way, Rusty, hold up there, easy now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There we go, that's much better. I thought I was about to go for a wild ride.

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: That horse’s got more energy than a thunderstorm today.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Let’s keep the pace gentle—my nerves need a break.

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.text: Stick by me and we’ll turn this into a pleasant stroll.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Max is really picking up speed—he must've spotted something in the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Hannah's matching him stride for stride, I can barely keep her steady.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Let’s ease them back before we end up in a full-on gallop.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Way, Hannah, way! Nice and easy now.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Max’s slowing already—good call on reining them in.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Looks like we dodged a wild ride this time! Let’s keep a close eye on them past this stretch.

meaning: To urinate.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Uh oh, emergency alert—I need to wee, like, right now! Can you find the next exit?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yikes, serious situation! Hang on, let me check how far the next one is.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I’m counting on you, Ben! My legs are basically doing a little dance over here.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Okay, okay—GPS says there’s a rest stop in seven minutes. Think you can outlast the countdown?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: If the traffic gods are kind, I just might. This always happens when I drink that giant iced tea.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Next time, smaller cup for you! Buckle up, we’re making a pit stop in record time.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I swear, these country roads go on forever—I’m starting to forget what civilization looks like.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Tell me about it. We've passed more cows than gas stations in the last hour.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Please tell me there’s a rest stop coming up, or at least a spot to stretch my legs.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Honestly? I’m desperate for a break too—I really need to wee.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I didn’t know you were on the brink! Okay, eyes peeled for the next exit.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed we make it—I don’t exactly want to use a bush as a bathroom.

meaning: Representing a short high-pitched sound, esp. as made by a pig.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Look at that little guy chasing his siblings through the mud! He's got some serious speed.

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: Yeah, and did you catch that? He just gave the tiniest 'week!' when he darted under the fence. Sounded like he was showing off.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Honestly, I think he knows he’s the star of the show. The others just can't keep up.

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: If they handed out trophies for barnyard drama, that piglet would win every time.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: He’s got the moves and the voice—what more could you want in a farm entertainer?

dialogue.speaker: Owen
dialogue.text: Next stop: piglet talent show. I’ll be grabbing front row seats.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You would not believe how lively the farm was this afternoon!

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Lively, huh? What was causing all the commotion?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: It was the piglets—they were chasing each other all around and making the funniest little sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can just hear them now: week, week, week! They always crack me up with those noises.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: They didn’t stop for a second; it was like a concert of squeals and tiny feet.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Now that’s the kind of chaos I’d love to see in person one day.

meaning: An imitation of the cry of certain small birds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Every time I walk through this path, I feel like I'm stepping into another world.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Same here. The trees are thick with birds today—listen to all that chatter.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: There, did you catch that tiny call from the bushes? It was so quick.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Yeah, I heard it! It's almost like the birds are having their own secret meeting.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I think it went something like 'weet, weet'—so sharp and bright!

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: It really brightens the morning when you notice those little sounds.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Looks like you hit the park trail before sunrise again this morning.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: You know me too well. The early hours are the best when everything’s still waking up.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You must've caught some interesting sounds while you walked. Did anything stand out?

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: There was so much birdsong! At one point, I just stopped to listen because it felt like a little symphony all around me.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Were they going like, 'weet, weet' from the bushes? That’s my favorite part—when they get really chatty.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Exactly that! It’s such a cheerful noise. Makes the morning feel alive, doesn’t it?

meaning: An imitation of the cry of certain birds, esp. the sandpiper and chaffinch.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: Listen! Did you catch that ‘weet-weet’ drifting across the marsh just now? It’s echoing all around the water.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I heard it too! That’s got to be one of those little birds we see flitting about over there.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: My guess is it's a sandpiper, or maybe a chaffinch hiding in those reeds.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: It’s amazing how something so tiny creates such a sharp sound over all this space.

dialogue.speaker: Eleanor
dialogue.text: How about we hold still for a bit and see who decides to show themselves?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I’m all for it—maybe if we’re quiet enough, we’ll catch a glimpse.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Look at that—mist rolling over the pond. Mornings like this always clear my head.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: And listen, there it goes again! That little weet-weet by the reeds—makes the whole place feel alive.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You really have an ear for those calls. I might have missed it if you hadn’t pointed it out.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Guess I’ve spent too much time hanging around the lake, picking up on every sound.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No wonder you’re the one beating me at birdwatching quizzes every time.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Let’s see if you can spot the next one before I do—challenge accepted?

meaning: To urinate.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Jake, can you please find a place to stop? I really need to do a wee-wee before I burst.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh man, I knew all that lemonade would catch up with you. Hang tight, I see a rest area sign ahead.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I seriously overestimated my bladder this time.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You and your endless refills! We’ll pull in as soon as we can.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Next time, I’m switching to tiny sips only.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That’s the spirit. Hold on, nearly there!

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Look at this crowd—it's almost like the whole city decided to come see this play tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: No kidding. I haven’t seen the lobby packed this much since that jazz festival last year.

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: At least we managed to snag pretty good seats. I hope we don’t miss the first act while we’re stuck in line.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: We’ve still got about fifteen minutes, so we might just make it. Fingers crossed!

dialogue.speaker: Hannah
dialogue.text: Actually, do you know if there’s a restroom near the entrance? I probably should’ve gone before we got in line.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Yeah, there’s one past the ticket booth. If you hurry, you’ll have time for a quick wee-wee before they dim the lights.

meaning: A conventional representation of the sound uttered by horses.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen me trying to feed the horses at Maplewood Farm yesterday—their noses kept nudging the carrots right out of my hand.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That sounds hilarious! Did any of them try to get too close or do something unexpected?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Absolutely! As soon as I approached the paddock, this one horse leaned over and let out the biggest, friendliest 'wehee!' right in my face—I jumped about a foot back.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Oh man, that’s incredible! I can imagine your reaction.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: The best part is that after that, he acted like nothing happened and just waited for his snack like a total gentleman.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Now I really want to meet these characters myself—next farm trip, you’re bringing me along!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You know, splashing through muddy fields yesterday was totally worth it—I finally managed to visit that horse sanctuary outside town.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: No way, Sophie! Did you get up close with any of the horses?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Jake, get this—a big chestnut came trotting over, tossed his mane, and let out the loudest 'wehee!' right in front of me. I almost jumped out of my boots!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: That’s hilarious. I bet he was showing off for you!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Definitely—it felt like he wanted all my attention. He kept nudging my pockets for treats, too.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Sounds like you made a new four-legged friend! I need these kinds of adventures in my life.

meaning: A vigorous stroke with a stick or the like; a heavy resounding blow; also the sound of this.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You should've seen what went down at the backyard barbecue yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let me guess—someone tried their luck with that old piñata again?

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Exactly! Mark grabbed the stick, took a wild swing, and boom—there was this loud whack as he completely missed the piñata and hit the picnic table instead.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh, I bet everyone stopped and stared for a second.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Totally, then the table nearly toppled over and all the drinks went flying.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s classic Mark—always turning a simple game into pure chaos!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Bet you didn’t think I'd volunteer to take a swing at the piñata at Chloe’s party, but there I was—blindfolded and everything.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I can totally picture that! Did you have any sense of where the piñata was hanging?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, not at all. The kids spun me around until I was dizzy—felt like a carnival ride gone wrong.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: So, did you go for it swinging or just tentatively wave the stick around like most grown-ups do?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I decided if I was going to miss, I might as well miss with style, so I just went for it full speed.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Then suddenly—whack—the piñata burst open! I swear, candy rained down like confetti and all the kids lost their minds.

meaning: To strike violently; to propel with great force, by hitting, throwing, kicking, etc.
A heavy blow; the sound of a heavy blow (or of an explosion, etc.).

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You should’ve seen the match last night; the field was a total mud pit.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Sounds intense! Did anything epic happen out there?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Right near the end, the ball bounced my way and I just let it rip—wham! It smashed off the post and into the net.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: No way! That must’ve got everyone fired up.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: People were jumping all over the place! Even Coach nearly lost his hat.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Only you manage to cause chaos and score at the same time, Liam.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You would not believe what just happened in the last inning—my heart’s still pounding.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Let me guess, another wild play? Spill the details!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: We were down by two, bases loaded, and our rookie stepped up to the plate.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: First pitch comes in and—wham—he sends it soaring over left field, clearing the fence like it was nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That’s insane! The crowd must’ve lost it.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Pandemonium! I swear, I haven’t seen a walk-off like that in ages.

meaning: A resounding blow or stroke, or the sound of such a blow; a bang.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Did you hear that noise coming from the garage just now?

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Yeah, it sounded like something heavy hit the floor. What do you think it was?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: I’ve never heard anything like it—a huge whang echoed through the whole house!

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Now I’m worried. Should we go check and see what fell?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Probably a shelf gave way, or maybe the ladder slipped. Let’s take a flashlight just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Lily
dialogue.text: Good idea. I’m not sure what we’ll find, but we’d better hurry before anything else happens.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Just my luck—while adjusting the shelves, the hammer slipped right out of my hand and landed on the toolbox with a massive whang!

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: That must have sent everyone’s heart racing! Did anything get damaged?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Everyone turned around like I’d set off some kind of alarm. Thankfully, the toolbox took the hit pretty well.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least the only casualty was the peace and quiet. You really know how to make an entrance, don’t you?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Apparently so! I think I’ll be hearing about this one for a while.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s just hope your next project comes with a little less drama—and a lot less noise!

meaning: To pronounce the letter r with a burr or guttural sound.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Every time I watch those Scottish movies, I get completely distracted by the way they roll their R’s.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I know exactly what you mean! My uncle from Dundee used to make even the word 'river' sound like thunder.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, I’d love to hear that! Can you mimic how he did it?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: You’re putting me on the spot, but alright, let me channel my inner Uncle Fergus.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Ahem, here it comes… wharlrrr! Did I get close?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Nailed it! That sounded like you summoned a bagpipe from the depths.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This script is impossible—I keep stumbling on the word 'ravine.' My 'r' just sounds totally flat.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Oh, my drama teacher used to make us practice tongue twisters. Want a demonstration of a super dramatic 'r'?

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Listen: rrrrr... wharl! Like I’m trying to summon a hurricane with my throat.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That sound could shake the stage! Mine comes out more like a coffee grinder that forgot how to grind.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Try it with extra flair! Just let your tongue take over and see what noise escapes.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Alright, here's my best shot—rrrr... Okay, that's officially the weirdest noise I've ever made in public!

meaning: To squeak, whine.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Something just made a strange noise by the couch, and now I can't focus on my book.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: You mean that high-pitched sound? I noticed it too—I thought maybe it was the radiator acting up again.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: No, it was more like… wheak! Almost as if someone’s complaining from behind the cushions.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That’s got to be Muffin. You know she hides her toy back there and lets everyone know when she can’t reach it.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Alright, Muffin, I’m coming to the rescue—let’s see what’s so urgent this time.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: With any luck, she’ll stop her dramatic performances once the toy’s back in her paws.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: There goes Daisy again—she’s been running circles around her cage for the last ten minutes.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you also hear that little wheak she does when she’s extra restless? Sounds like she’s plotting something sneaky.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: Yeah, and right after that, she tried to tip over her water dish too.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Classic Daisy. Maybe she’s angling for more broccoli—she knows you’re a soft touch.

dialogue.speaker: Jacob
dialogue.text: I can’t resist that furry face, even when she’s being dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: It’s official, she’s got all of us wrapped around her little paw.

meaning: An exclamation of joy, exhilaration, astonishment, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Just look at those twists ahead! I can't believe we're actually doing this.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: If my hands start shaking, it's totally your fault for convincing me!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Here we go—whee! The wind is wild up here!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Whoa, I didn't expect it to be this fast! My voice might come out squeaky soon.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: This drop looks insane, I’m holding on for dear life!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Next time, I'm picking the ride. Something on the ground, preferably!

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That roller coaster is calling my name—I can feel the adrenaline already!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Last one to the front row is a chicken! Ready to take the plunge together?

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Here we go—whee! That first drop was insane!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You looked like you were flying! Your face was priceless.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That was the craziest rush—I’m still buzzing! You up for round two?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I've got to beat your record for loudest scream.

meaning: To move quickly, esp. through or as if through the air; to whizz; to rush or dash.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you see that bird just now? It came out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Yes! It nearly brushed against my arm. How fast was that little thing?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: It seemed to wheech straight across in front of us—didn’t even give me time to react.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: No kidding, my heart skipped a beat. Birds in this park have no fear.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Maybe we should set up some warning signs. 'Beware: Speeding Birds!'

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Good idea! Next thing you know, they’ll be swooping down for our snacks, too.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You should've seen me racing to the bus stop this morning—barely made it before the doors shut!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Did you end up making a mad dash across the street again?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, absolutely! My backpack nearly went wheech off my shoulder as I sprinted up just in time.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You and that backpack—it's got a life of its own sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! I think it wants to escape every Monday.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe next time, you should leash it before you run for the bus.

meaning: To utter a somewhat protracted shrill cry, like the curlew or plover.
A long-drawn sound of a steel weapon drawn from its sheath.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This marsh always has the best surprises at dawn—did you notice how lively it is this morning?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely, it's buzzing with life. Something keeps catching my attention near the reeds.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Oh! Just now—did you hear that long, clear 'wheep... wheep' across the water?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Yeah, it really cuts through the quiet. There's something magical about calls like that.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It makes you want to spot the little singer hiding out there.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Let’s scan with the binoculars—maybe we’ll find our mystery musician perched on a branch.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Check that out—did you catch that movement by the reeds?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hmm, my binoculars are fogged up. Was it big or small?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: It looked slender, with a really long bill. I think that might be what we came for.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hang on, do you hear that piercing call cutting through the wind?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: That’s it! Right now—it just did that classic wheep, like a sound slicing straight through the marsh air.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You’ve got such an ear for these things. No way I’d have picked it out without you.

meaning: To utter a somewhat protracted shrill cry, like the curlew or plover.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: This morning by the estuary, one of those tall shorebirds let out the wildest wheeple—I can't get that ringing sound out of my head.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: You always seem to stumble across something extraordinary when you're out exploring.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Nature keeps serving up surprises; the bird stood in the reeds, almost invisible except for that unmistakable cry.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Even when I hike near the water, my encounters never feel quite that dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: It honestly felt like time paused for a moment—just me, the mist, and that echo across the flats.

dialogue.speaker: Grace
dialogue.text: Moments like that make me want to pay closer attention next time I'm out there. Birds have an uncanny way of commanding the landscape.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That eerie call just cut right through the quiet—did you catch that, Jason?

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Absolutely, and look—there’s a bird with long legs wading in the shallows. Could be the one making all that noise.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: It's almost like it just went, 'wheeple!' and let the sound hang in the air. That's such a wild note.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: Spot on, that sums it up better than any app description ever could.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Birdwatching is so much more interesting when you start picking up on the different calls.

dialogue.speaker: Jason
dialogue.text: If we stay still, maybe we’ll catch a couple more of those crazy vocal performances.

meaning: To whistle shrilly.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I swear, every time I walk this path, I discover something new about the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Wait, did you catch that? Something just made a really sharp sound over there.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Hmm, what kind of sound are we talking about? Like a bird call or more mechanical?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It was like wheetle!—right through the trees. Gave me chills, honestly.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That does sound a bit eerie! Maybe it's one of those woodpeckers playing tricks on us.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s keep moving, but now I’m dying to know what’s making that noise!

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: That was the weirdest noise—did it just come from behind those bushes?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No idea. It kind of made me jump, honestly. Was that a person or an animal?

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: If it was a person, they have impressive lung power. It cut right through the morning haze.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: It almost reminded me of those little whistles you get at fairs, only... wilder.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Wait, let me try to copy it—see if my memory serves me right.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Go for it! If I hear you wheetle like that again, I might have to hand you a carnival prize.

meaning: A sharp blow; esp. a box on the ear or slap on the face.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You would not believe the chaos near the vending machines at lunch today.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: That sounds wild already—what did I miss this time?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ben tried to snatch Mia’s chips right out of her hand when she turned her back for just a second.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Classic Ben move! Did he actually get away with it?

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: He almost did, but Mia spun around just in time—she was not having any of it.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Let me guess—Ben got a proper wherret for his trouble and probably dropped the chips everywhere, didn’t he?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You remember that one time at summer camp when I refused to hand over the remote? Sam marched over and gave me a proper wherret before grabbing it right back.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: No way! Sam actually did that?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, she never put up with any nonsense. One swift move and it was all over.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Now I get why nobody ever argued with her during movie night.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yep. Even the counselors steered clear when she was in charge.

dialogue.speaker: Elliot
dialogue.text: Classic Sam—she definitely had a way of keeping everyone in line.

meaning: To whistle; to make a whistling or rustling noise.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Look at those branches swaying—this storm is really going for it.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: I bet if you open that back door, the wind will blast straight through the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Alright, let’s see what happens—here it goes.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: *whew* That gust zipped down the hallway like a runaway train!

dialogue.speaker: Tom
dialogue.text: Almost knocked the paper towels off the counter, too.

dialogue.speaker: Mia
dialogue.text: Better batten down the hatches before everything ends up outside!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: The sunlight looks incredible streaming through the golden leaves right now.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Seriously, every step sounds like we’re walking on cornflakes with all these dry leaves.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wait—did you catch that noise above us just then?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: I did! Kind of sharp, wasn’t it? Maybe it’s something moving through the branches.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I can’t make it out... It’s not quite like a bird or anything.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Give it a second—there! *whew* That breeze just sent a chill right through the trees.

meaning: To cry plaintively, moan, whine, howl.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: There it goes again from the backyard—did you catch that? Sort of a mournful whewl echoing by the shed.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I thought I heard something dragging on for a bit. Like an animal, maybe?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Exactly! It wasn’t just a quick yelp, either. Almost sounded like it was calling for someone.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: It could be that stray collie we spotted near the compost pile last night.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: That makes sense. He seemed pretty lost and hungry then, too.

dialogue.speaker: David
dialogue.text: Let’s leave out some food and see if he comes closer—maybe he just needs a little kindness.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I just want to craw into bed and whewl until all this stress melts away—today really knocked the wind out of me.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Sounds like you got hit pretty hard. Was it work, home, or a bit of everything?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: A bit of everything, honestly. My meeting ran over, the dog got sick, and I spilled coffee right on my laptop.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That’s brutal. No wonder you’re feeling wiped out. Do you want to take a walk or just rant it out some more?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Thanks, Lucas. I think just having you listen helps more than anything right now.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: You’ve always got me in your corner—don’t forget that, even on days like this.

meaning: To squeak, as a pig.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This barn is way louder than I thought it would be—especially with all the animals running around.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No kidding! The ducks are quacking up a storm, but have you heard those pigs over by the fence?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh, totally! I always imagined pigs just making that classic snorting noise, but these little guys are so much more dramatic.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: I know, right? They sound like they're protesting something—it's such a weird, sharp sound.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Listen—whick, whick! That's exactly what they keep doing whenever I walk past.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You got their impression down perfectly, Jack. I think the pigs might have some competition!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: My shoes are still muddy from chasing those piglets yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You really dove right in—I thought one of them was about to escape under the gate!

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: You should've seen its little face when I got close.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: They’re quicker than I expected, especially when treats are involved.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Oh, and that high-pitched whick it made when I nearly caught it—the whole barn went quiet for a second!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sound cracked me up! That piglet has some serious pipes.

meaning: To utter a half-suppressed laugh; to snigger, titter.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: If meetings had an award for unintentional comedy, Greg’s slideshow this morning would’ve won hands down.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: You noticed that too? When his cat jumped onto the keyboard, I had to whicker behind my coffee mug or I’d burst out laughing.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I caught Maria glancing at you—pretty sure she almost lost it because of your face.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: It’s impossible to keep a straight expression with Greg and his little feline assistant running the show.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Next time, maybe we should all bring our pets and see whose takes over the meeting first.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: Deal—as long as yours doesn’t start critiquing my slides like Greg’s did.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: I barely made it through that yoga class—my mat slid out from under me right in the middle of downward dog.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: If I'd seen that, I probably would have tried not to whicker, but honestly, that's too good.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Hey, it wasn't my finest moment! Even the instructor had to pretend she didn't notice.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: You always keep things interesting, Sophie. The whole class was probably grateful for the entertainment.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: At least I gave everyone a story to tell. My dignity bounced away with the mat.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Remind me to set up a camera next time—I can't miss out on these legendary misadventures.

meaning: To utter a feeble, whining, broken cry, as a child about to burst into tears.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Looks like your brows are all furrowed again. Did something go sideways?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: My paper airplane got stuck in the tree, and I spent all recess trying to get it down.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Stubborn trees, always snagging the best planes. Did you try tossing anything else up there to knock it loose?

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: I threw my shoe, but now that's stuck too. Everyone laughed at me.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Oh Oliver, I can hear that little whimp escaping—don’t worry, we’ll get both back before dinner.

dialogue.speaker: Oliver
dialogue.text: You really think so? Even the plane? That would make everything better.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Something’s definitely up with Max—he’s curling into a little ball on the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: He’s been like that ever since his block tower tumbled down. I think he took it really hard.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Aww, did you hear that little whimp just now? My heart melts every time he gets like this.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Yeah, me too. Maybe he’d like a hand rebuilding his tower?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: That’s a good plan. Max, want to stack some blocks together?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: I'll grab the pieces—let's help him make the tallest one yet.

meaning: To utter a feeble, whining, broken cry, as a child about to burst into tears.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Hey, Ryan, are you okay? You look like you’ve had a tough day.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Yeah, I don’t know… everything just feels overwhelming right now.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I heard you let out a little whimper in class earlier. Do you want to talk about it?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: It’s just… I messed up on my presentation, and I felt everyone’s eyes on me. It was awful.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Aw, that sounds really tough. But I’m sure it wasn’t as bad as you think.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Thanks, Emily. It helps just to have someone listen.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You've barely touched your lunch. Something's weighing on you, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: "I just...can't seem to get anything right lately," Ryan manages, a soft whimper slipping out as his voice catches.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Oh, Ryan, you don't have to bottle that up. It's okay to let it out.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: It's like no matter how hard I try, it just keeps piling up.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You're not alone in this, you know. We can figure it out together.

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.text: Thanks, Emma. That actually helps more than you know.

meaning: To move with great force or impetus.
A word expressing a high-pitched ringing sound.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Did you catch that red frisbee Jay launched? It went whing straight over the pond and nearly knocked the soda out of my hand.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: No way! Jay’s throws always pack a punch, but that one was crazy.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: Seriously, you’d think he was a professional or something.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Imagine what he could do in an actual tournament. The competition wouldn’t stand a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: If we ever need to send a message across the park in record time, we know who to call.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: Just make sure you duck if you hear a whir overhead next time!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Out of nowhere, I was halfway across the parking lot and heard something slicing through the air behind me.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let me guess—a frisbee came whing right past your ear? Those things are like stealth missiles when people get too competitive.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Exactly! I barely ducked in time. It felt like it was aimed straight at my head.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No kidding, last summer I took one to the shoulder. Surprised I didn’t get a badge of honor from it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Maybe we should both stick to the benches when the frisbee crew is out.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Deal. I value my head too much to take another near miss!

meaning: Of a horse: To neigh, esp. in a low or gentle way.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Stepping into this barn always makes me feel like I’m part of some old countryside story.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely, there’s something magical about being surrounded by so many gentle horses.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Did you see the little bay mare near the fence earlier? She kept following me as I walked by.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, she's super friendly. Last week, I brought her a carrot and she wouldn't leave my side.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: What did she do when you gave her the carrot? Was she shy or did she come right up?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: She nudged my hand, took the carrot so delicately, and then gave this soft little whinny that made me laugh out loud.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: It's amazing how peaceful everything feels out here with the horses grazing.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: They really do bring a special calm, don’t they? I could spend hours just watching them.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: This one keeps coming over to the fence and nudging my hand; she seems so gentle.

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: She likes you already. That’s Rosie, she’s always curious about new faces.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Did you hear that soft little sound she made just now?

dialogue.speaker: Daniel
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was a whinny—she does that when she’s feeling content around people she trusts.

meaning: Of a horse: To neigh, esp. in a low or gentle way.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: You should've seen the sunset over the paddock yesterday—I stayed so late the horses nearly tucked me in.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: That sounds like a perfect evening! Did any of them come up to see you?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Daisy did. She followed me along the fence while I was heading back to the barn.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: She’s always curious. Did she do her usual nudge, or was she more relaxed this time?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: She leaned in close, gave a soft whrinny, and just waited there like she wanted a little more company.

dialogue.speaker: Lucas
dialogue.text: I swear Daisy has a way of making the quiet moments feel extra special out there.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: These stables always smell like fresh hay. I'm not sure if Buttercup even remembers me.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Watch her ears—she just perked up and gave a soft whrinny as soon as you walked in. I think you're unforgettable.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: She does look happy to see me. That makes me feel a lot better about coming back.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: It's like she’s been waiting for you all week. You two always had a special bond.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I hope she remembers all our old trails. Do you think she'd let me groom her today?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Absolutely. I’ll grab the brushes—you know she loves when you do her mane first.

meaning: A soft sibilant sound, as that of something moving rapidly through the air or over the surface of water.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: This river always draws me back. The water just begs for stone-skipping championships.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Championship accepted! My lucky flat stone is unbeatable today.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: Let’s see about that. Last time, you barely got three skips in a row.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Ouch, that’s fair. I’ll redeem myself right now.

dialogue.speaker: Eli
dialogue.text: I’ll keep score, but you’d better bring your A game.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Watch this—whish! That’s the sound of victory skipping across the water.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Check out how still the lake is right now. You know what this means—it’s perfect stone-skipping weather.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: I like your thinking. Bet I can get more skips than you this time.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Alright, you’re on. Let me find a good flat one... Ah, this should do.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That looks promising. Give it your best shot, Sam.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Here goes nothing! Watch how it glides—nice and low angle.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you hear that? Whish, whish, whish—it just danced right across the surface!

meaning: A slight blast or puff (of wind) or sprinkle (of rain).

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I can't believe how bright and warm it felt just fifteen minutes ago—look at us now, sleeves rolled down already.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Seriously! Those clouds moved in out of nowhere, and the whole park feels different now.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Did you just catch that sudden breeze, or am I imagining things?

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Nope, I felt it too—a little whisp brushed right past my face, and I thought I felt the tiniest bit of dampness as well.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Makes me wish I’d thrown an umbrella in my bag—even those little shifts can surprise you.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Let’s hang by that big oak for a bit, just in case this keeps up.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: The weather today is so strange, Mark. It looks sunny and then it suddenly gets all gloomy.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I know! I left my window open, and five minutes later, everything turned dark like it might rain.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Did you get caught in any showers though? I was debating going out for a quick walk.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: Not yet, but I’ve been checking outside every ten minutes just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: When I stepped out earlier, there was this sudden whisp that went right by my cheek—it was so chilly I just went right back in.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: That would have made me hesitate, too. I’ll probably wait for a real break in the weather before venturing out.

meaning: To make a sibilant sound of some kind.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: That kettle is taking its sweet time today, isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: I know, right? I’m hoping for tea before I finish these cookies.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Wait—there it goes! Hear that whiss? I think we’re close.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Finally! That sound means I’ll have my mug ready in a second.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Don’t forget the milk this time, or I’ll have to stage an intervention.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Deal! Pouring it in right now; crisis averted.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Jake, did you hear the kettle go whiss just now? The steam startled me!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: I did! That sound always means it’s almost tea time.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Perfect, I’ve already lined up our favorite mugs.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Awesome, I’ll grab the biscuits from the pantry.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Don’t forget the honey this time—I think it’ll pair nicely.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: You know me too well. This is going to be the coziest break!

meaning: To whisper, murmur.
A whistling sound, a whistle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Looks like someone’s deep in study mode over there—he hasn’t even turned a page.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: I know, right? He keeps fiddling with that envelope tucked inside the book. It’s odd.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Maybe it’s some top-secret library business. Should we pretend we don’t notice?

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Pretending is hard when it’s this mysterious. I almost expect him to suddenly dash out.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: Let’s keep our voices down and just—whist—see what happens next.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Alright, I’m on silent observer mode. This just got interesting.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: You always spot the rarest books, Alex. Managed to hunt down that poetry collection yet?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Not yet, Sophie. The shelves are like a maze, and Mrs. Bennett’s watching every aisle.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: She does have that stare, doesn’t she? Like she knows when someone’s about to sneeze.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Last week, someone dropped a pen and she appeared right behind them—spooky.

dialogue.speaker: Sophie
dialogue.text: By the way, have you caught wind of the odd chatter about the attic up there?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Come closer—whist—some say at midnight you can hear old typewriter keys clacking, like a ghostly librarian is still cataloging books.

meaning: Expressing a shrill abrupt sound, as a bird’s chirp, the whistling of a flying bullet, etc.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: There it is again, right above the rustle—did you catch that noise from the branches?

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Absolutely! That sharp 'whit!' always makes me look up. It must be that little gray bird darting around up there.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Your ears are like radar, Jake. I barely noticed before.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Years of birdwatching have trained me well. If we stand still, we might catch a glimpse.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: I wouldn’t mind staying here a little longer. This spot’s alive with surprises.

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.text: Nature always has something up its sleeve if you listen close enough.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: These old benches definitely have seen better days, but I love watching the park wake up in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Yeah, something about the sunlight through the branches makes even this cracked wood feel inviting.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Did you catch that? Something just zipped past us—super quick.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: That was sharp—whit!—almost right overhead. Must've been a little bird darting through the trees.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: I love moments like that; they make the city feel more alive somehow.

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.text: Absolutely. These quick flashes of nature keep things interesting, even on the most ordinary days.

meaning: A talkative person, a chatterer.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Of all the people in book club tonight, Rachel barely let anyone else get a sentence in.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: She must've had a lot on her mind about that mystery novel.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Actually, she barely even mentioned the book — it was all stories from her vacation and then somehow her cousin’s dog training fiasco.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That sounds just like my Uncle Joe at family dinners—he starts with one story and suddenly we’re learning about 1980s plumbing.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: I know, right? At some point, I just stopped trying to follow the thread.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: We definitely have a couple of prime whitters in our circle, that’s for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe the energy in the meeting today—my head's still spinning!

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No way, what happened to get you all worked up?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: There was this new intern who completely stole the spotlight.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: What did she do, bring fireworks or something?

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Close! She practically ran the conversation from start to finish, barely taking a breath.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Classic! Every team ends up with a whitter eventually. Keeps things interesting, I guess.

meaning: To make a sound as of a body rushing through the air.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Did you see the speed of that pitch? It looked almost impossible to catch.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Yeah! The ball went whiz right past the batter before he could even blink.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: Everyone in the stands gasped—nobody was expecting that.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: The pitcher must have been practicing nonstop to throw like that.

dialogue.speaker: Claire
dialogue.text: I wonder if he'll keep it up for the next few innings.

dialogue.speaker: Brian
dialogue.text: Let's keep watching; this game just got a lot more interesting!

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Did you catch that? Something just zipped past the porch lights.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: No way, I was fiddling with the grill. What did it look like?

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I only saw a blur—it vanished before I could even blink.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: Could've been a bat, or maybe even one of those model rockets the neighbors tinker with.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, all I really noticed was this sharp whiz as it flew right over our heads.

dialogue.speaker: James
dialogue.text: That’s wild—maybe whatever it was will make another lap so we can actually spot it this time.

meaning: To make a sound as of a body rushing through the air.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: This park always has a way of making me forget about deadlines.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Right? Fresh air and a little bit of chaos from the playground—perfect combo.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: Those kids with their paper airplanes are fearless. I swear one nearly crashed into my book.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Oh, that one just made a whizz right past my shoulder! They must be aiming for an airshow record.

dialogue.speaker: Emily
dialogue.text: If they keep this up, we might end up dodging more planes than pages.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Consider it a real-life obstacle course—with reading breaks.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: That tournament energy is wild—look at them dash across the field!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Seriously, someone just slid ten feet to grab that pass. No fear at all.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: Did you catch the leaping throw a second ago? That was nuts!

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: Absolutely! The way these guys throw, it’s like the disc has a mind of its own.

dialogue.speaker: Olivia
dialogue.text: And they can launch it sidearm from halfway across. Makes me want to train all summer.

dialogue.speaker: Ethan
dialogue.text: No kidding—I felt that last one slice by with a sharp whizz just inches from my ear!

meaning: A heavy, low sound.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: That wind is crazy! My window just rattled like it was about to jump right off.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: You’re telling me! The lights have flickered three times already—I’m keeping my flashlight close just in case.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: Wait, did you feel that? Something just shook the entire floor!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Seriously, I thought it was just the thunder at first, but that felt way closer.

dialogue.speaker: Ella
dialogue.text: It was like—whomp—and everything vibrated for a second. I really hope nothing crashed into the back door.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Let’s grab some shoes and take a look; with our luck tonight, it’s probably that old oak tree again.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: That made me jump out of my skin—did you feel the floor shake just now?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, my hands are still shaking. I thought maybe something hit the roof, but it felt closer.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: It was more than just a bang. There was this huge 'whomp' and everything rattled right after it.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe one of those old storage trunks tipped over in the attic again. I forgot how much stuff is up there.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: If that's what it was, I'm not keen on finding out alone. You coming with me?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No way I'm letting you go by yourself—just let me grab the flashlight, and we'll brave it together.

meaning: To make a snorting, gurgling, or snuffling sound.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: You missed it, Jack—Charlie just stretched out on his back and let out the loudest whoofle right in the middle of his nap.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: No way, he's still making those ridiculous sounds? I bet the neighbors heard it through the wall.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Honestly, sometimes I think he dreams about running wild and ends up snuffling and kicking all over the couch.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: If only recording his nap could win us some kind of comedy prize.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: I already have three videos—each one funnier than the last. It never gets old.

dialogue.speaker: Jack
dialogue.text: Next time I come over, those videos are at the top of our watch list, deal?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Listen to Max down there—he just let out a huge whoofle right when your coffee arrived.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Ha! Your dog has seriously perfect timing every time food or drinks show up.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: It's like he's got a sixth sense for snacks, I swear.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Or maybe he just wants a taste of that muffin you're hiding.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Trust me, he’s relentless—a real café regular at this point.

dialogue.speaker: Lucy
dialogue.text: Well, his whoofly interruptions make the coffee breaks way more entertaining.

meaning: To make a resonant booming or rushing sound.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: There it goes again—did you just feel your seat vibrate?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Yeah, those construction crews don’t mess around. I swear the equipment just keeps getting bigger.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Last week I saw them lifting a hunk of steel twice the size of my car.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: That must have sounded like the world ending if they dropped it.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Totally—it hit the ground and then came this giant whoom that rattled the windows all down the block.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Little wonder all the birds took off at once! Even my coffee nearly leapt out of the cup.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: That storm yesterday had my dog hiding under the table—I haven’t seen rain hit the pavement that hard in ages.

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! I swear the lights flickered every time the sky lit up.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: After that blinding flash, I counted three seconds before anything happened.

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: I braced myself every single time, but the thunder always caught me off guard.

dialogue.speaker: Jamie
dialogue.text: And then, whoom—the thunder rolled right overhead and rattled every window in the house.

dialogue.speaker: Leah
dialogue.text: Gives me chills just thinking about it. That was one wild night!

meaning: (Expressing) a sudden, violent rushing sound, as when a quantity of flammable material bursts into flame.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: These logs are stubborn—I swear they're resisting every spark I throw at them.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Try stacking some bark and dried leaves underneath, Ben. That’s how we got it going last summer, remember?

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Alright, let me wedge these leaves in. If this doesn’t work, we’re breaking out the marshmallows raw.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hold on—now watch... as soon as you light that spot, it’ll go whoompf if the wind doesn’t snatch the flame away.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Oh, wow! Did you see that blast? You totally called it.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Best seat in the house for a fire show—and s’mores up next!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Charcoal’s in, burgers are prepped—let’s fire this thing up and see if my grilling skills survive the weekend.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Whoa, did you see that? The second you sparked it—whoompf—the flames just leapt out of nowhere!

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: No kidding! That was a bit more dramatic than I expected.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: I honestly jumped back about two feet, not kidding.

dialogue.speaker: Ben
dialogue.text: Maybe I went a little heavy with the lighter fluid this time.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.text: Lesson learned—next time I’m keeping my eyebrows at a safe distance!

meaning: To utter or emit a dull soft sibilant sound, like that of something rushing through the air; to move rapidly with a rushing sound.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Look at those dark clouds rolling in—this is turning into quite the blustery afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: Josh
dialogue.text: Seriously, it feels like even the squirrels are hunkering down out there.

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Hold onto your umbrella—last time it nearly got ripped right out of my hands!

dialogue.speaker: Josh
